analyzed: rnam par dbye ba rnams kyang ste //

original: rtogs par dka' rnams yang dag dgrol //
analyzed: rtogs par dka' rnams yang dag dgrol //

original: @117b tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis ni dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan rgya cher bshad pa rnams nye bar bsdus te phyag mdzad pa dang / mdo sde'i rnam par bshad pa byed pa por mdzad de /
analyzed: @117b tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis ni dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan rgya cher bshad pa rnams nye bar bsdus te phyag mdzad pa dang / mdo sde'i rnam par bshad pa byed pa por mdzad de /
translated: These verses pay homage to the Buddha by summarizing the extensive praise of the qualities of the Three Jewels and by declaring him to be the author of the sutra explanations.

original: ji ltar 'byung ba dang gang mdzad pa rnams bstan bcos gzhan gyi gnas de rnams kun nas btus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'byung ba dang gang mdzad pa rnams bstan bcos gzhan gyi gnas de rnams kun nas btus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He teaches what has occurred and what he has done, because he has completely gathered all the topics of other treatises.

original: de la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung du bstan pa'i sde la sogs pa'i chos bstan pa kun la brten pa dang / slob dpon rang gis chos kyi de kho na nyid mngon par rtogs pa bzhin de'i stobs kyis de ma thag par bstod pa la rab tu zhugs te /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung du bstan pa'i sde la sogs pa'i chos bstan pa kun la brten pa dang / slob dpon rang gis chos kyi de kho na nyid mngon par rtogs pa bzhin de'i stobs kyis de ma thag par bstod pa la rab tu zhugs te /
translated: The Bhagavan Buddha, in all his teachings of the Dharma, such as the sutra collection, the songs, the declarations, and so on, relies on the power of his direct realization of the reality of the Dharma and immediately engages in praise.

original: de'i rnam pa 'dir bstan pas 'phags pa slob pa'i sde la gnas shing phyir mi ldog pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi gnas nyid kyi rgyu mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa 'dir bstan pas 'phags pa slob pa'i sde la gnas shing phyir mi ldog pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi gnas nyid kyi rgyu mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of the reality of the non-returner, which is the natural outcome of the stage of the noble one‚Äôs learning.

original: mdo sde'i rnam bshad mdzad pa dag gis bcom ldan 'das kyi che ba'i yon tan gyi chos gcig bstan na 'ang /
analyzed: mdo sde'i rnam bshad mdzad pa dag gis bcom ldan 'das kyi che ba'i yon tan gyi chos gcig bstan na 'ang /
translated: The author of the S≈´tra Explication of the Intention teaches one quality of the greatness of the Bhagavat,

original: blo chung ba rnams thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i rtogs pa la brten nas rjes su 'jug cing bstan bcos la spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo chung ba rnams thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i rtogs pa la brten nas rjes su 'jug cing bstan bcos la spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those of little intelligence enter into the treatise by way of the realizations of hearing, contemplation, and meditation.

original: de la dang po'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po de dag gis ni bcom ldan 'das yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi don drug yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: de la dang po'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po de dag gis ni bcom ldan 'das yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi don drug yongs su bstan te /
translated: In that regard, the first two verses teach the six topics of the Bhagavat, the perfect complete Buddha:

original: rang gi ngo bo dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / phrin las dang / sbyor ba dang / 'jug pa rnams so //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / phrin las dang / sbyor ba dang / 'jug pa rnams so //
translated: his essence, cause, effect, activity, endowment, and function.

original: de la re zhig / rtogs pa nges gnas dri med don //
analyzed: de la re zhig / rtogs pa nges gnas dri med don //
translated: In that regard, first, the two verses:üîΩThe Bhagavat is the one who has realized the stainless meaning,

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni rang gi ngo bo yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni rang gi ngo bo yongs su bstan te /
translated: This shows its essence,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi chos kyi sku rnam pa thams cad gnas pa la yongs su zhugs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩgang spyod rgya ma cho'i pha rol gshegs //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi chos kyi sku rnam pa thams cad gnas pa la yongs su zhugs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro // gang spyod rgya ma cho'i pha rol gshegs //
translated: because it is the characteristic of the Dharma Body of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, which is the entrance into the state of all excellences.

original: zhes pa 'dis ni rgyu'i don te /
analyzed: zhes pa 'dis ni rgyu'i don te /
translated: The line, ‚ÄúHe has gone to the other shore of the practice of the perfections‚Äù shows its causal significance,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bcu'i spyod pa rnam pa thams cad pa mtha' yas pa dus bskal ba grangs med par yongs su goms pa'i rgyus nges par 'byung pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bcu'i spyod pa rnam pa thams cad pa mtha' yas pa dus bskal ba grangs med par yongs su goms pa'i rgyus nges par 'byung pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of the emergence of the Dharma Body, since it is the cause of the emergence of the Dharma Body, since it is the cause of the attainment of the Dharma Body through the practice of the perfections, such as generosity, for three countless eons.

original: chos kun dbang phyug ces pa 'dis ni 'bras bu'i don te /
analyzed: chos kun dbang phyug ces pa 'dis ni 'bras bu'i don te /
translated: The line, ‚ÄúHe is the lord of all Dharmas‚Äù shows its significance as the result,üîΩbecause it is the result of the purification of the Buddha qualities, such as the powers, the fearlessnesses, and the special qualities of the Buddha.

original: nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa mtha' yas pa bcom pa'i phyir dang yon tan bla na med par gyur pa'i rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu thob pa na chos kun la dbang sgyur ba'i @118a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa mtha' yas pa bcom pa'i phyir dang yon tan bla na med par gyur pa'i rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu thob pa na chos kun la dbang sgyur ba'i @118a * //
translated: Because of the destruction of the infinite afflictions and the infinite objective obscurations together with their instincts, and because of the attainment of the result of perfect enlightenment, which is the unexcelled state of excellence, one has power over all things.üîΩInconceivable

original: phyir ro // bsam mi khyab /
analyzed: phyir ro // bsam mi khyab /
translated: Because it is inconceivable.üîΩüîΩ

original: 'dul ba'i thabs kyis 'dren pa can //
analyzed: 'dul ba'i thabs kyis 'dren pa can //
translated: and endowed with the means of guiding those to be trained.

original: zhes pa 'dis ni phrin las kyi don te /
analyzed: zhes pa 'dis ni phrin las kyi don te /
translated: This shows the meaning of activity.

original: kun shes pas 'das pa'i yul kun brjod pa dang / rdzu 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul la sogs pa dpag tu med pa 'dul ba'i thabs kyis btul te /
analyzed: kun shes pas 'das pa'i yul kun brjod pa dang / rdzu 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul la sogs pa dpag tu med pa 'dul ba'i thabs kyis btul te /
translated: By means of the infinite means of guiding those to be trained, such as the superknowledges, the miracles, and the instructions, one guides those to be trained,

original: sems can gyi sems kyi khams yongs su dag par 'dul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi sems kyi khams yongs su dag par 'dul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one purifies the mental element of sentient beings.üîΩThe qualities of the inconceivable transformation

original: gzhal med legs gyur yon tan ni //
analyzed: gzhal med legs gyur yon tan ni //
translated: The qualities of the celestial palace areüîΩ

original: zhes pa 'dis ni sbyor ba'i don te /
analyzed: zhes pa 'dis ni sbyor ba'i don te /
translated: This shows the meaning of application.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa las shin tu 'das pa yongs su phan pa'i rnam pa ma lus pas dka' ba spyod pa'i nges par 'byung ba dang / bla na med pa'i snying rje chen po dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i chos dkon mchog la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa las shin tu 'das pa yongs su phan pa'i rnam pa ma lus pas dka' ba spyod pa'i nges par 'byung ba dang / bla na med pa'i snying rje chen po dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i chos dkon mchog la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the emergence of the bodhisattva's career, which is beyond imagination and discernment, and which is the means of attaining the jewel of the Dharma, the supreme compassion, the powers, the fearlessnesses, etc.

original: rang dang gzhan don gnyis la brten //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan don gnyis la brten //
translated: It is based on the two aims, one's own and others'.

original: zhes pa 'dis ni 'jug pa'i don te /üîΩrang dang gzhan gyi don gnyis la gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / sprul pa'i sku dang / ngo bo nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnams ji ltar rigs par rang don gtso che ba la brten pa dang /
analyzed: zhes pa 'dis ni 'jug pa'i don te / rang dang gzhan gyi don gnyis la gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / sprul pa'i sku dang / ngo bo nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnams ji ltar rigs par rang don gtso che ba la brten pa dang /
translated: This verse shows the meaning of engagement.üîΩThe Dharma Body is based on the two aims, one's own and others', because it has the character of the support for both. The Enjoyment Body and the Transformation Body are based on the aim of others, because they are the means of attaining the aim of others.

original: mtha' yas pa'i gzhan don gtso che ba nyid la brten pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' yas pa'i gzhan don gtso che ba nyid la brten pa'o //
translated: The Essence Body is based on the aim of oneself, because it is the support for the supremacy of one's own aim.

original: brten zhes pa ni sku ston zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: brten zhes pa ni sku ston zhes pa'i don te /
translated: The word based means to manifest.

original: gnyis la brten zhes pa ni gtso cher spyad par bya ba ste /
analyzed: gnyis la brten zhes pa ni gtso cher spyad par bya ba ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbased on two‚Äù refers to the principal activities.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi rang don gtso che ba ste /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi rang don gtso che ba ste /
translated: The enjoyment body is the principal benefit for buddhas themselves,

original: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor chen po rnams su nges yongs su dgyes par zab mo'i chos kyi longs spyod so sor rjes su myong ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor chen po rnams su nges yongs su dgyes par zab mo'i chos kyi longs spyod so sor rjes su myong ba'i phyir ro /
translated: because in the great ma·πá·∏çalas of the retinue, they individually experience the enjoyment of the profound Dharma with great delight.

original: gzhan don gtso che ba des phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du so so ji lta bar rang nyid bzo'i las la sogs pa'i sprul pa rnams kyis sems can gyi bya ba kun bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan don gtso che ba des phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du so so ji lta bar rang nyid bzo'i las la sogs pa'i sprul pa rnams kyis sems can gyi bya ba kun bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The emanation body is the principal benefit for others, because in all the worlds of the ten directions, emanations such as artists and so on accomplish all the activities of sentient beings in accordance with each of them.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi sku de bzhin gshegs pa kun dang thun mong ba shin tu phra ba'i sgrib pa thams cad de bzhin nyid kyi gnas su yongs su sgyur ba'i mtshan nyid chos kyi sku rang don gtso che ba ma thob pa thob par byed pa zhes bya
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi sku de bzhin gshegs pa kun dang thun mong ba shin tu phra ba'i sgrib pa thams cad de bzhin nyid kyi gnas su yongs su sgyur ba'i mtshan nyid chos kyi sku rang don gtso che ba ma thob pa thob par byed pa zhes bya
translated: The essential body is the attainment of the dharmakƒÅya, which is the principal benefit for oneself, the transformation of all subtle obscurations into the state of suchness, which is shared with all tathƒÅgatas.

original: ba la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i dbye ba rnam pa gsum la 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: ba la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i dbye ba rnam pa gsum la 'jug par byed do //
translated: He causes them to enter into the three kinds of bodies of the Tathagata, the Dharma Body, Enjoyment Body, and Transformation Body.

original: bstod pa 'di nyid kyis chos dang / dge 'dun gyi yon tan kyang bshad par rigs par bya ste /
analyzed: bstod pa 'di nyid kyis chos dang / dge 'dun gyi yon tan kyang bshad par rigs par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that the qualities of the Dharma and the Sangha are also explained by this very praise.

original: rang gi ngo bo dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu'i @118b don bzung nas chos dkon mchog gi'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu'i @118b don bzung nas chos dkon mchog gi'o //
translated: The qualities of the Jewel of the Dharma are to be understood in terms of its own nature, cause, and result.

original: de slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i nges par 'byung ba'i phyir dge 'dun dkon mchog gi'o //
analyzed: de slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i nges par 'byung ba'i phyir dge 'dun dkon mchog gi'o //
translated: The qualities of the Jewel of the Sangha are to be understood in terms of the going forth of those in training and those beyond training.

original: slob ma rnams kyis rtogs sla ba'i don du bstan bcos kyi lus rnam par gzhag pa'ang mdzad de /
analyzed: slob ma rnams kyis rtogs sla ba'i don du bstan bcos kyi lus rnam par gzhag pa'ang mdzad de /
translated: In order to make it easy for his disciples to understand, he also sets forth the body of the treatise.üîΩHow many kinds of appropriation are there and why?

original: du dang ci'i phyir nyer len rnams //üîΩmtshan nyid de yi gnas rnams te //
analyzed: du dang ci'i phyir nyer len rnams // mtshan nyid de yi gnas rnams te //

analyzed: go rims don dang dper dbye dang // bsdus pa la sogs bzhi po ni // bsdus pas sbyor dang ldan de nyid //

original: rnam par nges pa'i dbye ba ste //
analyzed: rnam par nges pa'i dbye ba ste //
translated: The analysis of the ascertainment of the meaning.

original: kun nas btus pa'i spyi sdom mo //
analyzed: kun nas btus pa'i spyi sdom mo //
translated: This is the general summary of the compendium.

original: ci'i phyir bstan bcos 'di brtsams she na //üîΩphung po la sogs pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bstan bcos 'di brtsams she na // phung po la sogs pa las brtsams te /
translated: Why was this treatise composed?üîΩIt was composed in order to make one skilled in the topics to be reflected upon, such as the aggregates, etc.,

original: du dang ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsam pa'i gnas rnams la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir brtsams so //
analyzed: du dang ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsam pa'i gnas rnams la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir brtsams so //
translated: in terms of how many there are, their purpose, etc.

original: 'di ltar mkhas pa 'dis ni phan yon rnam pa gnyis thob ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar mkhas pa 'dis ni phan yon rnam pa gnyis thob ste /
translated: Thus, through this skill, one obtains two benefits:

original: yid la byed pa'i phan yon dang / yang dag pa'i gtam gtan la 'bebs pa'i phan yon no //
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i phan yon dang / yang dag pa'i gtam gtan la 'bebs pa'i phan yon no //
translated: the benefit of mental attention and the benefit of establishing true discourse.

original: de la yid la byed pa'i phan yon ni /
analyzed: de la yid la byed pa'i phan yon ni /
translated: The benefit of mental attention

original: zhi gnas kyi rjes su mthun pa dang / lhag mthong 'phel ba'i rjes su mthun par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi rjes su mthun pa dang / lhag mthong 'phel ba'i rjes su mthun par rig par bya'o //
translated: should be understood as conducive to serenity and conducive to the increase of insight.

original: zhi gnas kyi rjes su mthun pa ni /üîΩgnas 'di dag la'ang mkhas par byas pa na /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi rjes su mthun pa ni /üîΩgnas 'di dag la'ang mkhas par byas pa na /
translated: The benefit of mental attention that is conducive to serenityüîΩis the mental attention that is conducive to the stilling of the flux of discursive thought.üîΩThe benefit of mental attention that is conducive to the increase of insightüîΩis the mental attention that is conducive to the discernment of complete taking of the aggregates, etc.üîΩThe benefit of establishing true discourseüîΩis the establishment of the true discourse of the aggregates, etc.,

original: the tshom med pas ji ltar dmigs pa la sems rtse gcig pa'i tshul gyis bde bar sems mnyam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: the tshom med pas ji ltar dmigs pa la sems rtse gcig pa'i tshul gyis bde bar sems mnyam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the absence of doubt, the mind is well-placed in equipoise, in the manner of one-pointedness of mind with regard to the object of meditation.

original: lhag mthong 'phel ba'i rjes su mthun pa ni /üîΩrnam pa mang por shes bya yongs su brtags pas /
analyzed: lhag mthong 'phel ba'i rjes su mthun pa ni / rnam pa mang por shes bya yongs su brtags pas /
translated: The benefit of the increase of insight isüîΩthe increase of wisdom,

original: shes rab khyad zhugs par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab khyad zhugs par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the thorough investigation of the many aspects of objects of knowledge.

original: yang dag pa'i gtam gtan la 'bebs pa'i phan yon ni /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i gtam gtan la 'bebs pa'i phan yon ni /
translated: The benefit of the ascertainment of correct speech is

original: gnas 'di dag la mkhas pas 'dri ba thams cad lung ston pa'i mthu dang ldan pas mi 'jigs pa thob par blta'o //üîΩphung po rnams ni du /
analyzed: gnas 'di dag la mkhas pas 'dri ba thams cad lung ston pa'i mthu dang ldan pas mi 'jigs pa thob par blta'o // phung po rnams ni du /
translated: the attainment of fearlessness, because of the ability to answer all questions through skill in these topics.üîΩHow many are the aggregates?

original: khams rnams ni du /üîΩskye mched rnams ni du /
analyzed: khams rnams ni du / skye mched rnams ni du /
translated: How many are the elements?üîΩHow many are the sense bases?

original: phung po rnams ni lnga ste /
analyzed: phung po rnams ni lnga ste /
translated: There are five aggregates:

original: gzugs kyi phung po dang / tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po dang / tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
translated: the form aggregate, the feeling aggregate, the perception aggregate, the formation aggregate, and the consciousness aggregate.

original: khams rnams ni bco brgyad de /
analyzed: khams rnams ni bco brgyad de /
translated: There are eighteen elements:

original: mig gi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / rna ba'i khams dang / sgra'i khams dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes @119a * //
analyzed: mig gi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / rna ba'i khams dang / sgra'i khams dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes @119a * //
translated: the ear constituent, the sound constituent, and the ear-consciousness constituent;üîΩthe nose constituent, the smell constituent, and the nose-consciousness constituent;üîΩthe tongue constituent, the taste constituent, and the tongue-consciousness constituent;

original: pa'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lce'i khams dang / ro'i khams dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lus kyi khams dang / reg bya'i khams dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang /
analyzed: pa'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lce'i khams dang / ro'i khams dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lus kyi khams dang / reg bya'i khams dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang /
translated: the body constituent, the tangible-object constituent, and the body-consciousness constituent;

original: yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams so //
analyzed: yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams so //
translated: and the thinking-mind constituent, the dharma constituent, and the thinking-mind-consciousness constituent.

original: skye mched rnams ni bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: skye mched rnams ni bcu gnyis te /
translated: The sense bases are twelve:

original: mig gi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi skye mched dang / rna ba'i skye mched dang / sgra'i skye mched dang / sna'i skye mched dang / dri'i skye mched dang / lce'i skye mched dang ; ro'i skye mched dang / lus kyi skye mched dang /
analyzed: mig gi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi skye mched dang / rna ba'i skye mched dang / sgra'i skye mched dang / sna'i skye mched dang / dri'i skye mched dang / lce'i skye mched dang ; ro'i skye mched dang / lus kyi skye mched dang /
translated: the eye sense-sphere, the form sense-sphere, the ear sense-sphere, the sound sense-sphere, the nose sense-sphere, the smell sense-sphere, the tongue sense-sphere, the taste sense-sphere, the body sense-sphere,

original: reg bya'i skye mched dang / yid kyi skye mched dang / yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: reg bya'i skye mched dang / yid kyi skye mched dang / yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched do //
translated: the tangible sense-sphere, the mental sense-sphere, and the entity sense-sphere.

original: ci'i phyir phung po rnam pa lnga kho na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir phung po rnam pa lnga kho na /
translated: Why are there only five aggregates?

original: bdag gi dngos po rnam pa lnga 'byung ba nye bar len pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po rnam pa lnga 'byung ba nye bar len pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the five kinds of self-existence are appropriated.

original: bdag gi dngos po lus yongs su gzung ba dang bcas pa 'byung ba nye bar len pa'i phyir dang / bdag gi dngos po nye bar longs spyod pa 'byung ba nye bar len pa'i phyir dang / bdag gi dngos po tha snyad 'byung ba nye bar len pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po lus yongs su gzung ba dang bcas pa 'byung ba nye bar len pa'i phyir dang / bdag gi dngos po nye bar longs spyod pa 'byung ba nye bar len pa'i phyir dang / bdag gi dngos po tha snyad 'byung ba nye bar len pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Because the arising of the self-existence of the body with its appropriation is appropriated, because the arising of the self-existence of the enjoyment of the body is appropriated, because the arising of the self-existence of the designation of the body is appropriated,üîΩand because the arising of the self-existence of the view of the body is appropriated.

original: bdag gi dngos po chos dang chos ma yin par 'byung ba nye bar len pa'i phyir dang / bdag gi dngos po de rnams kyi rten 'byung ba nye bar len pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbdag gi dngos po rnam pa lnga 'byung ba nye bar len pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba 'di la rnam pa bzhi ni bdag gi gnas yin pas bdag gi dngos po'o //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po chos dang chos ma yin par 'byung ba nye bar len pa'i phyir dang / bdag gi dngos po de rnams kyi rten 'byung ba nye bar len pa'i phyir ro // bdag gi dngos po rnam pa lnga 'byung ba nye bar len pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba 'di la rnam pa bzhi ni bdag gi gnas yin pas bdag gi dngos po'o //
translated: because the self appropriates the entities that are Dharma and non-Dharma, and because the self appropriates the elements that are the support of those entities.üîΩThe self appropriates the five kinds of entities that are the self because the first four are the self‚Äôs abode and the fifth is the self‚Äôs characteristic.

original: lnga pa ni bdag gi mtshan nyid kho na ste /
analyzed: lnga pa ni bdag gi mtshan nyid kho na ste /
translated: The self is the support of those entities.

original: rten yin pas bdag gi dngos por rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rten yin pas bdag gi dngos por rig par bya'o //
translated: The self is known as the entity that is the support of those entities.

original: lus yongs su gzung ba dang bcas pas ni phyi dang nang gi gzugs kyi phung po bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lus yongs su gzung ba dang bcas pas ni phyi dang nang gi gzugs kyi phung po bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: The body is known as the appropriation of the self because it includes the internal and external aggregates of form.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa ni nye bar longs spyod pa la sogs pa nyid de /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa ni nye bar longs spyod pa la sogs pa nyid de /
translated: Feeling, etc., are the self‚Äôs enjoyment, etc.,

original: de dag gi mtshan nyid ston par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan nyid ston par shes par bya'o //
translated: and their characteristics should be understood as they are described.

original: de dag gi rten ni bdag gi dngos po rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi rten ni bdag gi dngos po rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The self‚Äôs consciousness is the support of those entities.

original: lus yongs su gzung ba dang bcas pa la sogs pa de dag gi rten ni de dag gi mtshan nyid de dngos po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lus yongs su gzung ba dang bcas pa la sogs pa de dag gi rten ni de dag gi mtshan nyid de dngos po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The basis of those, i.e., the body, etc., is their characteristic, and is called the thing.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na phal ches rnam par shes pa la ni bdag tu 'dzin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na phal ches rnam par shes pa la ni bdag tu 'dzin la /
translated: Thus, in the world, consciousness is generally held to be the self,

original: lhag ma rnams la ni bdag gir 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams la ni bdag gir 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the remaining aggregates are held to be what belongs to the self.

original: ci'i phyir khams rnams @119b bco brgyad kho na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir khams rnams @119b bco brgyad kho na /
translated: Why are there only eighteen elements?

original: lus dang yongs su gzung ba rnams kyis 'das pa dang / da ltar gyi nye bar spyod pa rnam pa drug 'dzin pa nye bar len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang yongs su gzung ba rnams kyis 'das pa dang / da ltar gyi nye bar spyod pa rnam pa drug 'dzin pa nye bar len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the six kinds of past and present experience are appropriated by the body and the things that are grasped.

original: lus dang yongs su gzung ba dag gis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lus dang yongs su gzung ba dag gis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The body and the things that are grasped are

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po drug gis dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i yul drug gis so //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po drug gis dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i yul drug gis so //
translated: the six sense faculties, such as the eye, etc., and the six sense objects, such as form, etc.

original: 'das pa dang da ltar gyi nye bar spyod pa rnam pa drug ni rnam par shes pa drug ste /
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar gyi nye bar spyod pa rnam pa drug ni rnam par shes pa drug ste /
translated: The six kinds of past and present experience are the six consciousnesses.

original: de 'dzin pa ni rten dang dmigs pa'i dngos por 'dzin to //
analyzed: de 'dzin pa ni rten dang dmigs pa'i dngos por 'dzin to //
translated: The appropriation of these is the grasping of the basis and the object.

original: dbang po dang yul rnams te /
analyzed: dbang po dang yul rnams te /
translated: The faculties and the objects.üîΩüîΩ

original: bcu gnyis ni de ltar de 'dzin pa'i phyir khams nyid do //
analyzed: bcu gnyis ni de ltar de 'dzin pa'i phyir khams nyid do //
translated: The faculties and the objects are the twelve.üîΩThey are called elements because they hold the self and the enjoyer.

original: rnam par shes pa rnams ni yang nye bar longs spyod pa'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir khams nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnams ni yang nye bar longs spyod pa'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir khams nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The consciousnesses are called elements because they hold the characteristics of the enjoyer.

original: ji ltar 'das pa dang ltar byung ba'i dmigs pa la sogs pa nye bar longs spyod pa'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa can ni ma 'ongs pa nyid do //
analyzed: ji ltar 'das pa dang ltar byung ba'i dmigs pa la sogs pa nye bar longs spyod pa'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa can ni ma 'ongs pa nyid do //
translated: The future is that which holds the characteristics of the enjoyer in regard to the object of past and present consciousnesses.

original: ci'i phyir skye mched rnams bcu gnyis kho na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir skye mched rnams bcu gnyis kho na /
translated: Why are the bases only twelve?

original: lus dang yongs su gzung ba gnyis nyid kyis ma 'ongs pa'i nyer spyod rnam pa drug gi sgo nye bar len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang yongs su gzung ba gnyis nyid kyis ma 'ongs pa'i nyer spyod rnam pa drug gi sgo nye bar len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the two, body and enjoyer, are the doors of the six kinds of future enjoyments.

original: skye ba'i sgo tsam yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba'i sgo tsam yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are merely the doors of birth.

original: dbang po dang don tsam gzung bas skye mched bcu gnyis kho na rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: dbang po dang don tsam gzung bas skye mched bcu gnyis kho na rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: The bases are established as only twelve because they merely hold the faculties and objects.

original: nye bar longs spyod pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par shes pa drug gi skye mched ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar longs spyod pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par shes pa drug gi skye mched ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the six sense-spheres, which have the characteristic of the experience of the object, do not exist.

original: ci'i phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams zhes brjod /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams zhes brjod /
translated: Why are they called the appropriating aggregates?

original: nye bar len par sbyor bas des na nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams zhes brjod do //
analyzed: nye bar len par sbyor bas des na nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams zhes brjod do //
translated: Because they are connected with the appropriating, they are called the appropriating aggregates.

original: nye bar len pa'i rnam pa gang 'dir 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags nyid nye bar len pa ste /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i rnam pa gang 'dir 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags nyid nye bar len pa ste /
translated: The appropriating is the desire and passion for the aggregates.

original: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi phung po mngon par 'grub pa dang / yongs su mi gtong bar nye bar len pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi phung po mngon par 'grub pa dang / yongs su mi gtong bar nye bar len pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they appropriate the non-abandonment of the future and present aggregates,

original: ma 'ongs pa la 'dod pa dang da ltar la lhag par chags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa la 'dod pa dang da ltar la lhag par chags pa'i phyir /
translated: because of the desire for the future and the attachment to the present.

original: nye bar len pa ni 'dun pa dang 'dod chags te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa ni 'dun pa dang 'dod chags te /
translated: The appropriating is the desire and passion for the aggregates.

original: de la 'dun pa ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dun pa ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: Desire is the desire for the future body.

original: 'dod chags ni lhag par chags pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni lhag par chags pa'o //
translated: Attachment is the attachment to the present body.

original: 'dun pas ni ma 'ongs pa'i lus 'dod pa'i sgo nas len te /
analyzed: 'dun pas ni ma 'ongs pa'i lus 'dod pa'i sgo nas len te /
translated: Through desire one appropriates the future body.

original: des ma 'ongs pa'i phung po rnams mngon par 'grub bo //
analyzed: des ma 'ongs pa'i phung po rnams mngon par 'grub bo //
translated: It is the cause of the future aggregates.

original: 'dod chags kyis ni da ltar gyi lus la lhag par chags pa'i sgo nas len te /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyis ni da ltar gyi lus la lhag par chags pa'i sgo nas len te /
translated: Desire is the cause of appropriation in the present life, because one appropriates the present body through attachment to it.

original: des na lta ba'i phung po rnams yongs su mi btod do //
analyzed: des na lta ba'i phung po rnams yongs su mi btod do //
translated: Therefore, one does not abandon the aggregates of views.

original: de bas na de gnyi ga la nye bar len pa zhes brjod par bya'o //üîΩrgyu gang @120a * //
analyzed: de bas na de gnyi ga la nye bar len pa zhes brjod par bya'o // rgyu gang @120a * //
translated: Therefore, both of these are called appropriation.

original: gis khams dang skye mched rnams nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i chos zhes brjod /
analyzed: gis khams dang skye mched rnams nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i chos zhes brjod /
translated: What is the cause of the appropriation of the elements and sense bases?

original: de la phung po ltar bshad do zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa dang ldan pa rnams te /
analyzed: de la phung po ltar bshad do zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa dang ldan pa rnams te /
translated: The aggregates are explained as they are.

original: de'i phyir nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams zhes rig par bya'o //üîΩgzugs rnams kyi phung po'i mtshan nyid rnams gang gzugs kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis kyi tshul te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams zhes rig par bya'o // gzugs rnams kyi phung po'i mtshan nyid rnams gang gzugs kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis kyi tshul te /
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the appropriated phenomena are the aggregates.üîΩThe characteristics of the aggregates of form are the characteristics of form.

original: reg pas gzugs dang yul spyad pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: reg pas gzugs dang yul spyad pa'i gzugs so //
translated: There are two types of characteristics of form: form that is touched and form that is experienced as an object.

original: reg pa gzugs gang lags pas kun du reg na reg pa gzugs te /
analyzed: reg pa gzugs gang lags pas kun du reg na reg pa gzugs te /
translated: Form that is touched is form that is touched by contact.

original: bong bas kun du reg pa'am /üîΩdbyig pas kun du reg pa'am /
analyzed: bong bas kun du reg pa'am / dbyig pas kun du reg pa'am /
translated: or by a stick,

original: mtshon chas kun du reg pa 'am /
analyzed: mtshon chas kun du reg pa 'am /
translated: or by a weapon,

original: grang ba 'am /
analyzed: grang ba 'am /
translated: or by cold,

original: tsha ba 'am /üîΩbkres pa 'am /
analyzed: tsha ba 'am / bkres pa 'am /
translated: or by heat,üîΩor by hunger,

original: skom pa 'am /üîΩsprang bu 'am /
analyzed: skom pa 'am / sprang bu 'am /
translated: or by thirst,üîΩor by gadflies,

original: sha sbrang ngam /
analyzed: sha sbrang ngam /
translated: or by mosquitoes,üîΩor by wind,

original: rlung ngam / gdung ba 'am /üîΩsdig sbrul gyis kun du reg pa reg na gzugs so //
analyzed: rlung ngam / gdung ba 'am / sdig sbrul gyis kun du reg pa reg na gzugs so //
translated: or by the burning sun,üîΩor by snakes.üîΩWhen there is contact with the tangible, there is a change in the body.

original: reg pas gzugs ni gzugs rnams la reg na dngos po gzhan du 'gyur bar rig par bya'o /üîΩyul dpyad pa gang gang yul 'di dang 'di'o //
analyzed: reg pas gzugs ni gzugs rnams la reg na dngos po gzhan du 'gyur bar rig par bya'o / yul dpyad pa gang gang yul 'di dang 'di'o //
translated: When there is contact with visible form, there is a change in the mind.üîΩThe analysis of the object:

original: gzugs 'di nyid dang 'di lta bu zhes mnyam par bzhag pa 'am /
analyzed: gzugs 'di nyid dang 'di lta bu zhes mnyam par bzhag pa 'am /
translated: ‚ÄúThis is the object, this is the object.‚Äù

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i yid rtog pa dang ldan pas sna tshogs su byed pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i yid rtog pa dang ldan pas sna tshogs su byed pa'o //
translated: The mind, whether concentrated or not, is diversified by the various thoughts.

original: gang yul la zhes bya ba ni mngon du gyur pa'i phyogs la'o //üîΩ'di dang 'di'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang yul la zhes bya ba ni mngon du gyur pa'i phyogs la'o // 'di dang 'di'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe object‚Äù refers to the present object.

original: keng rus kyi rigs la sogs pa shes bya'i dngos po dang 'dra ba'i gzugs brnyan no //
analyzed: keng rus kyi rigs la sogs pa shes bya'i dngos po dang 'dra ba'i gzugs brnyan no //
translated: ‚ÄúThis is the object, this is the object‚Äù refers to the image of the object of knowledge, such as a skeleton, etc.

original: 'di nyid dang 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bye brag go //
analyzed: 'di nyid dang 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bye brag go //
translated: This and like this refer to the particularities of color and shape.

original: sna tshogs su byed ces bya ba ni de ltar 'du shes so //
analyzed: sna tshogs su byed ces bya ba ni de ltar 'du shes so //
translated: To make manifold means to perceive in that way.

original: tshor ba rnams kyi mtshan nyid rnams gang /
analyzed: tshor ba rnams kyi mtshan nyid rnams gang /
translated: What are the characteristics of the feelings?

original: rjes su myong ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: rjes su myong ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The characteristic of experience.

original: gang rjes su myong ba'i ngo bo sa dge ba 'am /
analyzed: gang rjes su myong ba'i ngo bo sa dge ba 'am /
translated: The experience of the essence of what is virtuous or non-virtuous.

original: mi dge ba rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu so so'i rjes su myong ba'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu so so'i rjes su myong ba'o //
translated: The experience of the individual results of the evolution of actions.

original: las dge ba rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa ni bde ba rjes su myong ba'o //
analyzed: las dge ba rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa ni bde ba rjes su myong ba'o //
translated: The experience of pleasure is the evolution of virtuous actions.

original: las mi dge ba rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa ni sdug bsngal rjes su myong ba'o //
analyzed: las mi dge ba rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa ni sdug bsngal rjes su myong ba'o //
translated: The experience of pain is the evolution of non-virtuous actions.

original: gnyis ka'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pas sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa rjes su myong ba ste /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pas sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa rjes su myong ba ste /
translated: The experience of neither pleasure nor pain is the evolution of both.

original: 'di ltar dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams kyi rnam par smin pa len pa'i rnam par shes pa ni rtag tu btang snyoms nyid dang mtshungs pa ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams kyi rnam par smin pa len pa'i rnam par shes pa ni rtag tu btang snyoms nyid dang mtshungs pa ldan pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the consciousness that appropriates the maturation of the virtuous and nonvirtuous actions is always associated with equanimity alone.

original: btang snyoms de nyid rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms de nyid rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: That very equanimity is the maturation.

original: bde @120b ba dang sdug bsngal ba ni rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bde @120b ba dang sdug bsngal ba ni rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Since pleasure and pain arise from maturation,

original: rnam par smin pa zhes nye bar btags so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa zhes nye bar btags so //
translated: they are figuratively called maturation.

original: 'du shes kyi mtshan nyid rnams gang rab tu shes pas mtshan nyid de /üîΩmtshan mar 'dzin pa'am /üîΩbkra bar byed pa'i ngo bos gang ji ltar mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / zhen pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i don rnams kyi tha snyad do //
analyzed: 'du shes kyi mtshan nyid rnams gang rab tu shes pas mtshan nyid de / mtshan mar 'dzin pa'am / bkra bar byed pa'i ngo bos gang ji ltar mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / zhen pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i don rnams kyi tha snyad do //
translated: The characteristic of ideation is the characteristic by which one knows.üîΩIt is the apprehension of signs or the essence that creates diversity.üîΩIt is the conventional expression for the objects that are seen, heard, discriminated, and cognized, just as they are.

original: mthong ba dang thos pa dang / zhen pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i don rnams la zhes bya ba la mthong pa la ni gang mig gis myong ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba dang thos pa dang / zhen pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i don rnams la zhes bya ba la mthong pa la ni gang mig gis myong ba'o //
translated: As for the objects that are seen, heard, discriminated, and cognized, seeing is that which is experienced by the eye.

original: thos pa ni gang rna bas myong ba'o zhes pa ni gang 'di lta bu dang 'di lta bur 'gyur ro zhes bdag nyid kyis mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa ni gang rna bas myong ba'o zhes pa ni gang 'di lta bu dang 'di lta bur 'gyur ro zhes bdag nyid kyis mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: Hearing is that which is experienced by the ear. This is the direct realization of the self in the form of ‚Äúthis is so and so‚Äù.

original: rnam par shes pa ni gang so so rang gis myong ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni gang so so rang gis myong ba'o //
translated: Consciousness is that which is experienced by each one for himself.

original: tha snyad 'dogs pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par brjod pa rnams kyis go bar byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tha snyad 'dogs pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par brjod pa rnams kyis go bar byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Designation is that which is understood by means of verbal expressions.

original: 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid rnams gang /üîΩmngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid rnams te /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid rnams gang / mngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid rnams te /
translated: What are the characteristics of the formations?

original: gang sems kyi mngon par 'du byed pa'i ngo bos dge ba 'am /üîΩmi dge ba 'am /üîΩlung du ma byas pa 'am /
analyzed: gang sems kyi mngon par 'du byed pa'i ngo bos dge ba 'am / mi dge ba 'am / lung du ma byas pa 'am /
translated: The characteristics of the formations are the characteristics of the formative forces.

original: gnas skabs sna tshogs rnams su sems 'jug go //
analyzed: gnas skabs sna tshogs rnams su sems 'jug go //
translated: The mind is engaged in various situations by the nature of its formative forces.

original: gnas skabs sna tshogs rnams su ni bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs rnams su'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs sna tshogs rnams su ni bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs rnams su'o //
translated: In various situations means in situations of pleasure, etc.

original: rnam par shes pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid rnams gang /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid rnams gang /
translated: What are the characteristics of the consciousnesses?

original: rnam par shes pas mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pas mtshan nyid de /
translated: The characteristics of consciousness are the characteristics of the aggregates of consciousness.

original: gang rnam par shes pa'i ngo bos gzugs rnams kyang rnam par shes pa dang / sgra rnams dang / dri rnams dang / ro rnams dang / reg bya rnams dang / chos rnams kyang rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang rnam par shes pa'i ngo bos gzugs rnams kyang rnam par shes pa dang / sgra rnams dang / dri rnams dang / ro rnams dang / reg bya rnams dang / chos rnams kyang rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Whatever is the nature of consciousness, forms are also consciousness, sounds are also consciousness, smells are also consciousness, tastes are also consciousness, tangible objects are also consciousness, and mental objects are also consciousness.

original: mig gi khams kyi mtshan nyid gang /
analyzed: mig gi khams kyi mtshan nyid gang /
translated: What is the characteristic of the eye constituent?

original: gang mig rnams la gzugs rnams mthong ba can dang / blta ba ste /
analyzed: gang mig rnams la gzugs rnams mthong ba can dang / blta ba ste /
translated: It is that which sees forms in relation to the eyes.

original: gang de'i sa bon nye bar bsags pa rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa rab tu len pa de mig gi khams kyi mtshan nyid rnams so //üîΩgang gis mig rnams la gzugs rnams mthong ba can dang / blta ba ste zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i rnam par shes pa nye bar spyod pa 'dzin pa nyid kyis khams nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: gang de'i sa bon nye bar bsags pa rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa rab tu len pa de mig gi khams kyi mtshan nyid rnams so // gang gis mig rnams la gzugs rnams mthong ba can dang / blta ba ste zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i rnam par shes pa nye bar spyod pa 'dzin pa nyid kyis khams nyid du bstan to //
translated: The accumulation of the seeds that are appropriated by the consciousness that is the ripening of those [actions] is the characteristic of the eye constituent.üîΩ‚ÄúThat which sees forms in relation to the eyes‚Äù indicates the constituent nature by means of the retention of the experience of past consciousness.

original: blta ba zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi rnam par shes pa nye bar spyod pa 'dzin pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: blta ba zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi rnam par shes pa nye bar spyod pa 'dzin pa nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn relation to the eyes‚Äù indicates the constituent nature by means of the retention of the experience of present consciousness.

original: mig gi sa bon nye bar bsags pa kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin yang khams te /
analyzed: mig gi sa bon nye bar bsags pa kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin yang khams te /
translated: The eye element is the storehouse consciousness that accumulates the seeds of the eye.

original: gang las phyi ma la mig 'grub @121a * //
analyzed: gang las phyi ma la mig 'grub @121a * //
translated: It is the element from which the eye is produced in the future.

original: ba'o ; / rnam par smin ba'ang khams te /
analyzed: ba'o ; / rnam par smin ba'ang khams te /
translated: The element of the eye is also the result of evolution.

original: gang las grub zin pa'o //
analyzed: gang las grub zin pa'o //
translated: It is the element from which the eye is produced in the present.

original: sa bon rnam pa de gnyi ga yang mig gi rgyu yin pas mig gi khams zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sa bon rnam pa de gnyi ga yang mig gi rgyu yin pas mig gi khams zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Both of these kinds of seeds are the cause of the eye, and therefore they are called the eye element.

original: mig gi khams ji lta bar /
analyzed: mig gi khams ji lta bar /
translated: Just as it is for the eye element,

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi khams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi khams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: so it is for the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mental faculty elements.

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi mtshan nyid gang /üîΩmig gang rnams la gzugs rnams mthong ba dang ldan pa dang mthong ba rnams te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi mtshan nyid gang / mig gang rnams la gzugs rnams mthong ba dang ldan pa dang mthong ba rnams te /
translated: What is the characteristic of the form element?üîΩThe form element is that which is seen by the eyes, that which possesses the quality of being seen,

original: gang de la mig gi khams dbang ba de gzugs kyi khams kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gang de la mig gi khams dbang ba de gzugs kyi khams kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: and that which is the object of the eye element.

original: mig gi khams ni gzugs la dbang byed pa ste /
analyzed: mig gi khams ni gzugs la dbang byed pa ste /
translated: The eye element is the dominant condition for form.

original: dbang po'i dbang gis phyi rol gyi yul 'grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dbang po'i dbang gis phyi rol gyi yul 'grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: The external object is established by the power of the sense faculty.

original: rang gi rten dang dmigs pa'i bye brag can no //
analyzed: rang gi rten dang dmigs pa'i bye brag can no //
translated: It is the particular support and object.

original: gzugs kyi khams ji lta bar sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos kyi khams kyi mtshan nyid kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams ji lta bar sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos kyi khams kyi mtshan nyid kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The characteristics of the elements of sound, odor, taste, touch, and the mental object are like that of the element of form.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi mtshan nyid gang /üîΩrten mig gis dmigs pa gzugs kyis so sor snang ba'i rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi mtshan nyid gang / rten mig gis dmigs pa gzugs kyis so sor snang ba'i rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: What is the characteristic of the element of visual consciousness?üîΩIt is the consciousness which appears as the individual forms, the objects of the eye which is its support.

original: gang de'i sa bon nye bar bsags pa dang / rnam par smin pa len pa'i rnam par shes pa de mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gang de'i sa bon nye bar bsags pa dang / rnam par smin pa len pa'i rnam par shes pa de mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: It is the element of visual consciousness whose seed is accumulated and which takes on the retribution consciousness.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi mtshan nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi mtshan nyid kyang ngo //
translated: The characteristics of the elements of auditory, olfactory, gustatory, tactile, and mental consciousness are also like that.

original: skye mched kyi mtshan nyid gang /üîΩde khams bzhin blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: skye mched kyi mtshan nyid gang / de khams bzhin blta bar bya ste /
translated: What is the characteristic of the sense-fields?üîΩIt should be understood as the elements.

original: de yang ji ltar rigs par khams bzhin blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang ji ltar rigs par khams bzhin blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as the elements, according as is appropriate.

original: de yang ji ltar rigs par zhes pa ni mig gang gis gzugs rnams mthong bar 'gyur ba dang / gang de'i sa bon zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yang ji ltar rigs par zhes pa ni mig gang gis gzugs rnams mthong bar 'gyur ba dang / gang de'i sa bon zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang sbyar ro //
translated: Moreover, ‚Äúas appropriate‚Äù means that the eye by which one sees forms, and the seed of that, etc.

original: gzugs kyi phung po'i rnam par gnas pa gang /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po'i rnam par gnas pa gang /
translated: What is the classification of the form heap?

original: gzugs gang cung zad de thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams kyis nye bar blangs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs gang cung zad de thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams kyis nye bar blangs pa'o //
translated: Whatever is form is all four great elements and the form derived from the four great elements.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams kyis nye bar blangs pa'i zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams kyis nye bar blangs pa'i zhes bya ba la /
translated: The form derived from the four great elements is of two types:

original: nye bar blangs pa'i gzugs ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar blangs pa'i gzugs ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is derived form?

original: skyed pa dang / rjes su 'gyur ba dang / gnas par byed pa dang / gnod pa dang / 'phel bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyed pa dang / rjes su 'gyur ba dang / gnas par byed pa dang / gnod pa dang / 'phel bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the cause of generation, transformation, support, harm, and increase.

original: 'byung ba rnams kyis nye bar blangs pa'i gzugs la ni /
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams kyis nye bar blangs pa'i gzugs la ni /
translated: The form derived from the four great elements is of two types:

original: rgyu rnam pa lnga'i dbang @121b du byas nas bskyed pa la sogs pa nyid rgyu yin te /
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa lnga'i dbang @121b du byas nas bskyed pa la sogs pa nyid rgyu yin te /
translated: The five causes are the cause of generation, etc.

original: bskyed pa'i rgyu nyid ni de dag med na de mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rgyu nyid ni de dag med na de mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the generating cause, because the derived matter does not occur if they are absent.

original: rjes su 'gyur pa'i rgyu nyid ni 'byung ba rnams gyur na de la gnas pa nye bar blangs pa'i gzugs rnams mi gnas par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gyur pa'i rgyu nyid ni 'byung ba rnams gyur na de la gnas pa nye bar blangs pa'i gzugs rnams mi gnas par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the evolving cause, because when the primary elements evolve, the matter derived from them does not remain as it is.

original: gnas par byed pa'i rgyu nyid ni mtshungs par 'byung ba'i dus na 'byung ba rnams kyis nye bar blangs pa'i gzugs kyi rgyun rgyun mi 'chad pa'i tshul du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas par byed pa'i rgyu nyid ni mtshungs par 'byung ba'i dus na 'byung ba rnams kyis nye bar blangs pa'i gzugs kyi rgyun rgyun mi 'chad pa'i tshul du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the supporting cause, because the primary elements support the stream of derived matter that occurs simultaneously, by not interrupting it.

original: gnod pa'i rgyu nyid ni 'byung ba rnams bsal na nye bar blangs pa'i gzugs la so sor yul gnod pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa'i rgyu nyid ni 'byung ba rnams bsal na nye bar blangs pa'i gzugs la so sor yul gnod pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the obstructing cause, because when the primary elements are removed, the derived matter has no power to remain in the same place.

original: 'phel bar byed pa'i rgyu nyid ni 'phel ba'i dus na 'byung ba rnams kyis nye bar blangs pa'i gzugs yongs su rgyas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phel bar byed pa'i rgyu nyid ni 'phel ba'i dus na 'byung ba rnams kyis nye bar blangs pa'i gzugs yongs su rgyas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the increasing cause, because the primary elements increase the derived matter by nourishing it when it is growing.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams gang /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams gang /
translated: What are the four great elements?

original: sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams so //
analyzed: sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams so //
translated: the earth element, the water element, the fire element, and the wind element.

original: sa'i khams gang /
analyzed: sa'i khams gang /
translated: What is the earth element?

original: sra ba nyid do //
analyzed: sra ba nyid do //
translated: It is solidity.

original: chu'i khams gang /
analyzed: chu'i khams gang /
translated: What is the water element?

original: gsher ba nyid do //
analyzed: gsher ba nyid do //
translated: It is fluidity.

original: me'i khams gang /
analyzed: me'i khams gang /
translated: What is the fire element?

original: dro ba nyid do //
analyzed: dro ba nyid do //
translated: It is heat.

original: rlung gi khams gang /
analyzed: rlung gi khams gang /
translated: What is the wind element?

original: yang zhing g-yo ba nyid do //
analyzed: yang zhing g-yo ba nyid do //
translated: It is motion.

original: nye bar blangs pa'i gzugs gang /
analyzed: nye bar blangs pa'i gzugs gang /
translated: What is derived form?

original: mig gi dbang po dang / rna ba'i dbang po dang / sna'i dbang po dang / lce'i dbang po dang / lus kyi dbang po dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i phyogs gcig dang / chos kyi skye mched pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po dang / rna ba'i dbang po dang / sna'i dbang po dang / lce'i dbang po dang / lus kyi dbang po dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i phyogs gcig dang / chos kyi skye mched pa'i gzugs so //
translated: It is the eye faculty, the ear faculty, the nose faculty, the tongue faculty, the body faculty, visible form, sound, odor, taste, the tangible, and part of the element of mental objects.

original: mig gi dbang po gang /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po gang /
translated: What is the eye faculty?

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams kyi nye bar blangs pa mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gzugs dang pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams kyi nye bar blangs pa mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gzugs dang pa'o //
translated: It is derived from the four great elements and is the support of visual consciousness and visual perception.

original: rna ba'i dbang po gang /
analyzed: rna ba'i dbang po gang /
translated: What is the ear faculty?

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams kyis nye bar blangs pa rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rten gzugs dang ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams kyis nye bar blangs pa rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rten gzugs dang ba'o //
translated: It is the sensitive matter which is the support of the consciousness of the ear, and is made up of the four great elements.

original: sna'i dbang po gang /
analyzed: sna'i dbang po gang /
translated: What is the nose faculty?

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams kyis nye bar blangs pa sna'i rnam par shes pa'i rten gzugs dang ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams kyis nye bar blangs pa sna'i rnam par shes pa'i rten gzugs dang ba'o //
translated: It is the sensitive matter which is the support of the consciousness of the nose, and is made up of the four great elements.

original: lce'i dbang po gang /
analyzed: lce'i dbang po gang /
translated: What is the tongue faculty?

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams kyis nye bar blangs pa lce'i rnam par shes pa'i rten gzugs dang pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams kyis nye bar blangs pa lce'i rnam par shes pa'i rten gzugs dang pa'o //
translated: It is the sensitive matter which is the support of the consciousness of the tongue, and is made up of the four great elements.

original: lus kyi dbang po gang /
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po gang /
translated: What is the body faculty?

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams kyis nye bar blangs pa lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten gzugs dang ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams kyis nye bar blangs pa lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten gzugs dang ba'o //
translated: It is the sensitive matter which is the support of the consciousness of the body, and is made up of the four great elements.üîΩWhat is visible form?

original: gzugs gang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams kyis nye bar blangs pa gang mig gi dbang @122a * //üîΩpo'i spyod yul gyi don te /
analyzed: gzugs gang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams kyis nye bar blangs pa gang mig gi dbang @122a * //üîΩpo'i spyod yul gyi don te /
translated: It is the object which is the domain of the eye, and is made up of the four great elements.

original: ji ltar sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / ring ba dang / thung ba dang / lham pa dang / zlum po dang / rdul phran dang / rags pa dang / phyal le ba dang / phyal le ba ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / ring ba dang / thung ba dang / lham pa dang / zlum po dang / rdul phran dang / rags pa dang / phyal le ba dang / phyal le ba ma yin pa dang /
translated: blue,

original: mtho ba dang / dma' ba dang / grib ma dang / nyi ma dang / snang ba dang / mun pa dang / sprin dang / du ba dang / rdul dang / khug rna dang / mngon par gsal ba dang / rnam par rig byed dang /
analyzed: mtho ba dang / dma' ba dang / grib ma dang / nyi ma dang / snang ba dang / mun pa dang / sprin dang / du ba dang / rdul dang / khug rna dang / mngon par gsal ba dang / rnam par rig byed dang /
translated: yellow, red, white, long, short, square, round, coarse, fine, high, low, shadow, sunlight, light, darkness, cloud, smoke, dust, mist, manifest, unmanifest,

original: nam mkha' kha dog gcig pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' kha dog gcig pa'o //
translated: space, one color,

original: de yang kha dog bzang po dang / kha dog ngan pa dang / de gnyi ga'i bar na gnas pa dang / kha dog dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: de yang kha dog bzang po dang / kha dog ngan pa dang / de gnyi ga'i bar na gnas pa dang / kha dog dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: good color, bad color, both, and like color.

original: sngon po la sogs pa gzugs rnam pa nyi shu rtsa lnga ni mtshan nyid dang / dbyibs dang / phan gnod dang / phyed pa'i rten dang / byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyan dang / rnam pa drug gi rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa gzugs rnam pa nyi shu rtsa lnga ni mtshan nyid dang / dbyibs dang / phan gnod dang / phyed pa'i rten dang / byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyan dang / rnam pa drug gi rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The twenty-five kinds of form, such as blue, are to be known as being established in six ways: as characteristics, as shape, as helpful or harmful, as the basis of distinction, as the characteristic of action, and as ornament.

original: bzhi dang bcu dang brgyad dang / gcig dang gcig gi go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: bzhi dang bcu dang brgyad dang / gcig dang gcig gi go rims bzhin no //
translated: They are to be known as being established in four ways, in ten ways, in eight ways, in one way, and in one way, respectively.

original: de la mngon bar gsal ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la mngon bar gsal ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Among them, the manifestation is the object of the eye faculty.

original: de las gzhan pa thogs par byed pa'i rig bya dang bral ba'i phyogs gang yin pa'i dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa thogs par byed pa'i rig bya dang bral ba'i phyogs gang yin pa'i dmigs pa'o //
translated: It is the object of the eye faculty, which is the part of space that is free from the obstruction of other things.

original: nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni gang steng na sngon por snang ba'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni gang steng na sngon por snang ba'o //
translated: The sky is the part of space that appears blue above.

original: sgra gang 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams kyis nye bar blangs pa rna ba'i dbang po'i gzung ba'i don gang yid du 'ong ba'am /üîΩyid du mi 'ong ba'am /üîΩgnyi ga min ba'am /
analyzed: sgra gang 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams kyis nye bar blangs pa rna ba'i dbang po'i gzung ba'i don gang yid du 'ong ba'am / yid du mi 'ong ba'am / gnyi ga min ba'am /
translated: Sound is the object apprehended by the ear faculty, which is produced by the four great elements. It is either pleasant, unpleasant, or neither.

original: zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las sam /
analyzed: zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las sam /
translated: It is either a sound that is a product of the great elements that are grasped,üîΩor a sound that is a product of the great elements that are not grasped.

original: ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las sam /üîΩde gnyi ga 'am /üîΩ'jig rten pas rab tu rtogs ba'am /
analyzed: ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las sam / de gnyi ga 'am / 'jig rten pas rab tu rtogs ba'am /
translated: 1. sound that is the effect of the great elements that are not grasped;üîΩ2. sound that is the effect of the great elements that are both grasped and not grasped;üîΩ3. sound that is well known in the world;

original: grub pas bstan ba'am /üîΩyongs su brtags ba'am /
analyzed: grub pas bstan ba'am / yongs su brtags ba'am /
translated: 4. sound that is taught by the perfected being;üîΩ5. sound that is imagined;

original: 'phags pa'i tha snyad dam /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i tha snyad dam /
translated: 6. sound that is the conventional usage of the noble ones;

original: 'phags min gyi tha snyad do //
analyzed: 'phags min gyi tha snyad do //
translated: 7. sound that is the conventional usage of the non-noble ones.

original: sgra ni mtshan nyid dang / phan gnod dang / rgyus rab tu dbye ba dang / bshad pas rab tu dbye ba dang / tha snyad kyi sa rab tu dbye ba'i rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: sgra ni mtshan nyid dang / phan gnod dang / rgyus rab tu dbye ba dang / bshad pas rab tu dbye ba dang / tha snyad kyi sa rab tu dbye ba'i rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Sound is established by way of its characteristics, its benefit and harm, its classification, its explanation, and its classification of conventional usage.

original: mtshan nyid ni rna ba'i dbang po'i gzung ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni rna ba'i dbang po'i gzung ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: Its characteristics are the objects that are grasped by the ear faculty.

original: bshad pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni /
analyzed: bshad pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni /
translated: Its classification by explanation is

original: 'jig rten pas rab tu rtogs pa la sogs pa gsum mo //
analyzed: 'jig rten pas rab tu rtogs pa la sogs pa gsum mo //
translated: the three: that which is well known in the world, and so on.

original: lhag ma ni ji ltar mthun mthan du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni ji ltar mthun mthan du rig par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be understood according to how they are appropriate.üîΩAmong those, sound that is the effect of the great elements that are not grasped

original: de la zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ni /
analyzed: de la zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ni /
translated: is like this:üîΩthe sound of wind, trees, and so on.üîΩSound that is the effect of the great elements that are both grasped and not grasped

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: is like this:

original: ngag la sogs pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: ngag la sogs pa'i sgra'o //
translated: the sound of speech and so on.

original: ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu @122b las byung ba ni /
analyzed: ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu @122b las byung ba ni /
translated: The sound that arises from the great elements that are not grasped is

original: 'di lta ste shing la sogs pa'i sgra'o /
analyzed: 'di lta ste shing la sogs pa'i sgra'o /
translated: like the sound of a tree.

original: de gnyis ka ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de gnyis ka ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The sound that arises from both is like

original: lag pa dang rdza rnga la sogs pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: lag pa dang rdza rnga la sogs pa'i sgra'o //
translated: the sound of a hand-drum.üîΩThe sound that is understood by the world is included in the worldly

original: 'jig rten pas rab tu rtogs pa ni 'jig rten pa'i skad kyis bsdus pa'o //üîΩgrub pas bstan pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyis bstan pa'o //üîΩyongs su brtags pa ni mu stegs can rnams kyis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pas rab tu rtogs pa ni 'jig rten pa'i skad kyis bsdus pa'o // grub pas bstan pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyis bstan pa'o // yongs su brtags pa ni mu stegs can rnams kyis bstan pa'o //
translated: language.üîΩThe sound that is taught by the perfected beings is taught by theüîΩnoble ones.

original: 'phags pa'i tha snyad dam /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i tha snyad dam /
translated: The sound that is imagined is taught by the tƒ´rthikas.üîΩThe sound that is conventional is the eight conventions of seeing and so

original: 'phags min gyi tha snyad ni mthong ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad brgyad kyi dbang du byas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags min gyi tha snyad ni mthong ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad brgyad kyi dbang du byas par rig par bya'o //
translated: forth.üîΩWhat is smell? It is the object that is grasped by the nose sense faculty,

original: dri gang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams kyis nye bar blangs pa sna'i dbang po'i gzung ba'i don gang ;üîΩdri bzang ba'am /
analyzed: dri gang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams kyis nye bar blangs pa sna'i dbang po'i gzung ba'i don gang ; dri bzang ba'am /
translated: which is appropriated by the four great elements.

original: dri nga ba'am /
analyzed: dri nga ba'am /
translated: It is a good smell, a bad smell, or an

original: dri mnyam ba'am /üîΩlhan skyes las sam /üîΩsbyar ba las sam /
analyzed: dri mnyam ba'am / lhan skyes las sam / sbyar ba las sam /
translated: equal smell.

original: gyur pa las so //
analyzed: gyur pa las so //
translated: It is natural, compounded, or transformed.

original: dri ni mtshan nyid dang / phan gnod dang / rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: dri ni mtshan nyid dang / phan gnod dang / rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Odor is defined by its characteristics, its benefits and harm, and its classification.

original: lhan skyes kyi dri ni tsan dan la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: lhan skyes kyi dri ni tsan dan la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Natural odors are those of sandalwood, etc.

original: sbyar ba ni bdug spos sbyar ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sbyar ba ni bdug spos sbyar ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: Mixed odors are those of incense.

original: gyur pa ni shing tog smin pa la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gyur pa ni shing tog smin pa la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: Modified odors are those of ripe fruit, etc.

original: ro gang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams kyis nye bar blangs pa lce'i dbang po'i gzung ba'i don gang de yang kha ba'am /
analyzed: ro gang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams kyis nye bar blangs pa lce'i dbang po'i gzung ba'i don gang de yang kha ba'am /
translated: Taste is the object of comprehension by the tongue sense-faculty, and is appropriated by the four great elements. It is either sweet,üîΩsour,üîΩpungent,

original: sgyur ba'am / tsha ba'am /üîΩbska ba'am / lan tshva 'am /
analyzed: sgyur ba'am / tsha ba'am / bska ba'am / lan tshva 'am /
translated: astringent,üîΩsaline,üîΩbland,

original: mngar ba'am / yid du 'ong ba'am /
analyzed: mngar ba'am / yid du 'ong ba'am /
translated: agreeable,üîΩdisagreeable,

original: yid du mi 'ong ba'am /üîΩde gnyis ka las rnam par grol ba'am /üîΩlhan skyes sam /
analyzed: yid du mi 'ong ba'am / de gnyis ka las rnam par grol ba'am / lhan skyes sam /
translated: or neutral.üîΩNatural tastes are those of sugar cane, etc.üîΩMixed tastes are those of cooked vegetables, etc.

original: sbyar ba las sam /üîΩgyur pa las so //
analyzed: sbyar ba las sam / gyur pa las so //
translated: Modified tastes are those of wine, etc.

original: ro'i rnam par gzhag pa rnams ni dri ltar rig par bya'o //üîΩreg bya'i phyogs gcig gang /
analyzed: ro'i rnam par gzhag pa rnams ni dri ltar rig par bya'o //üîΩreg bya'i phyogs gcig gang /
translated: The definitions of tastes should be understood as those of odors.üîΩTouch is the object of comprehension by the body sense-faculty, and is appropriated by the four great elements. It is either

original: lus kyi dbang po'i gzung ba'i don gang 'byung ba chen po rnams kyis nye bar blangs pa 'jam pa nyid dam /üîΩrtsub pa nyid dam /
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po'i gzung ba'i don gang 'byung ba chen po rnams kyis nye bar blangs pa 'jam pa nyid dam / rtsub pa nyid dam /
translated: The object of the body sense-faculty is the tangible, which is derived from the four great elements.üîΩIt is smoothness,

original: yang ba nyid dam /üîΩlci ba nyid dam /üîΩmnyen pa nyid dam /
analyzed: yang ba nyid dam / lci ba nyid dam / mnyen pa nyid dam /
translated: roughness,üîΩlightness,üîΩheaviness,

original: lhod pa nyid dam /üîΩlhod min nyid dam /
analyzed: lhod pa nyid dam / lhod min nyid dam /
translated: pliancy,üîΩlimpness,üîΩrigidity,

original: grang ba'am / bkres ba'am /
analyzed: grang ba'am / bkres ba'am /
translated: cold,üîΩhunger,

original: skom ba'am / tshim ba'am /
analyzed: skom ba'am / tshim ba'am /
translated: thirst,üîΩsatiation,üîΩstrength,

original: stobs sam / stobs ngan nam /üîΩbrgyal ba'am / g-ya' ba'am /
analyzed: stobs sam / stobs ngan nam / brgyal ba'am / g-ya' ba'am /
translated: weakness,üîΩfainting,üîΩitching,

original: 'gred ba'am / na ba'am /
analyzed: 'gred ba'am / na ba'am /
translated: tingling,üîΩpain,üîΩaging,

original: rga ba'am / 'chi ba'am /üîΩngal ba'am / ngal sos ba'am /
analyzed: rga ba'am / 'chi ba'am / ngal ba'am / ngal sos ba'am /
translated: death,üîΩfatigue,

original: spungs che ba'o //
analyzed: spungs che ba'o //
translated: and relaxation.

original: reg bya'i phyogs gcig ni /
analyzed: reg bya'i phyogs gcig ni /
translated: One part of the tangible isüîΩevenness, unevenness, contact, harm, collection,

original: kun du man bas pa dang / kun du gzhal ba dang / reg pa dang / kun du gnod pa dang / 'dus pa dang / khams @123a * //üîΩsnyoms ma snyoms kyi rnam par gzhag go //üîΩchu dang rlung 'dus na grang ngo //
analyzed: kun du man bas pa dang / kun du gzhal ba dang / reg pa dang / kun du gnod pa dang / 'dus pa dang / khams @123a * // snyoms ma snyoms kyi rnam par gzhag go // chu dang rlung 'dus na grang ngo //
translated: and the elements.

original: chu dang sa 'dus na 'gred do //
analyzed: chu dang sa 'dus na 'gred do //
translated: When water and wind come together, it is cold.üîΩWhen water and earth come together, it is slimy.

original: khams snyoms nang la sogs pa dang / stobs dang spungs che bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: khams snyoms nang la sogs pa dang / stobs dang spungs che bar 'gyur te /
translated: One has great strength and great mass.

original: spungs che ba ni mi 'jigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: spungs che ba ni mi 'jigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that great mass is the same as fearlessness.

original: tshim pa ni gnyi ga'o//
analyzed: tshim pa ni gnyi ga'o//
translated: Satisfaction is both.

original: bkres pa la sogs pa'i lhag ma rnams ni khams ma snyoms par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bkres pa la sogs pa'i lhag ma rnams ni khams ma snyoms par rig par bya'o //
translated: The remainder, hunger, etc., are the disequilibrium of the elements.

original: chos kyi skye mched kyi rang bzhin gang /
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched kyi rang bzhin gang /
translated: What is the nature of the element of mental objects?

original: de ni rnam pa lngar blta ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa lngar blta ste /
translated: It is of five kinds:

original: mngon par bsdus pa can nam /
analyzed: mngon par bsdus pa can nam /
translated: that which is collected;

original: mngon bar gsal ba can nam /üîΩyang dag par blangs pa can nam /
analyzed: mngon bar gsal ba can nam / yang dag par blangs pa can nam /
translated: that which is manifested;üîΩthat which is assumed;

original: yongs su brtags pa can nam /
analyzed: yongs su brtags pa can nam /
translated: that which is imagined;

original: dbang 'byor pa can no //
analyzed: dbang 'byor pa can no //
translated: and that which is mastered.

original: mngon par bsdus pa can ni rdul phra rab kyi gzugs so //
analyzed: mngon par bsdus pa can ni rdul phra rab kyi gzugs so //
translated: That which is collected is the subtle matter of atoms.

original: mngon par gsal ba can ni de nyid de las gzhan pa thogs par byed pa'i reg bya dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par gsal ba can ni de nyid de las gzhan pa thogs par byed pa'i reg bya dang bral ba'o //
translated: That which is manifested is the same, but it is the tangible that is not resistant.

original: yang dag par blangs pa can ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: yang dag par blangs pa can ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs so //
translated: That which is assumed is non-informative matter.

original: yongs su brtags pa can ni gzugs brnyan gyi gzugs so //
analyzed: yongs su brtags pa can ni gzugs brnyan gyi gzugs so //
translated: The imagined form is the form of a reflection.

original: dbang 'byor ba can ni rnam par thar pa la bsam gtan pa'i spyod yul gyi gzugs gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dbang 'byor ba can ni rnam par thar pa la bsam gtan pa'i spyod yul gyi gzugs gang yin pa'o //
translated: The mastered form is the form that is the domain of the concentration of the liberations.

original: tshor ba'i phung po'i rnam par gnas pa gang tshor ba'i tshogs drug ste /üîΩmig gi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba'i bde ba'am /üîΩsdug bsngal lam /üîΩsdug bsngal dang bde ba 'ang min pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po'i rnam par gnas pa gang tshor ba'i tshogs drug ste / mig gi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba'i bde ba'am / sdug bsngal lam / sdug bsngal dang bde ba 'ang min pa'o //
translated: The aggregate of feeling is classified in terms of the six collections of feeling.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba'i bde ba'am /üîΩsdug bsngal lam /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba'i bde ba'am / sdug bsngal lam /
translated: There is the feeling that arises from the contact of eye, the feeling that arises from the contact of ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: sdug bsngal dang bde ba'am min pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bde ba'am min pa ste /
translated: These are pleasant, unpleasant, or neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: bde ba lus kyis sam /
analyzed: bde ba lus kyis sam /
translated: Pleasant feeling is experienced by the body,

original: sdug bsngal lus kyis sam /
analyzed: sdug bsngal lus kyis sam /
translated: unpleasant feeling is experienced by the body,

original: sdug bsngal dang bde ba'ang min pa lus kyis sam /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bde ba'ang min pa lus kyis sam /
translated: and neither pleasant nor unpleasant feeling is experienced by the body.

original: bde ba sems kyis sam /
analyzed: bde ba sems kyis sam /
translated: Pleasant feeling is experienced by the mind,

original: sdug bsngal sems kyis sam /
analyzed: sdug bsngal sems kyis sam /
translated: unpleasant feeling is experienced by the mind,

original: sdug bsngal dang bde ba'ang min par sems kyis sam /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bde ba'ang min par sems kyis sam /
translated: and neither pleasant nor unpleasant feeling is experienced by the mind.

original: bde ba dug bcas sam /
analyzed: bde ba dug bcas sam /
translated: Is it pleasant and defiled,

original: sdug bsngal lam sdug bsngal dang bde ba'ang min par dug bcas sam /
analyzed: sdug bsngal lam sdug bsngal dang bde ba'ang min par dug bcas sam /
translated: or unpleasant and defiled, or neither pleasant nor unpleasant and defiled?

original: bde ba dug med dam /üîΩsdug bsngal lam /
analyzed: bde ba dug med dam / sdug bsngal lam /
