analyzed: yang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug 'byung ba ni gnas so sor nges pa ste /
translated: Again, the arising of the six collections of consciousness is restricted to specific locations.

original: gnas gang dang gang las rnam par shes pa gang dang gang 'byung ba de dang de ni der zin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gnas gang dang gang las rnam par shes pa gang dang gang 'byung ba de dang de ni der zin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Consciousness arises from a specific location and that is where it is located.

original: lhag ma ni ma zin par 'gyur te mi rung ngo //
analyzed: lhag ma ni ma zin par 'gyur te mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not possible that the remaining parts of the body are not so located.

original: zin par yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: zin par yang mi rung ste /
translated: It is also not tenable that they are grasped.

original: rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because consciousness does not exist.

original: 'di ni gtan tshigs bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gtan tshigs bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth reason.

original: yang dang yang lus 'dzin pa'i nyes par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dang yang lus 'dzin pa'i nyes par yang 'gyur te /
translated: Also, the error of repeatedly grasping a body would occur.

original: 'di ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa res 'ga' ni 'byung /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa res 'ga' ni 'byung /
translated: Thus, sometimes the eye consciousness arises,

original: res 'ga' ni mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni mi 'byung ngo //
translated: and sometimes it does not arise.

original: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin te /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin te /
translated: The same goes for the remaining [consciousnesses].

original: 'di ni gtan tshigs lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gtan tshigs lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifth reason.

original: de ltar sngon gyi las dang / da ltar 'du byed kyi rkyen las byung ba dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba yin pa dang / de'i rnam pa mi dmigs pa dang / gnas so sor nges pa dang // yang dang yang nye bar len pas kyang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar sngon gyi las dang / da ltar 'du byed kyi rkyen las byung ba dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba yin pa dang / de'i rnam pa mi dmigs pa dang / gnas so sor nges pa dang // yang dang yang nye bar len pas kyang mi rung ngo //
translated: Thus, it is not tenable that the body arises from the conditions of previous karma and present formative forces, that it is virtuous or nonvirtuous, that its aspects are not observed, that it is determined in its location, and that it is repeatedly appropriated.

original: ci'i phyir bzod pa'i 'jug pa 'byung bar mi rung zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bzod pa'i 'jug pa 'byung bar mi rung zhe na /
translated: Why is it not tenable that the body arises from the conditions of patience?

original: gal te la la zhig 'di skad du /
analyzed: gal te la la zhig 'di skad du /
translated: If someone were to say:

original: ci ste kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa yod na de'i phyir rnam par shes pa gnyis cig car 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes zer na /
analyzed: ci ste kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa yod na de'i phyir rnam par shes pa gnyis cig car 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes zer na /
translated: If you say that two consciousnesses occur simultaneously because the appropriating consciousness exists,

original: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: then this should be said to you:

original: nyes pa med pa nyid la khyod nyes par 'du shes su zin gyi /
analyzed: nyes pa med pa nyid la khyod nyes par 'du shes su zin gyi /
translated: You imagine a fault where there is no fault.

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa gnyis cig car 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa gnyis cig car 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because two consciousnesses do not occur simultaneously.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar kha cig cig car mthong bar 'dod pa nas /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar kha cig cig car mthong bar 'dod pa nas /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar du 'dod pa la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar du 'dod pa la /
translated: Because some people desire to see simultaneously up to desire to cognize simultaneously,

original: thog mar rnam par shes pa gang yang rung ba zhig 'byung du mi rung ste /
analyzed: thog mar rnam par shes pa gang yang rung ba zhig 'byung du mi rung ste /
translated: the first consciousness does not occur.

original: 'di ltar de ni yid la byed pa dang / dbang po dang yul yang yod par bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni yid la byed pa dang / dbang po dang yul yang yod par bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mental activity, the sense faculty, and the object are not distinguished.

original: rnam par shes pa cig car 'byung ba med na ci'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / lhan cig rjes su 'jug pa'i yid kyi @135a * //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa cig car 'byung ba med na ci'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / lhan cig rjes su 'jug pa'i yid kyi @135a * //
translated: If two consciousnesses do not occur simultaneously, why is it that the mental consciousness that occurs simultaneously with the eye consciousness, etc.,

original: rnam par shes pa gsal bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gsal bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If you say that consciousness is not clear,

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe 'das pa'i yul myong ba rjes su dran pa de'i tshe yid kyi rnam par shes pas rgyu ba ni gsal ba ma yin la //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe 'das pa'i yul myong ba rjes su dran pa de'i tshe yid kyi rnam par shes pas rgyu ba ni gsal ba ma yin la //
translated: then when one remembers the experience of a past object, the operation of mental consciousness is not clear.

original: da ltar gyi yul la rgyu ba'i yid ni de ltar mi gsal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: da ltar gyi yul la rgyu ba'i yid ni de ltar mi gsal ba ma yin te /
translated: But the operation of mental consciousness on a present object is not unclear.

original: de'i phyir yang cig car 'byung ba dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa mi gsal bar yang rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang cig car 'byung ba dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa mi gsal bar yang rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is possible that the six consciousnesses occur simultaneously and that mental consciousness is not clear.

original: ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po dag phan tshun gyi sa bon nyid ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po dag phan tshun gyi sa bon nyid ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are the six collections of consciousness not seeds of each other?

original: 'di ltar dge ba'i 'og tu mi dge ba 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge ba'i 'og tu mi dge ba 'byung ba'am /
translated: Thus, after a wholesome consciousness, an unwholesome consciousness arises;

original: mi dge ba'i 'og tu dge ba dang / de gnyi ga'i 'og tu lung du ma bstan pa dang / khams ngan pa'i 'og tu khams bar ma dang / khams par ma'i 'og tu khams bzang po dang / de bzhin du khams bzang po'i 'og tu khams ngan pa dang /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i 'og tu dge ba dang / de gnyi ga'i 'og tu lung du ma bstan pa dang / khams ngan pa'i 'og tu khams bar ma dang / khams par ma'i 'og tu khams bzang po dang / de bzhin du khams bzang po'i 'og tu khams ngan pa dang /
translated: after an unwholesome consciousness, a wholesome consciousness; after both of those, a neutral consciousness; after a consciousness of a bad realm, a consciousness of an intermediate realm; after a consciousness of an intermediate realm, a consciousness of a good realm; and after a consciousness of a good realm, a consciousness of a bad realm.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'og tu zag pa med pa dang / zag pa med pa'i 'og tu zag pa dang bcas pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i 'og tu 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'og tu 'jig rten pa 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'og tu zag pa med pa dang / zag pa med pa'i 'og tu zag pa dang bcas pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i 'og tu 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'og tu 'jig rten pa 'byung ba ste /
translated: After the contaminated, the uncontaminated, after the uncontaminated, the contaminated, after the mundane, the supramundane, and after the supramundane, the mundane.

original: de dag ni de ltar sa bon nyid du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de dag ni de ltar sa bon nyid du mi rung ngo //
translated: They are not suitable as seeds in that way.

original: rgyud kyi rgyun chad nas yun ring du lon pa yung yun ring zhig na 'byung bas de'i phyir yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyun chad nas yun ring du lon pa yung yun ring zhig na 'byung bas de'i phyir yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Also, it is not suitable because a long time has passed since the continuum was severed, and it would arise after a long time.

original: rnam par shes pa cig car 'byung ba med na ci'i phyir las mi srid ce na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa cig car 'byung ba med na ci'i phyir las mi srid ce na /
translated: If consciousness does not occur simultaneously, why is karma impossible?

original: 'di ltar mdor bsdus na las rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar mdor bsdus na las rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: In brief, there are four types of karma:

original: snod kyi rnam par rig pa dang / gnas kyi rnam par rig pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i rnam par rig pa dang / yul gyi rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: snod kyi rnam par rig pa dang / gnas kyi rnam par rig pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i rnam par rig pa dang / yul gyi rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: the representation of the world, the representation of the abode, the representation of ‚ÄúI,‚Äù and the representation of objects.

original: rnam par rig pa 'di dag ni skad cig skad cig la cig car 'byung ba dmigs te /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa 'di dag ni skad cig skad cig la cig car 'byung ba dmigs te /
translated: These representations are observed to occur simultaneously in each moment.

original: rnam par shes pa gcig gi skad cig la ni ngo bo tha dad pa'i las 'di lta du 'di mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gcig gi skad cig la ni ngo bo tha dad pa'i las 'di lta du 'di mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not possible for these two actions to be of the same moment of consciousness.

original: kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa med na ci'i phyir lus kyi myong ba mi rung zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar 'ga' zhig tshul bzhin nam /
analyzed: kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa med na ci'i phyir lus kyi myong ba mi rung zhe na / 'di ltar 'ga' zhig tshul bzhin nam /
translated: If there were no appropriating consciousness, why is it impossible to experience the body?

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i sems sam /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i sems sam /
translated: In this way, some experience of the body occurs, whether the mind is correct or incorrect,

original: rjes su rnam par rtog gam /üîΩsems mnyam par bzhag gam /
analyzed: rjes su rnam par rtog gam / sems mnyam par bzhag gam /
translated: whether it is subsequent conceptualization or not,üîΩwhether the mind is in meditative equipoise or not,

original: sems mnyam par ma bzhag kyang rung ste /üîΩlus kyi myong ba gang dag 'byung ba /
analyzed: sems mnyam par ma bzhag kyang rung ste / lus kyi myong ba gang dag 'byung ba /
translated: whether the mind is in meditative equipoise or not.üîΩThe occurrence of these many different kinds of experiences of the body,

original: rnam pa du ma rnam pa sna tshogs mang po de dag 'byung ba dang / dmig spar yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: rnam pa du ma rnam pa sna tshogs mang po de dag 'byung ba dang / dmig spar yang mi rung ste /
translated: and the occurrence of the opening and closing of the eyes, would be impossible.

original: de'i phyir yang kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa @135b yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa @135b yod do //
translated: Therefore, the appropriating consciousness exists.

original: kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa med na /
analyzed: kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa med na /
translated: If there were no appropriating consciousness,

original: ci'i phyir sems med pa'i snyoms pa 'jug pa mi srid ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sems med pa'i snyoms pa 'jug pa mi srid ce na /
translated: why would it be impossible to enter the mindless meditative absorptions?

original: 'di ltar 'du shes med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid lus las 'da' bar 'gyur bar rigs na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'du shes med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid lus las 'da' bar 'gyur bar rigs na /
translated: Thus, it is reasonable that the consciousness of one who enters the meditative attainment of nonperception would depart from the body.

original: ma 'das te /
analyzed: ma 'das te /
translated: But it does not depart.

original: de'i phyir 'chi ba'i dus byed pa nyid du 'gyur ro //üîΩji skad du /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'chi ba'i dus byed pa nyid du 'gyur ro // ji skad du /
translated: Therefore, it would be death.üîΩAs the Blessed One said:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de'i rnam par shes pa lus dang ma bral ba yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de'i rnam par shes pa lus dang ma bral ba yin no zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe consciousness of that person is not separated from the body.‚Äù

original: kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa med na ci'i phyir 'chi 'pho yang mi rung zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar 'chi ba'i rnam par shes pa lus kyi stod dam /
analyzed: kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa med na ci'i phyir 'chi 'pho yang mi rung zhe na / 'di ltar 'chi ba'i rnam par shes pa lus kyi stod dam /
translated: If there is no appropriating consciousness, why is death impossible?

original: smad du drod yal bar byed cing 'dor na /
analyzed: smad du drod yal bar byed cing 'dor na /
translated: Thus, at the time of death, heat is withdrawn from the upper and lower parts of the body and discarded.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni nam yang mi 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni nam yang mi 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: But mental consciousness never ceases.

original: de'i phyir yang kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa lus 'dzin pa nyid dang bral ba'i phyir lus drod yal ba dang / lus tshor ba med par yang dmigs kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa lus 'dzin pa nyid dang bral ba'i phyir lus drod yal ba dang / lus tshor ba med par yang dmigs kyi /
translated: Therefore, the body loses heat and becomes insensate when it is separated from the appropriating consciousness that holds the body together.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang bral bas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang bral bas ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that it is devoid of mental consciousness.

original: de'i phyir yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable.

original: yid gang / dus rtag tu rlom pa'i bdag nyid dang / kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa la dmigs pa dang / nyon mongs pa bzhi po bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag la chags pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang /
analyzed: yid gang / dus rtag tu rlom pa'i bdag nyid dang / kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa la dmigs pa dang / nyon mongs pa bzhi po bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag la chags pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang /
translated: The mental faculty is always of the nature of self-conceit, has the appropriating consciousness as its object, and is associated with four afflictions: the view of self, attachment to self, pride in self, and

original: ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ste /
translated: ignorance.

original: de yang lam mngon du gyur pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mi slob pa'i sa ma gtogs par dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa thams cad du 'gro ba dang / gang yang rnam par shes pa drug po rnams 'gags ma thag pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de yang lam mngon du gyur pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mi slob pa'i sa ma gtogs par dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa thams cad du 'gro ba dang / gang yang rnam par shes pa drug po rnams 'gags ma thag pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: It is also present in all virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral states, except for the path of insight, the meditative attainment of cessation, and the stage of no more learning. It is also the consciousness that arises immediately after the six consciousnesses cease.

original: yid ni nges pa'i tshig dang / dmigs pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa dang / 'byung ba'i dus kyis bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid ni nges pa'i tshig dang / dmigs pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa dang / 'byung ba'i dus kyis bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: The mental faculty should be understood as being indicated by its verbal definition, its object, its association, and the time of its occurrence.

original: lam mngon du gyur pa na de med pa ni don dam par shes pa dang / bdag tu lta bu kun du 'byung ba shin tu mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam mngon du gyur pa na de med pa ni don dam par shes pa dang / bdag tu lta bu kun du 'byung ba shin tu mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the arising of the view of self is completely incompatible with it.

original: slob pas ni ma spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: slob pas ni ma spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not abandoned by the learner.

original: de'i 'og tu yang kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa las 'byung ngo //üîΩ'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yang kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa las 'byung ngo // 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bas /
translated: After that, it arises from the appropriating consciousness.üîΩThe meditative attainment of cessation is superior to the meditative attainment of non-perception,

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ches zhi ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ches zhi ba'i phyir te /
translated: because it is more peaceful.

original: de kun du 'byung ba dang mi mthun par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de kun du 'byung ba dang mi mthun par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it is incompatible with the arising of the view of self.

original: @136a * // 'gags ma thag pa yid du 'dod pas 'gags ma thag pa'i yid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: @136a * // 'gags ma thag pa yid du 'dod pas 'gags ma thag pa'i yid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The immediately preceding mind is the immediately preceding mind, because it is asserted to be the mind that has just ceased.

original: rnam par shes pa gang /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang /
translated: What is consciousness?

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ste /
translated: It is the group of six consciousnesses.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: They are eye consciousness, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind consciousness.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa gang /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa gang /
translated: What is eye consciousness?

original: mig la brten cing gzugs la dmigs nas so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: mig la brten cing gzugs la dmigs nas so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: It is the individual discerning of an object by means of the eye.

original: rna ba'i rnam bar shes pa gang /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam bar shes pa gang /
translated: What is auditory consciousness?

original: rna ba la brten cing sgra la dmigs nas so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: rna ba la brten cing sgra la dmigs nas so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: It is the individual discerning of an object by means of the ear.

original: sna'i rnam par shes pa gang /
analyzed: sna'i rnam par shes pa gang /
translated: What is olfactory consciousness?

original: sna la brten cing dri la dmigs nas so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: sna la brten cing dri la dmigs nas so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: It is the individual discerning of an object by means of the nose.

original: lce'i rnam par shes pa gang /
analyzed: lce'i rnam par shes pa gang /
translated: What is gustatory consciousness?

original: lce la brten cing ro la dmigs nas so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: lce la brten cing ro la dmigs nas so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: It is the individual discerning of an object by means of the tongue.

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa gang /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa gang /
translated: What is tactile consciousness?

original: lus la brten cing reg bya la dmigs nas so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: lus la brten cing reg bya la dmigs nas so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: It is the individual discerning of an object by means of the body.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gang /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gang /
translated: What is mental consciousness?

original: yid la brten cing chos la dmigs nas so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: yid la brten cing chos la dmigs nas so sor rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: It is the individual discerning of an object by means of the mind.

original: rnam par shes pa ni gnas dang dmigs pa dang / rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni gnas dang dmigs pa dang / rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Consciousness should be understood as being established by its basis, its object, and its own nature.

original: khams kyi rnam par gnas pa gang /
analyzed: khams kyi rnam par gnas pa gang /
translated: What is the distribution according to the elements?

original: gzugs kyi phung po gang de ni khams bcu ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po gang de ni khams bcu ste /
translated: The form aggregate is the ten elements.

original: mig gi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / rna ba'i khams dang / sgra'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang / lce'i khams dang / ro'i khams dang lus kyi khams dang / reg bya'i khams dang / chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig kyang ngo //
analyzed: mig gi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / rna ba'i khams dang / sgra'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang / lce'i khams dang / ro'i khams dang lus kyi khams dang / reg bya'i khams dang / chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig kyang ngo //
translated: The eye element, the form element, the ear element, the sound element, the nose element, the smell element, the tongue element, the taste element, the body element, the tangible element, and one part of the phenomena element.

original: tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po gang /
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po gang /
translated: The feeling aggregate, the perception aggregate, and the formation aggregate

original: de ni chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: de ni chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: are one part of the phenomena element.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po gang /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po gang /
translated: The consciousness aggregate

original: de ni rnam par shes pa'i khams bdun te /
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa'i khams bdun te /
translated: is the seven consciousness elements and the mind element.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / yid kyi khams so //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / yid kyi khams so //
translated: The eye consciousness element, the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind consciousness elements, and the mind element.

original: khams dang skye mched rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni logs shig tu rnam par gzhag tu med do //
analyzed: khams dang skye mched rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni logs shig tu rnam par gzhag tu med do //
translated: The characteristics of the elements and sense spheres cannot be established separately.

original: phung po bstan pa'i skabs su mig la sogs pa nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde bas na phung po @136b rnams las dmigs kyis bton te /
analyzed: phung po bstan pa'i skabs su mig la sogs pa nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro // de bas na phung po @136b rnams las dmigs kyis bton te /
translated: Because the eyes, etc. are indicated in the teaching on the aggregates.

original: khams rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: khams rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, the elements are established by distinguishing them from the aggregates.

original: khams rnams las dmigs kyis bton gyi skye mched rnams rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: khams rnams las dmigs kyis bton gyi skye mched rnams rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The sense spheres are established by distinguishing them from the elements.

original: khams rnams kyi nang nas phung po rnams kyis ci zhig ma bsdus /
analyzed: khams rnams kyi nang nas phung po rnams kyis ci zhig ma bsdus /
translated: What is not included in the aggregates within the elements?

original: chos kyi khams 'dus ma byas so //
analyzed: chos kyi khams 'dus ma byas so //
translated: The unconditioned dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: de yang 'dus ma byas gzhi brgyad de /
analyzed: de yang 'dus ma byas gzhi brgyad de /
translated: That is also the eight bases of the unconditioned:

original: chos dge ba rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de ltar chos mi dge ba dang / chos lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / nam mkha' dang / so sor ma brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang /
analyzed: chos dge ba rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / de ltar chos mi dge ba dang / chos lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / nam mkha' dang / so sor ma brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang /
translated: the suchness of wholesome dharmas, the suchness of unwholesome dharmas, the suchness of neutral dharmas, space, non-analytical cessation, analytical cessation,

original: mi g-yo ba dang / 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba dang / 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa'o //
translated: the cessation of perception and sensation.

original: phung po rnams kyis gang ma bsdus pa'i 'dus ma byas de ni rnam pa brgyad du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: phung po rnams kyis gang ma bsdus pa'i 'dus ma byas de ni rnam pa brgyad du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The unconditioned that is not included in the aggregates is established as being of eight kinds.üîΩThe three kinds of reality are:üîΩthe reality of characteristic,

original: de bzhin nyid rnam pa gsum ni /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid rnam pa gsum ni /
translated: the reality of transformation,üîΩand the reality of the ultimate.üîΩThe reality of characteristic is the suchness of all things.üîΩThe reality of transformation is the suchness of the wholesome roots.üîΩThe reality of the ultimate is the suchness of the ultimate.üîΩThe suchness of the wholesome roots is the suchness of the wholesome roots of the three vehicles.üîΩThe suchness of the ultimate is the suchness of the ultimate of the three vehicles.üîΩWhy is suchness called suchness?

original: gnas kyi rnam pas tha dad kyi //
analyzed: gnas kyi rnam pas tha dad kyi //
translated: Because it is the suchness of the non-differentiation of all things.üîΩThe suchness of the wholesome roots is the suchness of the wholesome roots of the three vehicles.üîΩThe suchness of the ultimate is the suchness of the ultimate of the three vehicles.üîΩWhy is suchness called suchness?

original: ngo bo nyid kyis tha dad pa ni ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis tha dad pa ni ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Because it is the suchness of the non-differentiation of all things.

original: chos dge ba rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang /
analyzed: chos dge ba rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang /
translated: The suchness of the wholesome roots is the suchness of the wholesome roots of the three vehicles.üîΩThe suchness of the ultimate is the suchness of the ultimate of the three vehicles.üîΩWhy is suchness called suchness?üîΩBecause it is the suchness of the non-differentiation of all things.üîΩThe suchness of the wholesome roots is the suchness of the wholesome roots of the three vehicles.

original: bdag med pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang // don dam pa dang / chos kyi dbyings kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag med pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang // don dam pa dang / chos kyi dbyings kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The suchness of the ultimate is the suchness of the ultimate of the three vehicles.üîΩWhy is suchness called suchness?üîΩBecause it is the suchness of the non-differentiation of all things.üîΩThe suchness of the wholesome roots is the suchness of the wholesome roots of the three vehicles.üîΩThe suchness of the ultimate is the suchness of the ultimate of the three vehicles.

original: ci'i phyir de bzhin nyid la de bzhin nyid ces brjod na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de bzhin nyid la de bzhin nyid ces brjod na /
translated: Why is suchness called suchness?

original: gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i dngos po nye bar len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i dngos po nye bar len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the suchness of the non-differentiation of all things.üîΩThe suchness of the wholesome roots is the suchness of the wholesome roots of the three vehicles.üîΩThe suchness of the ultimate is the suchness of the ultimate of the three vehicles.üîΩWhy is suchness called suchness?üîΩBecause it is the suchness of the non-differentiation of all things.

original: gzhan du mi 'gyur ba ni rtag tu dngos po rnams ni bdag med pa'i dngos por blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan du mi 'gyur ba ni rtag tu dngos po rnams ni bdag med pa'i dngos por blta bar bya'o //
translated: The suchness of the wholesome roots is the suchness of the wholesome roots of

original: ci'i phyir stong ba nyid la stong pa nyid ces brjod na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir stong ba nyid la stong pa nyid ces brjod na /
translated: Why is emptiness called emptiness?

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa mi rgyu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa mi rgyu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the afflictions do not occur in it.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa mi rgyu ba ni /üîΩdes kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dngos po la dmigs nas /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa mi rgyu ba ni / des kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dngos po la dmigs nas /
translated: The non-occurrence of the afflictions means thatüîΩhaving taken as its object the thing that is afflicted,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa /
translated: it makes the afflictions

original: stong par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: empty.

original: gang gi tshe kun nas nyon mongs pa can zhes brjod pa de'i tshe yang /
analyzed: gang gi tshe kun nas nyon mongs pa can zhes brjod pa de'i tshe yang /
translated: Even when it is called afflicted,

original: de la glo bur gyi nyon mongs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la glo bur gyi nyon mongs par rig par bya'o //
translated: one should understand that it is afflicted adventitiously.

original: glo bur gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de yang ci zhe na /
analyzed: glo bur gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de yang ci zhe na /
translated: What is that adventitious affliction?

original: de yis zin pa'i gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i sems kyi sa bon nyes pa gzhan gyi dbang gis 'jug par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de yis zin pa'i gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i sems kyi sa bon nyes pa gzhan gyi dbang gis 'jug par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is the seed of the mind that grasps the object and the subject, which is engaged by the power of other faults.

original: sems kyi chos nyid ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: sems kyi chos nyid ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /
translated: The reality of the mind is natural luminosity,

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the reality of all dharmas.

original: ci'i phyir mtshan ma med pa zhes brjod na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mtshan ma med pa zhes brjod na /
translated: Why is it called signless?

original: mtshan ma nye bar zhi ba nye bar len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma nye bar zhi ba nye bar len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the object of the non-apprehension of signs.

original: mtshan ma rnams ni gzugs dang / tshor ba nas /
analyzed: mtshan ma rnams ni gzugs dang / tshor ba nas /
translated: Signs are the elaborations of form, feeling,

original: byang chub ces bya ba'i par du spros pa @137a * //
analyzed: byang chub ces bya ba'i par du spros pa @137a * //
translated: up to and including enlightenment.

original: rnams te / des de dag nye bar zhi ba'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: rnams te / des de dag nye bar zhi ba'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: Because it is the pacification of those, it is signless.

original: ci'i phyir yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes brjod na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes brjod na /
translated: Why is it called the limit of reality?

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i dmigs pa nye bar len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i dmigs pa nye bar len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the object of the non-erroneous.

original: yang dag pa ni gang phyin ci ma log pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ni gang phyin ci ma log pa'o //
translated: The non-erroneous is reality.

original: de'i mtha' ni mur thug pa ste /
analyzed: de'i mtha' ni mur thug pa ste /
translated: Its limit is the end of that.

original: bdag med pa las pha rol du de kho na btsal du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa las pha rol du de kho na btsal du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because beyond selflessness, that reality is not sought elsewhere.üîΩWhy is it called the ultimate?

original: ci'i phyir don dam pa zhes brjod na ye shes dam pa'i spyod yul nye bar len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir don dam pa zhes brjod na ye shes dam pa'i spyod yul nye bar len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the object of the highest wisdom.

original: ci'i phyir chos kyi dbyings zhes brjod na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir chos kyi dbyings zhes brjod na /
translated: Why is it called the dharma-element?

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rgyu nye bar len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rgyu nye bar len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of all the dharmas of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and buddhas.

original: chos dge ba rnams kyi de bzhin nyid kyi lta ba bzhin /
analyzed: chos dge ba rnams kyi de bzhin nyid kyi lta ba bzhin /
translated: It is like the view of the suchness of virtuous dharmas.üîΩ

original: chos mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid kyang de ltar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid kyang de ltar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The suchness of unwholesome and neutral dharmas should be viewed in the same way as the suchness of wholesome dharmas.

original: nam mkha' gang /
analyzed: nam mkha' gang /
translated: What is space?

original: gzugs med cing byed pa thams cad gsal bar 'byin pa nye bar len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med cing byed pa thams cad gsal bar 'byin pa nye bar len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the absence of form, since it is the receptacle for all the activities of form.

original: nam mkha' ni gzugs med ces bya ba ni gzugs nyid las bzlog pa /üîΩgzugs med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni gzugs med ces bya ba ni gzugs nyid las bzlog pa / gzugs med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos /
translated: The absence of form is the characteristic of space.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul gang yin pa de ni nam mkha'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul gang yin pa de ni nam mkha'o //
translated: It is the object of mental consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes ba'i yul ni chos kyi khams kyi skabs yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes ba'i yul ni chos kyi khams kyi skabs yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The object of mental consciousness should be understood as the sphere of the element of mental objects.

original: gzugs nyid ces bya ba ni brnan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs nyid ces bya ba ni brnan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The word ‚Äúitself‚Äù is used to exclude feeling, etc.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa dang / thun mong ba'i de bzhin nyid dang / so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid sel to //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa dang / thun mong ba'i de bzhin nyid dang / so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid sel to //
translated: , the suchness common to all dharmas, analytical cessation, and impermanence.

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ni gtan med pa ste /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ni gtan med pa ste /
translated: The horns of a rabbit and so on are absolutely nonexistent.

original: de dag las bzlog par ni mi shes so //
analyzed: de dag las bzlog par ni mi shes so //
translated: They are not known to be the opposite of those.

original: 'di ltar 'di dag ni gtan nas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di dag ni gtan nas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are absolutely nonexistent.

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa nge dag ni gzugs yod pa 'di las bzlog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa nge dag ni gzugs yod pa 'di las bzlog pa ma yin te /
translated: The horns of a rabbit and so on are not the opposite of this existent form.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa dang thun mong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa dang thun mong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are common to feeling and so on.

original: de bas na gzugs nyid las bzlog ces brjod do //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs nyid las bzlog ces brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that they are the opposite of form itself.

original: gang gzugs ma yin pa zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gang gzugs ma yin pa zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: It should be said that they are not form.

original: de med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshig gis ni tshor ba la sogs pa gzugs can ma yin pa rnams bsal te /
analyzed: de med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshig gis ni tshor ba la sogs pa gzugs can ma yin pa rnams bsal te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthey are not nonexistent‚Äù excludes the formless, such as feeling, and so on.

original: de dag ni med pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni med pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin no //
translated: Because they are not characterized by nonexistence.

original: so sor ma brtags pa'i 'gog pa gang /
analyzed: so sor ma brtags pa'i 'gog pa gang /
translated: What is cessation not due to deliberation?

original: gang 'gog la mi 'bral ba'o //
analyzed: gang 'gog la mi 'bral ba'o //
translated: It is cessation that is not separation.

original: gang 'gog la mi 'bral zhes bya ba ni bag la nyal kun du ma bcom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang 'gog la mi 'bral zhes bya ba ni bag la nyal kun du ma bcom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúCessation that is not separation‚Äù means that the latent states are not destroyed.

original: so sor @137b brtags pa'i 'gog pa gang //
analyzed: so sor @137b brtags pa'i 'gog pa gang //
translated: What is cessation due to deliberation?

original: gang 'gog pha de 'bral ba'o //
analyzed: gang 'gog pha de 'bral ba'o //
translated: The cessation of that is separation.

original: gang 'gog pa de 'bral ba zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gang 'gog pa de 'bral ba zhes pa ni /
translated: The cessation of that is separation.

original: bag la nyal kun du bcom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag la nyal kun du bcom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the latent afflictions are destroyed.

original: spang bar bya ba ni gnyis su ba lta'o //
analyzed: spang bar bya ba ni gnyis su ba lta'o //
translated: The object of abandonment is twofold.

original: nyon mongs pa dang / de'i gnas su gyur pa'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / de'i gnas su gyur pa'i tshor ba'o //
translated: The afflictions and the feeling that is their basis.

original: tshor ba de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: tshor ba de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: That feeling is also twofold.

original: 'gyur bar byed pa dang / 'gyur bar mi byed pa ste /üîΩbde sdug dang / bde ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'gyur bar byed pa dang / 'gyur bar mi byed pa ste / bde sdug dang / bde ba yang ma yin /
translated: That which is changeable and that which is not changeable.üîΩPleasant, unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa dang go rims so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa dang go rims so //
translated: In order.

original: de la nyon mongs pa spong pas so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa spong pas so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Among them, the cessation that is achieved through analysis is posited by the abandonment of the afflictions.

original: tshor ba rnam pa gnyis spong bas mi g-yo ba dang / 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: tshor ba rnam pa gnyis spong bas mi g-yo ba dang / 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The cessation that is achieved without analysis and the cessation of discrimination and feeling are posited by the abandonment of the two kinds of feeling.

original: de la nyon mongs pa spong ba ni de'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len dang bral ba'i phyir gnas gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa spong ba ni de'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len dang bral ba'i phyir gnas gyur pa'o //
translated: Among them, the abandonment of the afflictions is the transformation of the basis because it is the freedom from the negative propensities that are the side of that.

original: tshor ba spong ba ni /
analyzed: tshor ba spong ba ni /
translated: The abandonment of feeling is the freedom from the negative propensities that are the side of that.

original: de'i gnyen por gyur pa snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa dang bral ba'i phyir gnas gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por gyur pa snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa dang bral ba'i phyir gnas gyur pa'o //
translated: The transformation of the basis is the antidote to that, because it is free from the obscurations to meditative concentration.

original: de'i phyir bsam gtan gnyis par sdug bsngal 'gog pa la 'dus ma byas rnam par mi gzhag ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsam gtan gnyis par sdug bsngal 'gog pa la 'dus ma byas rnam par mi gzhag ste /
translated: Therefore, the cessation of suffering in the second meditative concentration is not posited as unconditioned,

original: 'gyur bar byed pa'i tshor ba ma lus par ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gyur bar byed pa'i tshor ba ma lus par ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the feeling that transforms is not completely abandoned.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa mi g-yo ba gang /üîΩdge rgyas kyi 'dod chags dang bral la /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa mi g-yo ba gang / dge rgyas kyi 'dod chags dang bral la /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the immovable isüîΩthe cessation of pleasure and pain in the third meditative concentration,

original: gong ma'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i bde ba dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: gong ma'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i bde ba dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
translated: which is free from attachment to the third meditative concentration but not free from attachment to the fourth.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa gang /
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa gang /
translated: What is the cessation of conception and feeling?üîΩIt is the cessation of conception and feeling in the sphere of neither conception nor non-conception,

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba /
translated: which is free from attachment to the sphere of nothingness.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo las gyen du bskyed pa'i zhi bar gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba yid la byed pas sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos brtan pa ma yin pa rnams dang / brtan pa de dag las kyang kha cig 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo las gyen du bskyed pa'i zhi bar gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba yid la byed pas sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos brtan pa ma yin pa rnams dang / brtan pa de dag las kyang kha cig 'gog pa'o //
translated: The summit of existence is the highest stage of the realm of immateriality.üîΩThe summit of existence is the highest stage of the realm of immateriality.üîΩThe summit of existence is the highest stage of the realm of immateriality.

original: yang gang gzugs rnam pa lnga dang / tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / 'dus ma byas kyi gzhi brgyad po gang /üîΩde dag gcig tu bsdus te /
analyzed: yang gang gzugs rnam pa lnga dang / tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / 'dus ma byas kyi gzhi brgyad po gang / de dag gcig tu bsdus te /
translated: The summit of existence is the highest stage of the realm of immateriality.üîΩThe summit of existence is the highest stage of the realm of immateriality.üîΩThe summit of existence is the highest stage of the realm of immateriality.üîΩThe summit of existence is the highest stage of the realm of immateriality.üîΩThe summit of existence is the highest stage of the realm of immateriality.üîΩThe summit of existence is the highest stage of the realm of immateriality.üîΩThe summit of existence is the highest stage of the realm of immateriality.

original: bcu drug gi bdag nyid ni chos kyi khams so //üîΩskye mched kyi rnam par gnas pa gang /
analyzed: bcu drug gi bdag nyid ni chos kyi khams so // skye mched kyi rnam par gnas pa gang /
translated: The summit of existence is the highest stage of the realm of immateriality.üîΩThe summit of existence is the highest stage of the realm of immateriality.üîΩThe summit of existence is the highest stage of the realm of immateriality.

original: gzugs can gyi khams bcu po gang de nyid skye mched bcu'o //üîΩrnam par shes pa'i khams bdun gang /üîΩde yid kyi skye mched do //üîΩchos kyi khams gang /
analyzed: gzugs can gyi khams bcu po gang de nyid skye mched bcu'o // rnam par shes pa'i khams bdun gang / de yid kyi skye mched do // chos kyi khams gang /
translated: The summit of existence is the highest stage of the realm of immateriality.üîΩThe summit of existence is the highest stage of the realm of immateriality.üîΩThe summit of existence is the highest stage of the realm of immateriality.

original: de chos kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: de chos kyi skye mched do //
translated: The summit of existence is the highest stage of the realm of immateriality.üîΩThe summit of existence is the highest stage of the realm of immateriality.üîΩThe summit of existence is the highest stage of the realm of immateriality.üîΩThe summit of existence is the highest stage of the realm of immateriality.üîΩThe summit of existence is the highest stage of the realm of immateriality.üîΩThe summit of existence is the highest stage of the realm of immateriality.üîΩThe summit of existence is the highest stage of the realm of immateriality.üîΩThe summit of existence is the highest stage of the realm of immateriality.üîΩThe summit of existence is the highest stage of the realm of immateriality.üîΩThe summit of existence is the highest stage of the realm of immateriality.üîΩThe summit of existence is the highest stage of the realm of immateriality.üîΩThe summit of existence is the highest stage of the realm of immateriality.

original: de nyid kyi phyir phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched @138a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched @138a * //
translated: Therefore, the aggregates, elements, and sense bases are taught.üîΩ

original: rnams ni chos gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnams ni chos gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the aggregates, elements, and sense bases are included in the three.

original: gzugs kyi phung po dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi skye mched do //
translated: The form aggregate, the phenomena element, and the mind sense base.

original: gzugs kyi phung pos ni /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung pos ni /
translated: The form aggregate includes

original: khams gzugs can bcu bsdus so //
analyzed: khams gzugs can bcu bsdus so //
translated: the ten physical elements.

original: chos kyi khams kyis ni de nyid do //
analyzed: chos kyi khams kyis ni de nyid do //
translated: The phenomena element includes the phenomena element itself.

original: yid kyi skye mched kyis ni rnam par shes pa'i khams bdun te /
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched kyis ni rnam par shes pa'i khams bdun te /
translated: The mind sense base includes the seven consciousness elements.

original: de ltar na chos thams cad ni gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na chos thams cad ni gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, all phenomena are included in the three.

original: phung po khams dang skye mched de ltar rnam par gzhag pa la zhar la byung ba de bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: phung po khams dang skye mched de ltar rnam par gzhag pa la zhar la byung ba de bstan par bya'o //
translated: The aggregates, elements, and sense bases are presented in this way.

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna rnams so so la yang gnyis gnyis yod na /
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna rnams so so la yang gnyis gnyis yod na /
translated: If the eyes, ears, and nose each have two parts,

original: khams nyi shu rtsa gcig tu ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: khams nyi shu rtsa gcig tu ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: why are there not twenty-one elements?

original: de dag gnyis gnyis yod du zin kyang gnyi ga yang mig gi mtshan nyid yin pas mtshan nyid 'dra ba dang / gnyi ga'i bya ba mig gi rnam par shes pa yin par gcig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gnyis gnyis yod du zin kyang gnyi ga yang mig gi mtshan nyid yin pas mtshan nyid 'dra ba dang / gnyi ga'i bya ba mig gi rnam par shes pa yin par gcig pa'i phyir /
translated: Although there are two eyes, they are similar in that they are both the characteristics of the eye.

original: bya ba mthun pas khams gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: bya ba mthun pas khams gzhan ma yin no //
translated: And they are not different elements because their function is the same, i.e., the visual consciousness.

original: rna ba dang sna la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rna ba dang sna la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the ear and nose.

original: gnyis gnyis su grub pa ni gnas mdzes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis gnyis su grub pa ni gnas mdzes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are established as two because they are beautiful in their place.

original: de ltar ngos gnyis shin du rnam par mdzes na gnas mdzes kyi gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ngos gnyis shin du rnam par mdzes na gnas mdzes kyi gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: In that way, if the two sides are very beautiful, the place is beautiful, but not otherwise.

original: ci mig re re la brten te mig gi rnam par shes pa rtag tu 'byung ba'am //
analyzed: ci mig re re la brten te mig gi rnam par shes pa rtag tu 'byung ba'am //
translated: Is the visual consciousness always produced in dependence on each eye?

original: 'on te gnyi ga la'ang brten smras pa /
analyzed: 'on te gnyi ga la'ang brten smras pa /
translated: Or is it produced in dependence on both?

original: gsal bar 'dzin pa'i phyir gnyi ga la'ang brten nas 'byung ste /
analyzed: gsal bar 'dzin pa'i phyir gnyi ga la'ang brten nas 'byung ste /
translated: It is produced in dependence on both, because it apprehends clearly.

original: dper na mig gnyi ga phye na gzugs 'dzin pa la gsal bar 'gyur gyi gcig gis ni de ltar ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na mig gnyi ga phye na gzugs 'dzin pa la gsal bar 'gyur gyi gcig gis ni de ltar ma yin no //
translated: For example, when both eyes are open, the apprehension of form becomes clear, but not when only one is open.

original: dper na khang pa gcig tu mar me gnyis bus na /
analyzed: dper na khang pa gcig tu mar me gnyis bus na /
translated: For example, when two lamps are lit in a house,

original: mar me gnyis la brten nas 'od rgyas pa gcig gis shin tu gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mar me gnyis la brten nas 'od rgyas pa gcig gis shin tu gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the light of the two lamps is very bright.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang tshul de ltar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang tshul de ltar blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, it should be understood that it is the same here.

original: de'i yul sna tshogs nye bar gnas par gyur na /üîΩde'i rnam pa rnams la dbang po re re'i sgo nas rnam par shes pa rnams rim gyis 'byung ngam /
analyzed: de'i yul sna tshogs nye bar gnas par gyur na / de'i rnam pa rnams la dbang po re re'i sgo nas rnam par shes pa rnams rim gyis 'byung ngam /
translated: When the various objects are present,

original: 'on te gcig gis cig car 'dzin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gcig gis cig car 'dzin zhe na /
translated: do the consciousnesses arise in succession through the doors of the individual sense faculties, or do they all arise simultaneously through a single faculty?

original: rnam par shes pa gcig kho nas cig car 'dzin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gcig kho nas cig car 'dzin te /
translated: The consciousnesses arise simultaneously through a single faculty.

original: rnam pa ni sna tshogs su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa ni sna tshogs su rig par bya'o //
translated: The various aspects should be understood.

original: lce la zas kyi khams reg na /
analyzed: lce la zas kyi khams reg na /
translated: When the food element is in contact with the tongue,

original: lce dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa rtag tu cig car 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lce dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa rtag tu cig car 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: it should be understood that the tongue consciousness and the body consciousness always arise simultaneously.

original: sgra ni rgyun chad pa'i phyir yul gzhan dag tu gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de /
analyzed: sgra ni rgyun chad pa'i phyir yul gzhan dag tu gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de /
translated: Sound is interrupted, so it is transmitted from one place to another.

original: 'byung ba'i rgyun gyis yul gzhan du 'gro ba med kyi 'on kyang @138b 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i rgyun gyis yul gzhan du 'gro ba med kyi 'on kyang @138b 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: rang gi yul na 'dug cing lan cig 'byung ste /
analyzed: rang gi yul na 'dug cing lan cig 'byung ste /
translated: it remains in its own place and arises once.

original: mar me'i 'od rgyas pa bzhin du /
analyzed: mar me'i 'od rgyas pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as the light of a lamp expands,

original: sgra rgyas par 'gyur ba yang de ltar blta'o //üîΩnye yang bar du bcad pa'i sgra yang gsal bar mi thos pa'i sgra de thogs pa yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgra rgyas par 'gyur ba yang de ltar blta'o // nye yang bar du bcad pa'i sgra yang gsal bar mi thos pa'i sgra de thogs pa yod pa'i phyir /
translated: so too the sound expands.

original: sgrib pa'i gseb nas chung dur 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa'i gseb nas chung dur 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, a sound that is not heard clearly because it is obstructed by a wall is known to arise in a small way from within the obstruction because it is impeded.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po de dag las rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa ni du zhig / rnam par mi rtog pa ni du zhig ce na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po de dag las rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa ni du zhig / rnam par mi rtog pa ni du zhig ce na /
translated: Among those six collections of consciousness, how many are conceptual and how many are non-conceptual?

original: rnam par rtog pa gsum gyis re zhig yid kyi rnam par shes pa gcig tu rtog pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gsum gyis re zhig yid kyi rnam par shes pa gcig tu rtog pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: One mental consciousness is conceptual because of three types of conceptuality.

original: rnam par rtog pa gsum ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par rtog pa dang / rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / mngon par dpyod pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gsum ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par rtog pa dang / rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / mngon par dpyod pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The three kinds of conceptualization are: conceptualization as intrinsic nature, conceptualization as memory, and conceptualization as investigation.

original: de la rang bzhin gyis rnam par rtog pa ni /
analyzed: de la rang bzhin gyis rnam par rtog pa ni /
translated: Conceptualization as intrinsic nature is

original: da ltar byung ba'i 'du byed myong ba na /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i 'du byed myong ba na /
translated: when one experiences present formative forces,

original: gang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: and conceptualizes their individual characteristics.

original: rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni /
translated: Conceptualization as memory is

original: gang sngon myong ba'i 'du byed rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gang sngon myong ba'i 'du byed rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: when one conceptualizes past formative forces that have been experienced.

original: mngon par dpyod pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni /
analyzed: mngon par dpyod pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni /
translated: Conceptualization as investigation is

original: gang 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi lkog tu gyur pa rnams la mngon par rtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi lkog tu gyur pa rnams la mngon par rtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: when one conceptualizes the hidden meaning of past, present, and future.

original: yang rnam par rtog pa bdun te /
analyzed: yang rnam par rtog pa bdun te /
translated: There are also seven kinds of conceptualization:

original: dmigs pa la rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / mtshan ma dang bcas pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / kun du tshol bar byed pa dang / so sor rtog pa dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa la rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / mtshan ma dang bcas pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / kun du tshol bar byed pa dang / so sor rtog pa dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: the conceptualization that engages its object spontaneously, the conceptualization that has a sign, the conceptualization that is signless, the conceptualization that is a thorough search, the conceptualization that is an investigation, the conceptualization that is defiled, and the conceptualization that is undefiled.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa dang po'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ste /
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa dang po'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ste /
translated: The first conceptualization is the five collections of consciousness.

original: dmigs pa la bkra bar ma bzung bar rang gi yul ji lta ba bzhin du rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa la bkra bar ma bzung bar rang gi yul ji lta ba bzhin du rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they engage their objects spontaneously, in accordance with their objects, without grasping their objects as having a variegated nature.

original: mtshan ma dang bcas pa ni rang bzhin dang rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bcas pa ni rang bzhin dang rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: The conceptualization that has a sign is the conceptualization that is natural and the conceptualization that is recollection.

original: da ltar dang / 'das pa'i yul bkra bar 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar dang / 'das pa'i yul bkra bar 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they grasp their objects as having a variegated nature in the present and the past.

original: mtshan ma med pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i yul yin la 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i yul yin la 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The conceptualization that is signless is the conceptualization that is an engagement that has an object that is future.

original: lhag ma rnams ni mngon par dpyod pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni mngon par dpyod pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid du rig par bya ste /
translated: The remaining ones should be understood as having the nature of conceptualization through investigation.

original: 'di ltar res 'ga' ni rnam par rtog pa'i kun du la @139a * //üîΩtshol lo // res 'ga' ni so sor rtog go //
analyzed: 'di ltar res 'ga' ni rnam par rtog pa'i kun du la @139a * // tshol lo // res 'ga' ni so sor rtog go //
translated: Sometimes they are conceptualizations that seek out,üîΩsometimes they are discriminations,

original: res 'ga' ni nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: sometimes they are defiled,

original: res 'ga' ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: and sometimes they are not defiled.

original: gang gi tshe gzugs la sogs pa so sor rnam par rig pa'i rnam par shes pa de ci'i phyir /üîΩmig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'i //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzugs la sogs pa so sor rnam par rig pa'i rnam par shes pa de ci'i phyir / mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'i //
translated: When consciousness is aware of form, etc., why is it called visual consciousness, etc.,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes mi bya zhe na /
translated: and not called form consciousness, etc.?

original: tshig rnam par sbyar ba rnam pa lnga 'thad pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i tshig mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩji ltar zhe na mig la rnam par shes pa ni /
analyzed: tshig rnam par sbyar ba rnam pa lnga 'thad pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i tshig mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro // ji ltar zhe na mig la rnam par shes pa ni /
translated: Because the five kinds of verbal derivation are possible for it, but not for form, etc.üîΩWhat are the five kinds of verbal derivation?

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Consciousness in the eye is visual consciousness.

original: gnas kyi yul la rnam par shes pa byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas kyi yul la rnam par shes pa byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form.

original: de yod na de yang yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de yod na de yang yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: And because when that exists, this exists.

original: 'di ltar mig yod na long ba ma yin pa rnams kyi mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig yod na long ba ma yin pa rnams kyi mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
translated: For, when the eye exists, visual consciousness arises for those who are not blind,

original: tha na mun pa yang mngon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha na mun pa yang mngon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even darkness is manifest.

original: gzugs yod du zin kyang don mi za bar 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs yod du zin kyang don mi za bar 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: Even if form exists, visual consciousness does not arise without the eye,

original: long ba rnams kyis mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: long ba rnams kyis mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the blind do not see.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Visual consciousness is the consciousness of the eye.

original: gzugs ma gyur kyang de'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs ma gyur kyang de'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if form does not change, consciousness changes because of the eye.

original: dper na mig ser gyi nad kyis btab na /
analyzed: dper na mig ser gyi nad kyis btab na /
translated: For example, when the eye is affected by jaundice,

original: gzugs sngon po la sogs pa la mig gis ser po nyid du mthong ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzugs sngon po la sogs pa la mig gis ser po nyid du mthong ba lta bu'o //
translated: the eye sees a white conch as yellow because of the eye, not because of form.

original: mig las rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: mig las rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Consciousness of the eye is visual consciousness.

original: mig ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i sa bon dang 'brel pas /
analyzed: mig ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i sa bon dang 'brel pas /
translated: The eye is the seed of visual consciousness.

original: de las grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is produced from that.

original: mig gi phyir rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: mig gi phyir rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The consciousness of the eye is eye-consciousness.

original: de la phan pa dang / mi phan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la phan pa dang / mi phan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is helpful or harmful to the eye.

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan par myong bas /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan par myong bas /
translated: For, when one experiences something in association with consciousness,

original: dbang po la phan gnod du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dbang po la phan gnod du 'gyur gyi /
translated: the sense faculty is helped or harmed,

original: yul la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yul la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the object.

original: mig dang mtshungs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: mig dang mtshungs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The consciousness that is similar to the eye is eye-consciousness.

original: gnyi ga yang sems can gyi grangs su gtogs par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang sems can gyi grangs su gtogs par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both are counted as belonging to the class of sentient beings.

original: gzugs ni gdon mi za bar sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs ni gdon mi za bar sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: But form is not necessarily counted as belonging to the class of sentient beings.

original: ci mig gis gzugs rnams mthong ngam //
analyzed: ci mig gis gzugs rnams mthong ngam //
translated: Does the eye see form?

original: 'on te rnam par shes pas mthong zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rnam par shes pas mthong zhe na /
translated: Or does consciousness see?

original: chos rnams ni byed pa med pa'i phyir /üîΩgcig gis kyang mi mthong la /
analyzed: chos rnams ni byed pa med pa'i phyir / gcig gis kyang mi mthong la /
translated: Because things are devoid of activity,

original: cig shos kyis kyang mi mthong bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: cig shos kyis kyang mi mthong bar rig par bya ste /
translated: one should understand that neither sees.

original: tshogs par gyur pa la mthong ba gdags @139b so //üîΩyang rnam pa drug gis mig gis gzugs mthong ngo zhes gtso bor rig par bya ste /
analyzed: tshogs par gyur pa la mthong ba gdags @139b so // yang rnam pa drug gis mig gis gzugs mthong ngo zhes gtso bor rig par bya ste /
translated: Seeing is ascribed to the collection.

original: rnam par shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it should be understood that the eye sees form in six ways, not the consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa drug gang zhe na /üîΩ'byung ba'i rgyu'i phyir mig las par shes pa la mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug gang zhe na / 'byung ba'i rgyu'i phyir mig las par shes pa la mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: What are the six ways?üîΩBecause it is the cause of the arising of consciousness.

original: de'i gnas kyi phyir mthong ba'i rten mig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gnas kyi phyir mthong ba'i rten mig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the support of seeing, since the eye is the support of visual consciousness.

original: mi g-yo bar 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi g-yo bar 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it engages its object without moving.

original: mig ni rtag tu rigs gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig ni rtag tu rigs gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the eye is always of the same type.

original: rang dbang du 'jug pa'i phyir skad cig re re la 'byung ba'i rkyen tshogs pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang dbang du 'jug pa'i phyir skad cig re re la 'byung ba'i rkyen tshogs pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it engages its object independently, since it does not depend on a collection of conditions that arise in each moment.

original: mdzes par 'jug pa'i phyir des gnas mdzes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdzes par 'jug pa'i phyir des gnas mdzes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it engages its object beautifully, since it is the support of beauty.

original: lung gi phyir mig gis gzugs rnams mthong ngo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lung gi phyir mig gis gzugs rnams mthong ngo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: And because of scripture, which says, ‚ÄúThe eye sees form.‚Äù

original: ji skad du bshad pa de thams cad ni rnam par shes pa la mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa de thams cad ni rnam par shes pa la mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All of this is impossible for consciousness.

original: 'di ni rnam pa mang por 'byung ba'i g-yo bar 'jug pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam pa mang por 'byung ba'i g-yo bar 'jug pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the movement of the many forms of consciousness.

original: ji ltar khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams la 'dus ma byas rnam par bzhag pa de bzhin du phung po rnams la ci'i phyir rnam par ma bzhag ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams la 'dus ma byas rnam par bzhag pa de bzhin du phung po rnams la ci'i phyir rnam par ma bzhag ce na /
translated: Why is the unconditioned not posited as a aggregate?

original: phung po'i don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po'i don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would not have the meaning of an aggregate.

original: gzugs la sogs pa 'das pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag gis bsdus te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa 'das pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag gis bsdus te /
translated: The aggregates are posited as the five aggregates of form, etc., which include the past, future, and present forms, etc., of all three times.

original: spungs pa'i don ni phung po'i don du bstan pa /
analyzed: spungs pa'i don ni phung po'i don du bstan pa /
translated: The meaning of a heap is the meaning of an aggregate.

original: de ni rtag tu yod pa ma yin pas phung po rnams la 'dus ma byas rnam par mi gzhag go //
analyzed: de ni rtag tu yod pa ma yin pas phung po rnams la 'dus ma byas rnam par mi gzhag go //
translated: Since the unconditioned does not exist at all times, it is not posited as an aggregate.

original: ci'i phyir chos 'di rnams khams dang / phung po rnams dang / skye mched kyi sgo nas logs shig tu bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir chos 'di rnams khams dang / phung po rnams dang / skye mched kyi sgo nas logs shig tu bshad ce na /
translated: Why are these phenomena explained separately as the elements, the sense bases, and the aggregates?

original: gdul bya rnams bsdus pa dang / rgyas par bstan pa la mkhas pa skyed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gdul bya rnams bsdus pa dang / rgyas par bstan pa la mkhas pa skyed pa'i phyir te /
translated: In order to generate skill in the concise and extensive teachings for disciples.

original: 'di ltar phung po bstan pa la gzugs dang rnam par shes pa gang dag mdor bstan pa de dag khams dang skye mched rnams la rnam pa bcu gcig dang / rnam pa bdun du phye nas rgyas par bstan te /
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po bstan pa la gzugs dang rnam par shes pa gang dag mdor bstan pa de dag khams dang skye mched rnams la rnam pa bcu gcig dang / rnam pa bdun du phye nas rgyas par bstan te /
translated: Thus, form and consciousness, which are taught concisely in the teaching of the aggregates, are taught extensively in the teaching of the elements and bases, being classified as eleven types and seven types, respectively.

original: ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
translated: They are to be applied as appropriate.

original: der tshor ba la sogs pa gang dag rgyas par bstan pa de dag ni khams dang / skye mched rnams su chos kyi khams dang / skye mched du bsdus te bstan to //
analyzed: der tshor ba la sogs pa gang dag rgyas par bstan pa de dag ni khams dang / skye mched rnams su chos kyi khams dang / skye mched du bsdus te bstan to //
translated: Those such as feeling that are taught extensively in the teaching of the aggregates are taught concisely in the teaching of the elements and bases as the phenomena element and phenomena base.

original: yang mtshan nyid tsam du rnam par gzhag pas phung po bstan to //
analyzed: yang mtshan nyid tsam du rnam par gzhag pas phung po bstan to //
translated: Moreover, the aggregates are taught by way of the mere characteristics of the aggregates.

original: 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang / 'dzin par byed pa rnam par gzhag pas khams bstan to //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang / 'dzin par byed pa rnam par gzhag pas khams bstan to //
translated: The elements are taught by way of the classifications of the apprehender, the apprehended, and that which causes apprehension.

original: 'dzin par byed ba skye ba'i sgor gyur pa /
analyzed: 'dzin par byed ba skye ba'i sgor gyur pa /
translated: The bases are taught by way of the doors of arising of the apprehender.

original: gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa tsam rnam par gzhag pas skye mched bstan @140a * //
analyzed: gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa tsam rnam par gzhag pas skye mched bstan @140a * //
translated: The bases are taught by way of the mere presentation of apprehended objects and apprehending subjects.

original: par rig par bya'o //üîΩzhar la byung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: par rig par bya'o // zhar la byung ba rdzogs so /
translated: This is the conclusion.üîΩThis concludes the supplementary discussion.

original: // /'di man chad ni rtsa ba'i gzhung nyid kyi don bshad par blta'o //üîΩmig ces sam /
analyzed: // /'di man chad ni rtsa ba'i gzhung nyid kyi don bshad par blta'o // mig ces sam /
translated: From here on, the meaning of the root text should be explained.

original: mig gi khams she na /üîΩmig gang / mig gi khams kyang de'am /
analyzed: mig gi khams she na / mig gang / mig gi khams kyang de'am /
translated: Is it the eye or the eye element?üîΩWhat is the eye? Is the eye element also that?

original: mig gi khams gang mig kyang de'am zhe na /
analyzed: mig gi khams gang mig kyang de'am zhe na /
translated: Or, is the eye element also the eye?

original: mig la mig gi khams ma yin pa'ang /
analyzed: mig la mig gi khams ma yin pa'ang /
translated: The eye is not the eye element.

original: dgra bcom pa tha ma'i mig go //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa tha ma'i mig go //
translated: The eye of the final arhat.

original: mig gi khams la mig ma yin pa yang /
analyzed: mig gi khams la mig ma yin pa yang /
translated: The eye element is not the eye.

original: sgo nga'i nang na 'dug pa dang / nur nur por gyur pa dang / mer mer por gyur pa dang / nar nar por gyur pa dang / ma'i mngal na gnas pa'i mig ma dod pa dang / mig zhar ba dang / gzugs med par skyes pa'i so so'i skye bo'i mig gi rgyu'o //
analyzed: sgo nga'i nang na 'dug pa dang / nur nur por gyur pa dang / mer mer por gyur pa dang / nar nar por gyur pa dang / ma'i mngal na gnas pa'i mig ma dod pa dang / mig zhar ba dang / gzugs med par skyes pa'i so so'i skye bo'i mig gi rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of the eye of an ordinary being born in the formless realm, the eye of an embryo in the womb, the eye of an embryo in the egg, the eye of an embryo in the blood and semen, the eye of an embryo in the oval, the eye of an embryo in the flesh mass, the eye of an embryo in the limb stage, the eye of a blind person, and the eye of a person born in the formless realm.

original: mig yin la mig gi khams kyang yin pa'ang /
analyzed: mig yin la mig gi khams kyang yin pa'ang /
translated: The eye is also the eye element.

original: de ma yin pa'i gnas skabs gzhan rnams so //
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i gnas skabs gzhan rnams so //
translated: The other states are not eye and are not the eye element.

original: mig ma yin la mig gi khams kyang ma yin pa'ang /
analyzed: mig ma yin la mig gi khams kyang ma yin pa'ang /
translated: That which is neither eye nor the eye element

original: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang / gzugs med par skyes pa'i 'phags pa'i'o //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang / gzugs med par skyes pa'i 'phags pa'i'o //
translated: is the eye of the arhat who has attained nirvana without any remainder of the aggregates, and the eye of the arhat who has been born in the formless realm.

original: mig dang mig gi khams ji lta bar rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi de bzhin nyid de yang ji ltar rigs par ro //
analyzed: mig dang mig gi khams ji lta bar rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi de bzhin nyid de yang ji ltar rigs par ro //
translated: The ear, nose, tongue, and body should be understood in the same way as the eye and the eye element, according to the method that was used above.

original: dgra bcom pa tha ma'i mig go zhes bya ba ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na tha ma ste /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa tha ma'i mig go zhes bya ba ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na tha ma ste /
translated: The eye of the final arhat is the last eye of the arhat who is about to enter nirvana.

original: de ni mig gzhan gyi sgyu ma yin pas khams ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni mig gzhan gyi sgyu ma yin pas khams ma yin no //
translated: It is not an element because it is an illusory eye, not a real one.

original: gzugs med par skyes pa'i so so'i skye bo'i mig gi rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni de nas 'phos te /
analyzed: gzugs med par skyes pa'i so so'i skye bo'i mig gi rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni de nas 'phos te /
translated: The eye of an ordinary person who has been born in the formless realm is the cause of the eye.

original: gzugs can gyi khams su skye ba'i mig gi sa bon kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'i phyir /
