analyzed: gzugs can gyi khams su skye ba'i mig gi sa bon kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the seed of the eye is retained in the consciousness that is the basis of the act of appropriating,

original: 'di ltar yang mig mngon par 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang mig mngon par 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, the eye sense faculty is formed.

original: yang phyir mi 'ong bas 'phags pa rnams kyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang phyir mi 'ong bas 'phags pa rnams kyi ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not formed in the noble ones, the non-returners.

original: lus kyi khams yin la lus ma yin pa yang /
analyzed: lus kyi khams yin la lus ma yin pa yang /
translated: There is also the body element that is not the body.

original: gzugs med par skyes pa'i so so'i skye bo'i rgyu zhes bya ba 'dir brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs med par skyes pa'i so so'i skye bo'i rgyu zhes bya ba 'dir brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here, it should be explained what is the cause of the ordinary beings born in the formless realm.

original: sgo nga'i nang na 'dug pa la sogs pa ni lus yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgo nga'i nang na 'dug pa la sogs pa ni lus yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those in the egg and so on have a body because they exist.

original: lus zhig pa ni mi 'tsho ba'i phyir ro //üîΩyid gang yid kyi khams kyang de'am /
analyzed: lus zhig pa ni mi 'tsho ba'i phyir ro // yid gang yid kyi khams kyang de'am /
translated: But the body that has disintegrated does not live.üîΩIs the mind the mind element or

original: yid kyi khams gang yin kyang de'am /
analyzed: yid kyi khams gang yin kyang de'am /
translated: is the mind element the mind?

original: yid la yid kyi khams ma yin pa'ang dgra bcom pa tha ma'i yid do //
analyzed: yid la yid kyi khams ma yin pa'ang dgra bcom pa tha ma'i yid do //
translated: The mind of the final arhat is the mind that is not the mind element.

original: yid kyi khams la yid ma yin pa'ang @140b 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i yid kyi khams so //
analyzed: yid kyi khams la yid ma yin pa'ang @140b 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i yid kyi khams so //
translated: The mind element of one who has entered the absorption of cessation is the mind element that is not the mind.

original: yid yin la yid kyi khams kyang yin pa'am /
analyzed: yid yin la yid kyi khams kyang yin pa'am /
translated: The mind that is the mind element

original: de ma yin pa'i gnas skabs gzhan rnams so //
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i gnas skabs gzhan rnams so //
translated: or other states that are not that.

original: yid ma yin pa yid kyi khams kyang ma yin pa'ang /
analyzed: yid ma yin pa yid kyi khams kyang ma yin pa'ang /
translated: That which is neither the mind nor the mind elementüîΩis the mind element of one who has entered the absorption of cessation.

original: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i'o //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i'o //
translated: and who has entered into the realm of Nirvana without any remainder of the aggregates.

original: yid kyi khams yin la yid ma yin pa yod ces bya ba 'dir 'du shes med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa ma bzung ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi khams yin la yid ma yin pa yod ces bya ba 'dir 'du shes med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa ma bzung ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is a mental element that is not a mental faculty. Here, the attainment of the non-perception meditative absorption is not included because the afflicted mental faculty exists.

original: gang du byung zhing skyes par gyur pa de'i sa pa nyid kyis mig gis de'i sa pa'i gzugs rnams mthong ngam /üîΩbyung zhing skyes par gyur zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gang du byung zhing skyes par gyur pa de'i sa pa nyid kyis mig gis de'i sa pa'i gzugs rnams mthong ngam / byung zhing skyes par gyur zhes pa ni /
translated: When one is born in a certain realm, does one see the forms of that realm with the eye of that realm?üîΩ‚ÄúWhen one is born‚Äù means

original: grub pa dang / rgyas par gyur pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: grub pa dang / rgyas par gyur pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: when one has been born and has grown.

original: go rims so //
analyzed: go rims so //
translated: This is the order.

original: de yi sa ba'i mig gis de'i sa pa'i gzugs rnams mthong ba yang yod /
analyzed: de yi sa ba'i mig gis de'i sa pa'i gzugs rnams mthong ba yang yod /
translated: There is seeing of the forms of that realm with the eye of that realm.

original: gzhan gyis sa pa'i mthong ba 'ang yod /
analyzed: gzhan gyis sa pa'i mthong ba 'ang yod /
translated: There is also seeing with the eye of another realm.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su byung zhing skyes par gyur pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su byung zhing skyes par gyur pa /
translated: When one is born in the desire realm,

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i mig gis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gzugs rnams mthong ba dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i sa gong ma pas sa 'og ma rnams mthong ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i mig gis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gzugs rnams mthong ba dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i sa gong ma pas sa 'og ma rnams mthong ba'o //
translated: The eye of the realm of desire sees the visible forms of the realm of desire. The eye of the first meditation sees the visible forms of the realm of desire and of the first meditation.

original: mig gis gzugs rnams mthong ba ji ltar bar rna bas sgra yang de bzhin no //üîΩ'dod pa'i khams su skyes par gyur pa ji lta bar gzugs kyi khams su byung zhing skyes par gyur pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: mig gis gzugs rnams mthong ba ji ltar bar rna bas sgra yang de bzhin no // 'dod pa'i khams su skyes par gyur pa ji lta bar gzugs kyi khams su byung zhing skyes par gyur pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: The ear hears the sounds of its own stage and of the stage immediately below.üîΩThe nose, the tongue and the body of the realm of desire grasp their own objects of the realm of desire.üîΩThe nose, the tongue and the body of the realm of desire grasp their own objects of the realm of desire.üîΩThe nose, the tongue and the body of the realm of desire grasp their own objects of the realm of desire.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa'i 'od dang pa na spyod pa'i sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi 'dod pa na spyod pa nyid kyi dri rnams snom mo //üîΩro rnams myong ngo //üîΩreg bya rnams la reg go //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa'i 'od dang pa na spyod pa'i sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi 'dod pa na spyod pa nyid kyi dri rnams snom mo // ro rnams myong ngo // reg bya rnams la reg go //
translated: The nose, the tongue and the body of the realm of desire grasp their own objects of the realm of desire.üîΩThe nose, the tongue and the body of the realm of desire grasp their own objects of the realm of desire.üîΩThe nose, the tongue and the body of the realm of desire grasp their own objects of the realm of desire.üîΩThe nose, the tongue and the body of the realm of desire grasp their own objects of the realm of desire.üîΩThe nose, the tongue and the body of the realm of desire grasp their own objects of the realm of desire.üîΩThe nose, the tongue and the body of the realm of desire grasp their own objects of the realm of desire.üîΩThe nose, the tongue and the body of the realm of desire grasp their own objects of the realm of desire.üîΩThe nose, the tongue and the body of the realm of desire grasp their own objects of the realm of desire.üîΩThe nose, the tongue and the body of the realm of desire grasp their own objects of the realm of desire.üîΩThe nose, the tongue and the body of the realm of desire grasp their own objects of the realm of desire.üîΩThe nose, the tongue and the body of the realm of desire grasp their own objects of the realm of desire.üîΩThe nose, the tongue and the body of the realm of desire grasp their own objects of the realm of desire.üîΩThe nose, the tongue and the body of the realm of desire grasp their own objects of the realm of desire.üîΩThe nose, the tongue and the body of the realm of desire grasp their own objects of the realm of desire.üîΩThe nose, the tongue and the body of the realm of desire grasp their own objects of the realm of desire.

original: gzugs kyi khams su skyes par gyur pa gzugs na spyod pa'i lus kyis rang gis sa pa nyid kyi reg bya rnams la reg go //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su skyes par gyur pa gzugs na spyod pa'i lus kyis rang gis sa pa nyid kyi reg bya rnams la reg go //
translated: The nose, the tongue and the body of the realm of desire grasp their own objects of the realm of desire.

original: de na dri dang ro ni rang bzhin gyis med de khams kyi zas kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na dri dang ro ni rang bzhin gyis med de khams kyi zas kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In this realm, smell and taste do not exist, because one is detached from the attachment to the food of the material elements.

original: de'i phyir sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa yang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa yang med do //
translated: Consequently, the olfactory and the gustatory consciousnesses do not exist there.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su byung zhing skyes par gyur pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i yid kyis khams gsum ni spyod pa rnams dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyang shes so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su byung zhing skyes par gyur pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i yid kyis khams gsum ni spyod pa rnams dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyang shes so //
translated: When one is born in the realm of desire, the mental consciousness of the realm of desire cognizes the factors of the three realms and also the pure factors.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes par gyur pa ji lta bar gzugs su skyes par gyur pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes par gyur pa ji lta bar gzugs su skyes par gyur pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as one born in the realm of desire, so also one born in the realm of form.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su skye sa par gyur pa @141a * //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su skye sa par gyur pa @141a * //
translated: When one is born in the realm of the formless,

original: ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i yid kyis gzugs med pa na spyod pa rang gi sa pa rnams dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyang shes so //
analyzed: ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i yid kyis gzugs med pa na spyod pa rang gi sa pa rnams dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyang shes so //
translated: the mental consciousness of the realm of the formless cognizes the factors of its own realm, the factors of the realm of form and the factors of the realm of desire, and also the pure factors.

original: zag pa med pa'i yid kyis ni khams gsum na spyod pa rnams dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyang shes so zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i yid kyis ni khams gsum na spyod pa rnams dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyang shes so zhes pa ni /
translated: The uncontaminated mental faculty cognizes the factors of the three realms and the uncontaminated factors.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: This is from the perspective of ƒÅryas and ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: phyi rol pa'i so so'i skye bo ni rang gi sa pa rnams nyid rnam par shes so //
analyzed: phyi rol pa'i so so'i skye bo ni rang gi sa pa rnams nyid rnam par shes so //
translated: Ordinary beings of other schools cognize their own levels.

original: chos 'di pa ni /
analyzed: chos 'di pa ni /
translated: Those who are Buddhists

original: la la sngon thos pas yongs su bsgoms pa'i dbang gis sa gong ma la yang dmigs te de las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la la sngon thos pas yongs su bsgoms pa'i dbang gis sa gong ma la yang dmigs te de las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: cognize higher levels through the power of cultivating what they have heard previously, because they are born there.

original: ci'i phyir phung po rnams go rims su brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir phung po rnams go rims su brjod ce na /
translated: Why are the aggregates presented in that order?

original: rnam par shes pa'i gnas nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i gnas nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: Because they are the basis of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i gnas bzhi dang rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i gnas bzhi dang rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The four bases of consciousness and consciousness itself.

original: yang snga ma ni phyi ma'i rten nye bar len pa'i phyir te /üîΩgzugs ji lta ba de bzhin du myong ngo //
analyzed: yang snga ma ni phyi ma'i rten nye bar len pa'i phyir te / gzugs ji lta ba de bzhin du myong ngo //
translated: The former are the support of the latter because they are the appropriator of the latter.üîΩForm is experienced as it is.

original: ji ltar tshor bar byed pa de bzhin du 'du shes su byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar tshor bar byed pa de bzhin du 'du shes su byed do //
translated: As it is felt, so it is perceived.

original: ji ltar 'du shes su byed pa de bzhin du sems par byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar 'du shes su byed pa de bzhin du sems par byed do //
translated: He thinks as he perceives.

original: ji ltar sems par byed pa de bzhin du rnam par shes par byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar sems par byed pa de bzhin du rnam par shes par byed do //
translated: He cognizes as he thinks.

original: de dang der nye bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang der nye bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He goes to such and such a place.

original: gzugs ji lta ba de bzhin du myong ngo zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: gzugs ji lta ba de bzhin du myong ngo zhes bya ba ni //
translated: He experiences as he sees.

original: bde ba la sogs pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i dbang po dang yul gnyis las bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩtshor bar byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i dbang po dang yul gnyis las bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro // tshor bar byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: He experiences pleasure, etc. from the two, the sense-faculty and the object, which are the causes of the experience of pleasure, etc.

original: 'du shes su byed do zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'du shes su byed do zhes pa ni /
translated: He perceives as he experiences.üîΩHe perceives as he experiences.

original: ji ltar myong ba bzhin du 'du shes kyis mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar myong ba bzhin du 'du shes kyis mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He perceives as he experiences.üîΩHe thinks as he perceives.

original: ji ltar 'du shes su byed pa de bzhin du sems par byed do zhes bya ba ni 'du shes ji lta ba de bzhin du las mngon bar 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'du shes su byed pa de bzhin du sems par byed do zhes bya ba ni 'du shes ji lta ba de bzhin du las mngon bar 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He thinks as he perceives.

original: ji ltar sems par byed pa de bzhin du rnam par shes par byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar sems par byed pa de bzhin du rnam par shes par byed do //
translated: He cognizes as he thinks.üîΩHe cognizes as he thinks.

original: de dang der nye bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /üîΩji ltar mngon bar 'du byas pa'i yul rnams dang / 'gro ba gzhan rnams su rnam par shes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang der nye bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni / ji ltar mngon bar 'du byas pa'i yul rnams dang / 'gro ba gzhan rnams su rnam par shes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the basis of the arising of the consciousnesses that are associated with the defilements and with purification.üîΩIt is the basis of the arising of the consciousnesses that are associated with the defilements and with purification.üîΩIt is the basis of the arising of the consciousnesses that are associated with the defilements and with purification.

original: gang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba ste phung po rnams kyi go rims bstan pa ni de lta'o //üîΩgang du kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i yul lo //
analyzed: gang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba ste phung po rnams kyi go rims bstan pa ni de lta'o //üîΩgang du kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i yul lo //
translated: It is the basis of the arising of the consciousnesses that are associated with the defilements and with purification.üîΩIt is the basis of the

original: rjes su myong ba gang gis zhes bya ba ni dug dang bcas pa dang / dug med pa la sogs pa dang / go rims so //
analyzed: rjes su myong ba gang gis zhes bya ba ni dug dang bcas pa dang / dug med pa la sogs pa dang / go rims so //
translated: By what experience? refers to the experience of the poisoned and the unpoisoned and so on.üîΩBy what signs? refers to the signs of the poisoned and the unpoisoned and so on.üîΩBy what discrimination? refers to the discrimination of the poisoned and the unpoisoned and so on.

original: mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa gang gis zhes bya ba ni /üîΩtshul bzhin ma yin pa dang / tshul bzhin du 'jug pas so //
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa gang gis zhes bya ba ni / tshul bzhin ma yin pa dang / tshul bzhin du 'jug pas so //
translated: By what apprehension of signs? refers to the apprehension of signs of the poisoned and the unpoisoned and so on.üîΩBy what volition? refers to the volition of the poisoned and the unpoisoned and so on.üîΩBy what attention? refers to the attention of the poisoned and the unpoisoned and so on.üîΩBy what mental activity? refers to the mental activity of the poisoned and the unpoisoned and so on.üîΩBy what apprehension? refers to the apprehension of the poisoned and the unpoisoned and so on.

original: gang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: By what adherence? refers to the adherence of the poisoned and the unpoisoned and so on.üîΩBy what grasping? refers to the grasping of the poisoned and the unpoisoned and so on.

original: sems gnas ngan len dang bcas pa dang / gnas ngan len med par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems gnas ngan len dang bcas pa dang / gnas ngan len med par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: By what mental construction? refers to the mental construction of the poisoned and the unpoisoned and so on.üîΩBy what discrimination? refers to the discrimination of the poisoned and the unpoisoned and so on.

original: ci'i phyir khams rnams go rims su brjod ce na /üîΩ'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi rjes su 'jug pa nye bar len pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir khams rnams go rims su brjod ce na / 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi rjes su 'jug pa nye bar len pa'i phyir te /
translated: By what apprehension of signs? refers to the apprehension of signs of the poisoned and the unpoisoned and so on.üîΩBy what volition? refers to the volition of the poisoned and the unpoisoned and so on.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi rjes su 'jug pa nye bar len pa gang /üîΩde la thog ma kho nar phan tshun blta'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi rjes su 'jug pa nye bar len pa gang / de la thog ma kho nar phan tshun blta'o //
translated: By what attention? refers to the attention of the poisoned and the unpoisoned and so on.üîΩBy what mental activity? refers to the mental activity of the poisoned and the unpoisoned and so on.

original: blta ba la brten nas kun du smra ba'o //
analyzed: blta ba la brten nas kun du smra ba'o //
translated: By what apprehension? refers to the apprehension of the poisoned and the unpoisoned and so on.

original: de'i 'og tu khrus dang / byug pa dang / phreng ba la longs spyod do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu khrus dang / byug pa dang / phreng ba la longs spyod do //
translated: Then, bathing, anointing, and wearing garlands.

original: de'i 'og tu bza' ba dang / btung ba la longs spyod do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bza' ba dang / btung ba la longs spyod do //
translated: Then, eating and drinking.

original: de'i 'og tu mal dang / bting ba dang / bud med la yongs su spyod do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mal dang / bting ba dang / bud med la yongs su spyod do //
translated: Then, sleeping, sitting, and enjoying women.

original: thams cad du rnam par rtog pa can yid kyi khams so //
analyzed: thams cad du rnam par rtog pa can yid kyi khams so //
translated: In all cases, the mind element is conceptual.

original: nang gi khams rnams rgyur byas nas phyi'i khams rnams go rims so //
analyzed: nang gi khams rnams rgyur byas nas phyi'i khams rnams go rims so //
translated: The order of the external elements is based on the order of the internal elements.

original: de'i 'og tu rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams so //
translated: Then, the consciousness elements.

original: khams kyi go rims ji lta bar skye mched rnams kyi yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: khams kyi go rims ji lta bar skye mched rnams kyi yang de bzhin no //
translated: The order of the bases is the same as that of the elements.

original: phung po'i don gang gzugs gang ci yang 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'am /
analyzed: phung po'i don gang gzugs gang ci yang 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'am /
translated: The meaning of the aggregates is whatever form there is, past, future, or present,

original: nang gi'am / phyi'i 'am /üîΩrags pa'am / phra ba'am /
analyzed: nang gi'am / phyi'i 'am / rags pa'am / phra ba'am /
translated: internal or external,üîΩgross or subtle,

original: ngan pa'am / gya nom pa'am /
analyzed: ngan pa'am / gya nom pa'am /
translated: inferior or excellent,

original: rgyang ring ba'am /üîΩthag nye ba gang /
analyzed: rgyang ring ba'am /üîΩthag nye ba gang /
translated: distant or near.

original: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus te spungs pa'i phyir gzugs kyi phung po zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus te spungs pa'i phyir gzugs kyi phung po zhes brjod do //
translated: The aggregate of form is so called because all of these are collected and heaped up together.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i bar du'ang de bzhin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i bar du'ang de bzhin te /
translated: The same is true of the other aggregates up to the aggregate of consciousness.

original: non gyi phung po bzhin no //üîΩsred pa rnam pa bcu gcig gi skabs kyis /
analyzed: non gyi phung po bzhin no // sred pa rnam pa bcu gcig gi skabs kyis /
translated: It is like the aggregate of form.üîΩThe eleven types of craving should be understood as the context for the aggregates of form, etc., which are not established as past, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa 'das pa la sogs pa'i rnam par ma bzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa 'das pa la sogs pa'i rnam par ma bzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, there is craving for the past, craving for the future, craving for the present, craving for the internal, craving for the external, craving for what is high, craving for what is low, craving for what is far, craving for what is near, craving for what is seen, craving for what is not seen, craving for what is heard, craving for what is not heard, craving for what is sensed, craving for what is not sensed, craving for what is cognized, and craving for what is not cognized.üîΩThere is craving for what is not cognized.üîΩThere is craving for what is seen, craving for what is not seen, craving for what is heard, craving for what is not heard, craving for what is sensed, craving for what is not sensed, craving for what is cognized, and craving for what is not cognized.

original: de yang kha bltas pa'i sred @142a * //
analyzed: de yang kha bltas pa'i sred @142a * //
translated: There is craving for what is not cognized.üîΩThere is craving for what is seen, craving for what is not seen, craving for what is heard, craving for what is not heard, craving for what is sensed, craving for what is not sensed, craving for what is cognized, and craving for what is not cognized.üîΩThere is craving for what is not cognized.üîΩThere is craving for what is seen, craving for what is not seen, craving for what is heard, craving for what is not heard, craving for what is sensed, craving for what is not sensed, craving for what is cognized, and craving for what is not cognized.üîΩThere is craving for what is not cognized.

original: pa dang / mngon bar dga' ba'i sred pa dang / lhag par chags pa'i sred pa dang / bdag la sred pa dang / yul la sred pa dang / 'dod pa la sred pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i sred pa dang / nyes par spyad pa'i sdug bsngal la sred pa dang /
analyzed: pa dang / mngon bar dga' ba'i sred pa dang / lhag par chags pa'i sred pa dang / bdag la sred pa dang / yul la sred pa dang / 'dod pa la sred pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i sred pa dang / nyes par spyad pa'i sdug bsngal la sred pa dang /
translated: There is craving for what is seen, craving for what is not seen, craving for what is heard, craving for what is not heard, craving for what is sensed, craving for what is not sensed, craving for what is cognized, and craving for what is not cognized.üîΩThere is craving for what is not cognized.

original: legs par spyad pa'i bde ba la sred pa dang / ring ba la sred pa dang / nye ba la sred pa sta /
analyzed: legs par spyad pa'i bde ba la sred pa dang / ring ba la sred pa dang / nye ba la sred pa sta /
translated: There is craving for what is seen, craving for what is not seen, craving for what is heard, craving for what is not heard, craving for what is sensed, craving for what is not sensed, craving for

original: sred pa de dag gi dmigs pa nyid kyi go rims bzhin du 'das pa la sogs pa'i rnam par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sred pa de dag gi dmigs pa nyid kyi go rims bzhin du 'das pa la sogs pa'i rnam par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The order of these cravings is to be applied to the past, etc.

original: yang rnam grangs gzhan du na /
analyzed: yang rnam grangs gzhan du na /
translated: Again, in another way,

original: byung ba dang / ma byung ba'i bye brag dang / 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i bye brag dang / phyi rol du bltas pa dang / nang du bltas pa'i bye brag dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i bye brag dang /
analyzed: byung ba dang / ma byung ba'i bye brag dang / 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i bye brag dang / phyi rol du bltas pa dang / nang du bltas pa'i bye brag dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i bye brag dang /
translated: the distinction of the past and future, the distinction of the grasper and the grasped, the distinction of external and internal, the distinction of the afflicted and unafflicted,

original: ring ba dang nye ba'i bye brag dang / 'das pa la sogs pa dang / ji ltar mthun mthun du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ring ba dang nye ba'i bye brag dang / 'das pa la sogs pa dang / ji ltar mthun mthun du rig par bya'o //
translated: the distinction of the distant and the near, and the distinction of the past, etc., should be understood as appropriate.

original: de la byung ba ni 'das pa dang / da ltar ro //
analyzed: de la byung ba ni 'das pa dang / da ltar ro //
translated: Among them, the past and present are the occurred.

original: ma byung ba ni ma 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: ma byung ba ni ma 'ongs pa'o //
translated: The future is the non-occurred.

original: 'dzin pa ni nang gi'o //üîΩgzung ba ni phyi'i'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni nang gi'o // gzung ba ni phyi'i'o //
translated: The internal is the grasper.üîΩThe external is the grasped.

original: phyi rol du bltas pa ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du bltas pa ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i'o //
translated: The external is the distracted.

original: nang du bltas pa ni mnyam par bzhag pa'i'o //
analyzed: nang du bltas pa ni mnyam par bzhag pa'i'o //
translated: The internal is the concentrated.

original: lhag ma rnams go sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams go sla bas ma bshad do //
translated: The remaining terms are easy to understand and thus need not be explained.

original: yang sdug bsngal shin tu rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid nye bar len pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang sdug bsngal shin tu rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid nye bar len pa'i phyir te /
translated: Moreover, they are appropriated because they are the characteristics of the extensive development of suffering.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: The great mass of suffering alone arises.

original: shing gi phung po bzhin no //üîΩsdug bsngal shin tu rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid nye bar len pa'i phyir zhes pa ni /
analyzed: shing gi phung po bzhin no // sdug bsngal shin tu rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid nye bar len pa'i phyir zhes pa ni /
translated: Like a mass of wood.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la brten nas skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la brten nas skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are appropriated because they are the characteristics of the extensive development of suffering, because the suffering of birth, etc. develop extensively in dependence on form, etc.

original: yang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i khur khyer ba nyid kyi phyir te phrag khur khyer ba bzhin no //
analyzed: yang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i khur khyer ba nyid kyi phyir te phrag khur khyer ba bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, they are appropriated because they are the burden of the afflictions, like a burden carried on the shoulder.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i khur khyer ba nyid kyi phyir te zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa gzugs la sogs pa la brten pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i khur khyer ba nyid kyi phyir te zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa gzugs la sogs pa la brten pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are appropriated because they are the burden of the afflictions, because the afflictions of the defilements, etc. are based on form, etc.

original: dper na 'jig rten na phrag pa'i khur khyer ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na 'jig rten na phrag pa'i khur khyer ba'i phyir /
translated: For example, in the world, because one carries a burden on the shoulder,

original: phrag khur khyer ba bzhin no //
analyzed: phrag khur khyer ba bzhin no //
translated: it is called a shoulder.

original: lus kyi phyogs gang gis khur khyer ba de la phrag pa zhes brjod cing 'dogs te phag @142b khur khyer pa dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyi phyogs gang gis khur khyer ba de la phrag pa zhes brjod cing 'dogs te phag @142b khur khyer pa dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The part of the body on which the burden is carried is called a shoulder and is designated as such, because it is similar to a burden-carrier.

original: khams kyi don gang /
analyzed: khams kyi don gang /
translated: What is the meaning of element?

original: chos thams cad kyi sa bon gyi don to //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi sa bon gyi don to //
translated: It is the meaning of seed of all dharmas.

original: kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa la rgyu'i dbang du byas pa'i don to //
analyzed: kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa la rgyu'i dbang du byas pa'i don to //
translated: It is the meaning of cause in the appropriating consciousness.

original: yang rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i don to //
translated: It is also the meaning of holding to its own characteristics.

original: 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos po 'dzin pa'i don te /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos po 'dzin pa'i don te /
translated: It is the meaning of holding to the state of cause and effect.

original: 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos po 'dzin pa ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos po 'dzin pa ni /
translated: Holding to the state of cause and effect

original: khams bco brgyad po de dag la rnam par shes pa'i khams drug dang / dbang don gyi khams rnams dang go rims so //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad po de dag la rnam par shes pa'i khams drug dang / dbang don gyi khams rnams dang go rims so //
translated: is the meaning of the eighteen elements, because the six consciousness elements and the elements of the sense faculties and their objects are in order.

original: yang chos kyi rnam pa thams cad bsdus nas 'jig pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang chos kyi rnam pa thams cad bsdus nas 'jig pa'i don to //
translated: Moreover, it is the meaning of the destruction of the totality of all aspects of dharmas.

original: chos kyi rnam pa thams cad bsdus nas 'dzin pa ni mdo sde'i nang du sa'i khams la sogs pa dang / khams gzhan dag bstan pa dag kyang khams bco brgyad po 'di dag tu ji ltar mthun par bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rnam pa thams cad bsdus nas 'dzin pa ni mdo sde'i nang du sa'i khams la sogs pa dang / khams gzhan dag bstan pa dag kyang khams bco brgyad po 'di dag tu ji ltar mthun par bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the aggregates is the same as the meaning of the bases and elements, because all the aspects of the Dharma are included in the aggregates, bases, and elements.

original: skye mched kyi don gang /
analyzed: skye mched kyi don gang /
translated: What is the meaning of the sense bases?

original: rnam par shes pa skye ba'i sgo'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skye ba'i sgo'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the sense bases is the door for the arising of consciousness.

original: sa bon gyi don dang / chos kyi rnam pa thams cad bsdus pa'i don ni skye mched kyi don du yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sa bon gyi don dang / chos kyi rnam pa thams cad bsdus pa'i don ni skye mched kyi don du yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the seeds and the meaning of the inclusion of all aspects of the Dharma should also be understood as the meaning of the sense bases.üîΩWhat is the example?

original: dpe gang / gzugs ni dbu ba'i gong bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: dpe gang / gzugs ni dbu ba'i gong bu lta bu'o //
translated: Form is like a mass of foam.

original: tshor ba ni chu'i chu bur lta bu'o //
analyzed: tshor ba ni chu'i chu bur lta bu'o //
translated: Feeling is like a bubble.

original: 'du shes ni smig rgyu lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'du shes ni smig rgyu lta bu'o //
translated: Perception is like a mirage.

original: 'du byed rnams ni chu shing gi phung po lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni chu shing gi phung po lta bu'o //
translated: Formative factors are like a banana tree.

original: rnam par shes pa ni sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes gang gsungs pa /
translated: Consciousness is like an illusion.

original: ci'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams ni dbu ba'i gong bu la sogs pa lta bu nyid de /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams ni dbu ba'i gong bu la sogs pa lta bu nyid de /
translated: Why is form, etc., like a mass of foam, etc.?

original: bdag med pa nye bar len pa dang / gtsang ba med pa nye bar len pa dang / ro bro ba chung ba nye bar len pa dang / mi brten cing snying po med pa nye bar len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa nye bar len pa dang / gtsang ba med pa nye bar len pa dang / ro bro ba chung ba nye bar len pa dang / mi brten cing snying po med pa nye bar len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the appropriation of non-self, the appropriation of the impure, the appropriation of the tasteless, and the appropriation of the unstable and insubstantial.

original: rang gi mdo'i tshig 'di rnams kyi don ni yang med pa dang / gso ba dang / gsog dang / snying po med par yang bshad par rig par bya'o //üîΩbdag dang / gtsang ba dang / bde ba dang / rtag par phyin ci log gi gnyen po ste /
analyzed: rang gi mdo'i tshig 'di rnams kyi don ni yang med pa dang / gso ba dang / gsog dang / snying po med par yang bshad par rig par bya'o // bdag dang / gtsang ba dang / bde ba dang / rtag par phyin ci log gi gnyen po ste /
translated: The meaning of these statements from our scriptures should be understood as explained above, as the non-existence of self, the non-existence of purity, the non-existence of pleasure, and the non-existence of permanence.

original: bdag med pa nye bar len pa'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig rnams dang go rims ltar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa nye bar len pa'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig rnams dang go rims ltar rig par bya'o //
translated: The antidotes to the errors of self, purity, pleasure, and permanence are, respectively, the statements beginning with ‚Äúbecause of the appropriation of non-self,‚Äù and so on.

original: phung po dang / khams dang skye mched rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba gang /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang skye mched rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba gang /
translated: What is the classification of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases?

original: sdom du na /
analyzed: sdom du na /
translated: In summary,

original: rdzas yod shes bya gzugs can sogs //
analyzed: rdzas yod shes bya gzugs can sogs //
translated: The substantially existent, the knowable, the physical, and so on,

original: zag bcas byung la sogs pa dang // 'das dang rkyen la sogs pa rnams //
analyzed: zag bcas byung la sogs pa dang // 'das dang rkyen la sogs pa rnams //
translated: The defiled, the arisen, and so on, the past, the conditions, and so on,

original: ji ltar du zhig ci yi phyir //üîΩphung @143a * //
analyzed: ji ltar du zhig ci yi phyir // phung @143a * //
translated: How many are substantial entities? For what purpose are substantial entities investigated?üîΩHow many are substantial entities?

original: po dang khams dang skye mched rnams ji ltar na rdzas su yod /üîΩrdzas su yod pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: po dang khams dang skye mched rnams ji ltar na rdzas su yod / rdzas su yod pa rnams ni du /
translated: How many are substantial entities?

original: ci'i phyir rdzas su yod par brtag / dbang po'i spyod yul brjod pa la mi ltos pa dang / de las gzhan pa la mi ltos pa ni rdzas su yod pa'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir rdzas su yod par brtag / dbang po'i spyod yul brjod pa la mi ltos pa dang / de las gzhan pa la mi ltos pa ni rdzas su yod pa'o //
translated: That which is not dependent on the expression of the domain of the senses, and that which is not dependent on anything else is a substantial entity.

original: thams cad kyang rdzas su yod pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang rdzas su yod pa'o //
translated: All are substantial entities.

original: bdag la rdzas su mngon par zhen pa spong ba'i phyir rdzas su yod par brtag go //
analyzed: bdag la rdzas su mngon par zhen pa spong ba'i phyir rdzas su yod par brtag go //
translated: Substantial entities are investigated for the purpose of abandoning attachment to a substantial self.

original: ji ltar du zhig ci'i phyir zhes dri ba rnam pa gsum rnam par 'jug pa ni mtshan nyid dang / dngos po la rmongs pa dang / sgro 'dogs pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar du zhig ci'i phyir zhes dri ba rnam pa gsum rnam par 'jug pa ni mtshan nyid dang / dngos po la rmongs pa dang / sgro 'dogs pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The threefold question, ‚ÄúHow many are substantial entities? ,‚Äù ‚ÄúFor what purpose are substantial entities investigated? ‚Äù is formulated in order to abandon confusion about the characteristics and things, and in order to abandon superimposition.

original: de la ji ltar na rdzas su yod ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na rdzas su yod ces bya ba ni /
translated: Here, ‚ÄúHow many are substantial entities?‚Äù

original: rdzas su yod pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pas de la rmongs pa spong ngo //
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pas de la rmongs pa spong ngo //
translated: is taught in order to abandon confusion about the characteristics of substantial entities.

original: thams cad kyang rdzas su yod pa'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni dngos po la rmongs pa spong ngo //
analyzed: thams cad kyang rdzas su yod pa'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni dngos po la rmongs pa spong ngo //
translated: The phrase all of them exist substantially eliminates the confusion about entities.

original: bdag la rdzas su mngon bar zhen pa spong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis ni sgro 'dogs pa spong ngo //
analyzed: bdag la rdzas su mngon bar zhen pa spong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis ni sgro 'dogs pa spong ngo //
translated: The phrase in order to eliminate the misapprehension of the self as a substantial entity eliminates the reification.

original: de bzhin du gzhan rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the other [four characteristics].

original: dbang po'i spyod yul brjod pa la mi ltos pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dbang po'i spyod yul brjod pa la mi ltos pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The phrase not dependent on the expression of the object of the sense faculties means that,

original: gzugs dang tshor ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu ni /
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu ni /
translated: for example, form, feeling, and so on,

original: ming bkra bar mi 'dzin par don gang yin pa 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: ming bkra bar mi 'dzin par don gang yin pa 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: are not apprehended as mere names, but are apprehended as the referents themselves.

original: de las gzhan pa la mi ltos pa ni 'di lta ste /üîΩdon gzhan la mi ltos par gang du de'i blo 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa la mi ltos pa ni 'di lta ste / don gzhan la mi ltos par gang du de'i blo 'byung ba ste /
translated: The phrase not dependent on anything else means that,üîΩfor example, the cognition of a referent arises without depending on another referent.

original: ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa la ltos nas bum pa la sogs pa la bum pa la sogs pa'i blo byung ba lta bu ni ma yin no //üîΩji ltar na btags pa'i yod pa /
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa la ltos nas bum pa la sogs pa la bum pa la sogs pa'i blo byung ba lta bu ni ma yin no // ji ltar na btags pa'i yod pa /
translated: It is not like the cognition of a pot, etc., which arises in dependence on form, etc.üîΩHow are they nominally existent?

original: btags pa'i yod pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: btags pa'i yod pa rnams ni du /
translated: How many are nominally existent?

original: ci'i phyir btags pa'i yod par brtag / dbang po'i spyod yul brjod pa dang / de las gzhan pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa ni btags pa'i yod pa'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir btags pa'i yod par brtag / dbang po'i spyod yul brjod pa dang / de las gzhan pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa ni btags pa'i yod pa'o //
translated: That which is the domain of the sense faculties, that which is described, and that which is dependent on something other than itself is nominally existent.

original: thams cad kyang btags pa'i yod pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang btags pa'i yod pa'o //
translated: All are nominally existent.

original: bdag la rdzas su mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir brtags pa'i yod par brtag go //üîΩji ltar na kun rdzob tu yod /
analyzed: bdag la rdzas su mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir brtags pa'i yod par brtag go // ji ltar na kun rdzob tu yod /
translated: It is considered to be nominally existent in order to abandon attachment to a self that is substantially existent.üîΩWhat is existence as conventional reality?

original: kun rdzob tu yod pa rnam ni du /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yod pa rnam ni du /
translated: How many are existence as conventional reality?

original: ci'i phyir kun rdzob tu yod par brtag /
analyzed: ci'i phyir kun rdzob tu yod par brtag /
translated: With what aim is existence as conventional reality investigated?

original: kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'i dmigs pa ni kun rdzob tu yod pa'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'i dmigs pa ni kun rdzob tu yod pa'o zhes pa ni /
translated: That which is the object of the afflictions is existence as conventional reality.

original: kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'i dmigs pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa 'phel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'i dmigs pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa 'phel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The object of the afflictions is existence as conventional reality because the afflictions increase in relation to it.

original: thams cad kyang kun @143b rdzob tu yod pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang kun @143b rdzob tu yod pa'o //
translated: All are existence as conventional reality.

original: bdag la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyur mngon bar zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyur mngon bar zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is considered to be existence as conventional reality in order to abandon attachment to a self that is the cause of the afflictions.

original: bdag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu'o snyam du mngon bar zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu'o snyam du mngon bar zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to abandon attachment to the idea that the self is the cause of the defilement of the world.

original: ji ltar na don dam par yod /üîΩdon dam par yod pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: ji ltar na don dam par yod / don dam par yod pa rnams ni du /
translated: What is ultimate existence?üîΩHow many are ultimately existent?

original: ci'i phyir don dam par yod par brtag //üîΩrnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i dmigs pa ni don dam par yod pa'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir don dam par yod par brtag // rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i dmigs pa ni don dam par yod pa'o //
translated: With what aim is ultimate existence investigated?üîΩThe object of purification is ultimately existent.

original: rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i dmigs pa ni don dam par yod pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i dmigs pa ni don dam par yod pa ste /
translated: The object of purification is ultimately existent,

original: ye shes dam pa'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes dam pa'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the domain of the highest clear knowledge.

original: thams cad kyang don dam par yod pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang don dam par yod pa'o //
translated: All are ultimately existent.

original: bdag la rnam par dag pa'i rgyur mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la rnam par dag pa'i rgyur mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to abandon attachment to the idea that the self is the cause of purification.

original: thams cad kyang don dam par yod pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad de bzhin nyid las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩji ltar na shes par bya ba /
analyzed: thams cad kyang don dam par yod pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad de bzhin nyid las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro // ji ltar na shes par bya ba /
translated: All are ultimately existent, because all dharmas are not other than thusness.üîΩWhat is the knowable?

original: shes par bya ba rnams ni du /
analyzed: shes par bya ba rnams ni du /
translated: How many are knowable?üîΩWith what aim is the knowable investigated?

original: ci'i phyir shes par bya ba brtag / shes par bya ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir shes par bya ba brtag / shes par bya ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Why is the object of knowledge investigated? The object of knowledge is fivefold.

original: gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / 'dus ma byas so //
analyzed: gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / 'dus ma byas so //
translated: Form, mind, mental factors, formations not associated with the mind, and the unconditioned.

original: de la gzugs ni gzugs kyi phung po ste /
analyzed: de la gzugs ni gzugs kyi phung po ste /
translated: Form is the form aggregate,

original: gzugs can gyi khams bcu dang / skye mched bcu dang / chos kyi khams dang / chos kyi skye mched pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: gzugs can gyi khams bcu dang / skye mched bcu dang / chos kyi khams dang / chos kyi skye mched pa'i gzugs so //
translated: the ten physical elements, the ten physical sense spheres, and form that is part of the phenomena element and phenomena sense sphere.

original: sems ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po ste /
analyzed: sems ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po ste /
translated: Mind is the consciousness aggregate,

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams bdun dang / yid kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams bdun dang / yid kyi skye mched do //
translated: the seven consciousness elements, and the mind sense sphere.

original: sems las byung ba'i chos rnams ni tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed kyi phung po dang / chos kyi khams dang / skye mched kyi phyogs gcig kyang do //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos rnams ni tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed kyi phung po dang / chos kyi khams dang / skye mched kyi phyogs gcig kyang do //
translated: Mental factors are the feeling aggregate, the conception aggregate, the formations associated with the mind that are included in the form aggregate, and part of the phenomena element and phenomena sense sphere.

original: ldan pa ma yin pa ni ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed kyi phung po dang / chos kyi khams dang / skye mched kyi phyogs gcig kyang ngo //
analyzed: ldan pa ma yin pa ni ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed kyi phung po dang / chos kyi khams dang / skye mched kyi phyogs gcig kyang ngo //
translated: The non-associated are the aggregate of formations dissociated from thought, the element of mental objects, and one part of the sense realm of mental objects.

original: 'dus ma byas ni chos kyi khams dang / skye mched kyi phyogs gcig go //üîΩgang du kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'am /üîΩgang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'am /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni chos kyi khams dang / skye mched kyi phyogs gcig go // gang du kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'am / gang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'am /
translated: The unconditioned is one part of the element of mental objects and of the sense realm of mental objects.üîΩIn regard to the defiled and the purified,üîΩor that which is defiled and purified,

original: gang gis kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: gang gis kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: or that by which there is defilement and purification,

original: rnam par byang ba dang / de'i gnas skabs gang dang / rnam par byang ba gang yin pa'i dbang du byas nas thams cad kyang shes par @144a * //üîΩbya'o // gang gis kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba dang / de'i gnas skabs gang dang / rnam par byang ba gang yin pa'i dbang du byas nas thams cad kyang shes par @144a * // bya'o // gang gis kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: or whatever the state of defilement and purification, all should be understood according to the rule.

original: rnam par byang ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That by which there is defilement and purificationüîΩmeans

original: sems las byung ba 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa rnams dang / go rims so //
analyzed: sems las byung ba 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa rnams dang / go rims so //
translated: the mental factors of attachment, etc., and of faith, etc., in order.

original: de'i gnas skabs gang ni gzugs dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i gnas skabs dag la btags pa sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs gang ni gzugs dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i gnas skabs dag la btags pa sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams so //
translated: The state of that is the state of form, mind, and mental factors, and is designated as the formations not associated with mind.

original: rnam par byang ba gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas te /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas te /
translated: That which is purification is the unconditioned.

original: de ni ci rigs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ni ci rigs su sbyar ro //
translated: That should be connected as appropriate.

original: de rnams kyi dbang du byas pas na thams cad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dbang du byas pas na thams cad ces bya'o //
translated: Since they are the basis of that, they are called all.

original: yang shes bya'i chos rnams ni mos pas shes pa'i spyod yul dang / rig pas shes pa'i spyod yul dang / rnam par 'phro ba med pas shes pa'i spyod yul dang / so so rang gis shes pas spyod yul dang / gzhan gyis bdag nyid shes pas spyod yul dang /
analyzed: yang shes bya'i chos rnams ni mos pas shes pa'i spyod yul dang / rig pas shes pa'i spyod yul dang / rnam par 'phro ba med pas shes pa'i spyod yul dang / so so rang gis shes pas spyod yul dang / gzhan gyis bdag nyid shes pas spyod yul dang /
translated: Moreover, the phenomena that are objects of knowledge are the domain of knowledge through belief, the domain of knowledge through understanding, the domain of knowledge through non proliferation, the domain of knowledge through individual knowledge, the domain of knowledge through the knowledge of others' minds, and the domain of knowledge through the knowledge of reality.

original: 'og ma shes pas spyod yul dang / gong ma shes pas spyod yul dang / rnam par sun 'byin pa shes pas spyod yul dang / kun nas ldang ba shes pas spyod yul dang / mi skye ba shes pas spyod yul dang / shes pa shes pas spyod yul dang /
analyzed: 'og ma shes pas spyod yul dang / gong ma shes pas spyod yul dang / rnam par sun 'byin pa shes pas spyod yul dang / kun nas ldang ba shes pas spyod yul dang / mi skye ba shes pas spyod yul dang / shes pa shes pas spyod yul dang /
translated: The domain of the knowledge of the lower, the domain of the knowledge of the higher, the domain of the knowledge of remorse, the domain of the knowledge of complete uprooting, the domain of the knowledge of non-arising, the domain of the knowledge of knowledge,

original: mthar thug pa shes pas spyod yul dang / don chen po shes pas spyod yul lo //
analyzed: mthar thug pa shes pas spyod yul dang / don chen po shes pas spyod yul lo //
translated: the domain of the knowledge of the ultimate, and the domain of the knowledge of the great meaning.

original: bdag la shes pa po dang / mthong ba por mngon bar zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la shes pa po dang / mthong ba por mngon bar zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to abandon attachment to a self that knows and sees.

original: yang yul gyi rnam pa bcu gsum po 'dis shes bya gang yin pa rab tu bstan te /
analyzed: yang yul gyi rnam pa bcu gsum po 'dis shes bya gang yin pa rab tu bstan te /
translated: Moreover, these thirteen aspects of objects fully reveal what is to be known.

original: de dag ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa dang / bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa dang / don dam pa'i shes pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / chos shes pa dang /
analyzed: de dag ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa dang / bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa dang / don dam pa'i shes pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / chos shes pa dang /
translated: They are the knowledge that arises from hearing, the knowledge that arises from reflection, the knowledge that arises from mundane cultivation, the knowledge of the ultimate, the knowledge of others' minds, the knowledge of dharmas,

original: rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang / zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dang / theg pa chen po shes pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang / zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dang / theg pa chen po shes pa ste /
translated: the cognition of subsequent realization, the cognition of suffering, the cognition of origination, the cognition of cessation, the cognition of the path, the cognition of destruction and non-arising, and the cognition of the great vehicle.

original: de ni go rims bzhin du mos pa'i shes pa la sogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni go rims bzhin du mos pa'i shes pa la sogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: These should be understood respectively as the cognition of resolve, etc.

original: de la gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni gzhan gyi bdag nyid shes pa ste /
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni gzhan gyi bdag nyid shes pa ste /
translated: Among them, the cognition of another's mind is the cognition of another's self,

original: gzhan gyi bdag nyid kyi sems yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bdag nyid kyi sems yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind of another's self is its object.

original: chos shes pa ni 'og ma shes pa ste /
analyzed: chos shes pa ni 'og ma shes pa ste /
translated: The cognition of the teaching is the lower cognition,

original: bden pa rnams la thog mar 'byung ba'i phyir @144b ro //
analyzed: bden pa rnams la thog mar 'byung ba'i phyir @144b ro //
translated: because it occurs first with regard to the truths.

original: rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa ni gang ma shes pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa ni gang ma shes pa ste /
translated: The cognition of subsequent realization is the cognition of what has not been known,

original: chos shes pa'i 'og tu 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩrnam par sun 'byin pa'i phyir /üîΩkun nas mi ldang bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos shes pa'i 'og tu 'byung ba'i phyir ro // rnam par sun 'byin pa'i phyir / kun nas mi ldang bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: because it occurs after the cognition of the teaching.üîΩfor the sake of thorough understanding,üîΩfor the sake of thorough rejection,

original: mi skye ba'i shes pa la /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i shes pa la /
translated: for the sake of thorough realization,

original: mthar thug pa la /
analyzed: mthar thug pa la /
translated: for the sake of the ultimate,

original: don chen pa la /
analyzed: don chen pa la /
translated: for the sake of the great meaning,

original: shes pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par sun 'byin pa'i shes pa nas /
analyzed: shes pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par sun 'byin pa'i shes pa nas /
translated: Any consciousness that is a consciousness of the truth of suffering is a consciousness that is a counteragent to the truth of origin.üîΩ

original: don chen po'i shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar tu sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: don chen po'i shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar tu sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The consciousnesses are to be connected with the consciousnesses that are the counteragents to those, up to the consciousness of the great meaning.

original: don chen po ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: don chen po ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi phyir ro //
translated: The great meaning is for the sake of one's own and others' goals.

original: ji ltar na rnam par shes par bya /üîΩrnam par shes par bya ba rnams ni du /
analyzed: ji ltar na rnam par shes par bya / rnam par shes par bya ba rnams ni du /
translated: How are they to be known?üîΩHow many are to be known?üîΩWhy are they to be known?

original: ci'i phyir rnam par shes par bya bar brtag / rnam par mi rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / rgyu dang / 'jug pa dang / rgyu mtshan dang / rgyu mtshan las byung ba dang / mi mthun pa dang / gnyen po dang /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam par shes par bya bar brtag / rnam par mi rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / rgyu dang / 'jug pa dang / rgyu mtshan dang / rgyu mtshan las byung ba dang / mi mthun pa dang / gnyen po dang /
translated: They are to be known as the non-conceptual, the conceptual, the cause, the engagement, the sign, the result of the sign, the discordant, the counteragent,

original: phra ba'i rab tu phye bas kyang rnam par shes par bya bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: phra ba'i rab tu phye bas kyang rnam par shes par bya bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: and the classification of the subtle.

original: de la rnam par mi rtog pas zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag gis so //
analyzed: de la rnam par mi rtog pas zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag gis so //
translated: Among them, the non-conceptual is by the five groups of consciousnesses.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas so //
translated: The conceptual is by the mental consciousness.

original: rgyu ni len pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni len pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The cause is the appropriating consciousness.

original: 'jug pa ni de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The engagement is the other consciousnesses.

original: rgyu mtshan ni dbang po dang don rnams so //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan ni dbang po dang don rnams so //
translated: The objective images are the sense faculties and the objects.

original: rgyu mtshan las byung ba ni rnam par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan las byung ba ni rnam par shes pa rnams so //
translated: The consciousnesses that arise from the objective images are the consciousnesses.

original: mi mthun pa dang gnyen po ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba zhes pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa dang gnyen po ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba zhes pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The antidotes to the resistances are such as the consciousnesses that are associated with attachment and those that are free from attachment, those that are associated with hatred and those that are free from hatred, and so on.

original: phra ba'i rab tu dbye ba ni /
analyzed: phra ba'i rab tu dbye ba ni /
translated: The subtle differentiation is

original: rnam par shes pa dka' ba'i rnam par rig pa bdun gyi bye brag gi ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dka' ba'i rnam par rig pa bdun gyi bye brag gi ste /
translated: the differentiation of the seven kinds of consciousness that are difficult to understand.

original: rnam par shes par dka' ba'i rnam par rig pa bdun ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes par dka' ba'i rnam par rig pa bdun ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The seven kinds of consciousness that are difficult to understand are as follows:

original: ma rig pa'i rnam par rig pa ni /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rnam par rig pa ni /
translated: The consciousness of nescience

original: snod kyi rnam par rig pa ste /
analyzed: snod kyi rnam par rig pa ste /
translated: is the representation of the container,

original: dus thams cad du rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus thams cad du rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not differentiated at all times.

original: sna tshogs kyi rnam par rig pa ni /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi rnam par rig pa ni /
translated: The consciousness of the variety

original: gcig gi rnam pa ni gcig dang / sna tshogs te /
analyzed: gcig gi rnam pa ni gcig dang / sna tshogs te /
translated: The form of one is one, and that of the various is various.

original: rnam par gzhag pa dka' ba'i phyir 'di ni phra ba nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa dka' ba'i phyir 'di ni phra ba nyid do //
translated: This is subtle because it is difficult to establish.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rnam par rig pa ni dus gcig tu 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa rnams ji ltar so so rang gi yul ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su gcod pa rnam par gzhag pa dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rnam par rig pa ni dus gcig tu 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa rnams ji ltar so so rang gi yul ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su gcod pa rnam par gzhag pa dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The simultaneous perception is the simultaneous arising of the consciousnesses, which is difficult to establish because it is the discernment of each of the objects as they are.

original: phra ba nyid ces bya ba ni thams cad kyi dbang du byas par rig @145a * //
analyzed: phra ba nyid ces bya ba ni thams cad kyi dbang du byas par rig @145a * //
translated: It should be understood that the term ‚Äúsubtle‚Äù is used in all of these cases.

original: par bya'o // mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gnyen po myur du 'byung ba'i rnam par rig pa ni /
analyzed: par bya'o // mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gnyen po myur du 'byung ba'i rnam par rig pa ni /
translated: The perception of the antidote arising quickly from the counteragent is

original: ji ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'ching ba thams cad dang ldan pa'i sems te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'ching ba thams cad dang ldan pa'i sems te /
translated: the mind that is endowed with all the bonds of passion and so on,

original: yud tsam nyid la lan cig tu 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yud tsam nyid la lan cig tu 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: which in an instant becomes free from passion and so on.

original: bag chags kyi rnam par rig pa ni /
analyzed: bag chags kyi rnam par rig pa ni /
translated: The perception of the habitual propensities is

original: ji ltar las kun du 'byung ba rnams kyis sems las bag chags bsgo bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar las kun du 'byung ba rnams kyis sems las bag chags bsgo bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: How does the mind become imprinted with latent impressions from the arising of all actions?

original: de las bag chags gzhan pa'ang ma yin la /
analyzed: de las bag chags gzhan pa'ang ma yin la /
translated: The latent impressions are not different from that mind,

original: de tsam nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: de tsam nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: but neither is it just that mind alone.

original: 'bras bu 'byin pa yang rim gyis 'byung ba rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'byin pa yang rim gyis 'byung ba rnyed pa'o //
translated: The mind that produces the effect is found to arise in sequence.

original: nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par rig pa ni /
analyzed: nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par rig pa ni /
translated: The consciousness that links to rebirth

original: ji ltar lus rnams du mar 'grub pa'i las kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa yod pa dang / de bzhin du 'chi ba'i dus na shin tu mi gsal ba'i tshe /
analyzed: ji ltar lus rnams du mar 'grub pa'i las kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa yod pa dang / de bzhin du 'chi ba'i dus na shin tu mi gsal ba'i tshe /
translated: is the consciousness that is infused by the karma that establishes the various bodies, and in the same way, at the time of death, when the body is very unclear,

original: 'phral la las kyi bag chags gang yang rung ba cig sad cing rgyas nas /
analyzed: 'phral la las kyi bag chags gang yang rung ba cig sad cing rgyas nas /
translated: at that moment, any latent impression of karma whatsoever awakens and expands,

original: 'gro ba gang yang rung ba zhig tu nying mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba gang yang rung ba zhig tu nying mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and it links to rebirth in any of the realms.

original: grol ba'i rnam par rig pa ni dgra bcom pa'i sems mchog tu spros pa med pa'i chos nyid thob pa de 'khor ba na 'dris pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa'i rnam pa thams cad las yang dag par shin tu 'das pa ste /
analyzed: grol ba'i rnam par rig pa ni dgra bcom pa'i sems mchog tu spros pa med pa'i chos nyid thob pa de 'khor ba na 'dris pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa'i rnam pa thams cad las yang dag par shin tu 'das pa ste /
translated: The consciousness of liberation is the consciousness of an arhat who has attained the ultimate reality free from conceptual elaboration. It is completely beyond all the aspects of the conduct that is familiar in cyclic existence and that is associated with the outflows.

original: rnam pa 'dis 'jug par rnam par gzhag par dka' ba'i phyir 'dis phra ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa 'dis 'jug par rnam par gzhag par dka' ba'i phyir 'dis phra ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it is subtle because it is difficult to determine its mode of activity.

original: thams cad kyang rnam par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang rnam par shes par bya'o //
translated: All of them should be understood.

original: bdag la mthong ba po la sogs par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la mthong ba po la sogs par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to abandon attachment to the self as the seer, etc.

original: mthong ba po dang por bzung bas ni nyan pa po dang / snom pa po dang / myong ba po dang / reg pa po dang / rnam par shes pa po'i zhes pa 'di dag gzung ba rig par bya'o //üîΩji ltar na mngon par shes par bya ba /
analyzed: mthong ba po dang por bzung bas ni nyan pa po dang / snom pa po dang / myong ba po dang / reg pa po dang / rnam par shes pa po'i zhes pa 'di dag gzung ba rig par bya'o // ji ltar na mngon par shes par bya ba /
translated: Since the seer is mentioned first, it should be understood that the hearer, the smeller, the taster, the toucher, and the knower are included.üîΩHow many are to be directly realized?

original: mngon par shes par bya ba rnams ni du /
analyzed: mngon par shes par bya ba rnams ni du /
translated: How many are directly realized?

original: ci'i phyir mngon par shes par bya bar brtag / kun du 'gro ba dang / rjes su thob ba dang / spyod pa la 'jug pa dang / 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba dang / nges par 'byung ba'i phyir spong ngo //üîΩmngon par shes pa ni mngon par shes pa drug gi yul lo //
analyzed: ci'i phyir mngon par shes par bya bar brtag / kun du 'gro ba dang / rjes su thob ba dang / spyod pa la 'jug pa dang / 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba dang / nges par 'byung ba'i phyir spong ngo // mngon par shes pa ni mngon par shes pa drug gi yul lo //
translated: Why are they to be directly realized? They are to be directly realized because of their universality, because of their attainment, because of their engagement in conduct, because of their coming, because of their going, and because of their deliverance.üîΩThe object of the supernormal knowledge is that which is to be directly realized, because it is universal.

original: 'gro ba'i bye brag gis rab tu phye ba'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bye brag gis rab tu phye ba'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa ste /
translated: The supernormal knowledge of supernormal power is distinguished by the variety of its activities.

original: de'i yul ni kun du 'gro ba'i @145b phyir mngon bar shes par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i yul ni kun du 'gro ba'i @145b phyir mngon bar shes par bya ba nyid do //
translated: Its object is that which is to be directly realized, because it is universal.

original: rna ba'i mngon bar shes pas 'gro ba sna tshogs kyi sgra yongs su shes pas na rjes su thob pa'o //
analyzed: rna ba'i mngon bar shes pas 'gro ba sna tshogs kyi sgra yongs su shes pas na rjes su thob pa'o //
translated: The supernormal knowledge of the divine ear is the attainment, because it is the knowledge of the various sounds of the world.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i sems shes pa'i phyir spyod pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i sems shes pa'i phyir spyod pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: The supernormal knowledge of the mind of another is the engagement in conduct, because it is the knowledge of the minds of others that are passionate, etc.

original: 'das pa'i tshe rabs brgyud nas 'ongs pa shes pa'i phyir 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i tshe rabs brgyud nas 'ongs pa shes pa'i phyir 'ong ba'o //
translated: The supernormal knowledge of the recollection of former lives is the coming, because it is the knowledge of the succession of former lives.üîΩThe supernormal knowledge of the divine eye is the going, because it is the knowledge of the passing away and coming to birth of beings.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i skye bar 'gyur ba shes pa'i phyir 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i skye bar 'gyur ba shes pa'i phyir 'gro ba'o //
translated: It is a going because it is the knowledge of future birth.

original: khams gsum las nges par thar pa dang thabs shes pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: khams gsum las nges par thar pa dang thabs shes pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is a deliverance because it is the knowledge of the means of definite liberation from the three realms.

original: thams cad kyang mngon par shes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang mngon par shes par bya ba'o //
translated: All are to be known by the superknowledges.

original: thams cad kyang tha ma gsum gyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyang tha ma gsum gyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All are the objects of the last three.

original: bdag mthu dang bcas par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag mthu dang bcas par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The aggregates are to be known in order to abandon attachment to a powerful self.

original: ji ltar na gzugs can /
analyzed: ji ltar na gzugs can /
translated: What is having form?

original: gzugs can rnams ni du /
analyzed: gzugs can rnams ni du /
translated: How many have form?üîΩWith what aim is that which has form investigated?

original: ci'i phyir gzugs can du brtag / gzugs de'i bdag nyid dang / 'byung ba rten du gyur pa dang / dga' ba'i kun 'byung dang / phyogs dang bcas pa dang / yul la khyab pa dang / yul nye bar bstan du rung ba dang / yul spyod yul du gyur pa dang /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzugs can du brtag / gzugs de'i bdag nyid dang / 'byung ba rten du gyur pa dang / dga' ba'i kun 'byung dang / phyogs dang bcas pa dang / yul la khyab pa dang / yul nye bar bstan du rung ba dang / yul spyod yul du gyur pa dang /
translated: That which has form should be understood as having the nature of form, as the support of the great elements, as the origin of pleasure, as having direction, as pervading the object, as being an object that can be shown, as being an object that is a domain.

original: gnyi spyod yul du mtshungs pa dang / 'brel pa dang / rjes su 'brel pa dang / rab tu rtog pa dang / gnod par byed pa dang / go bar byed pa dang / bsags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / phyi rol tu bltas pa dang /
analyzed: gnyi spyod yul du mtshungs pa dang / 'brel pa dang / rjes su 'brel pa dang / rab tu rtog pa dang / gnod par byed pa dang / go bar byed pa dang / bsags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / phyi rol tu bltas pa dang /
translated: It should be regarded as material because it is similar to material form in terms of its domain, its relationship, its connection, its investigation, its harm, its understanding, its accumulation, its external orientation,

original: nang du bltas pa dang / yun ring pa dang / dus yongs su chad pa dang / de'i dus dang / nges par ston pa'i phyir yang gzugs can du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: nang du bltas pa dang / yun ring pa dang / dus yongs su chad pa dang / de'i dus dang / nges par ston pa'i phyir yang gzugs can du blta bar bya'o //
translated: its internal orientation, its duration, its temporal division, its present time, and its teaching.

original: de la gzugs ni chos de'i bdag nyid dang / ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: de la gzugs ni chos de'i bdag nyid dang / ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: In this regard, material form is the nature and essence of that entity.

original: de'i phyir gzugs can yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs can yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it is material.

original: gzugs can gzhan dang ldan pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs can gzhan dang ldan pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not because it possesses another materiality.

original: gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i bar du brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i bar du brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is called the essence of material form.

original: 'byung ba rten du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'byung ba rten du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe primary elements serve as its support‚Äù

original: gzugs gzhan dang ldan pa'i phyir yang gzugs can nyid du ston te /
analyzed: gzugs gzhan dang ldan pa'i phyir yang gzugs can nyid du ston te /
translated: indicates that it is material because it possesses another materiality.

original: kun du len pa'i gzugs ni 'byung ba'i gzugs dang ldan pa dang / 'byung ba'i gzugs rnams kyang nang phan tshun ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du len pa'i gzugs ni 'byung ba'i gzugs dang ldan pa dang / 'byung ba'i gzugs rnams kyang nang phan tshun ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The form that is grasped is the form of the elements, and the elements are mutually conjoined.

original: dga' ba kun 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dga' ba kun 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The origin of pleasure is the cause of pleasure.

original: dga' ba nyid gang gi kun 'byung ba yin pa de gzugs can yin gyi /
analyzed: dga' ba nyid gang gi kun 'byung ba yin pa de gzugs can yin gyi /
translated: The cause of pleasure is form,

original: ji ltar tshor ba la sogs pa'i kun 'byung ba ni sngon gyi dga' ba dang / da ltar byung ba'i reg pa la sogs pa @146a * //
analyzed: ji ltar tshor ba la sogs pa'i kun 'byung ba ni sngon gyi dga' ba dang / da ltar byung ba'i reg pa la sogs pa @146a * //
translated: unlike the origin of feeling, etc., which is the previous pleasure and the present contact, etc.

original: yang yin ba lta bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang yin ba lta bu ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the origin of pleasure is pleasure itself.

original: phyogs dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni cha shas dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyul la khyab pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyogs dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni cha shas dang bcas pa'i phyir ro // yul la khyab pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is with parts because it is divisible.

original: phyogs rnams su lus kyis rgyas pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyul nye bar bstan du rung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyogs rnams su lus kyis rgyas pa'i phyir ro // yul nye bar bstan du rung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It pervades the field because it extends throughout the body.

original: phyogs che ge mo zhig na'o zhes bstan par nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs che ge mo zhig na'o zhes bstan par nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is suitable to be indicated as a location because it can be indicated as being in a certain direction.

original: yul spyod yul du gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phyogs 'ga' zhig na 'dug par dmigs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul spyod yul du gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phyogs 'ga' zhig na 'dug par dmigs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are objects that are the domain of activity means that they are perceived as existing in a certain place.

original: gnyis spyod yul du mtshungs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnyis spyod yul du mtshungs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because they are the same domain of activity means that

original: sems can gnyis kyis mtshungs par dmigs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: sems can gnyis kyis mtshungs par dmigs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ;
