translated: they are perceived as the same by two sentient beings.

original: / gzugs can ma yin pa ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: / gzugs can ma yin pa ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: This is not so for the formless.

original: ji lta bdag gis mngon pa bzhin du gzhan dag gis shes par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'brel ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji lta bdag gis mngon pa bzhin du gzhan dag gis shes par mi nus pa'i phyir ro // 'brel ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because others cannot know it as it is known by oneself.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yang brgyud pas gzugs can nyid do /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yang brgyud pas gzugs can nyid do /
translated: Because of their connection means that eye consciousness and so on are also form by way of a continuum.

original: dbang po gzugs can dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrjes su 'brel pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dbang po gzugs can dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro // rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because they are connected to physical sense faculties.

original: gzugs med pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams la gzugs kyi sa bon rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams la gzugs kyi sa bon rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are related means that the seeds of form are related to ordinary beings in the formless realm.

original: rab tu rtog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab tu rtog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because of their conception means that

original: rtog pa rnams dmigs pa la rab tu rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa rnams dmigs pa la rab tu rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because thoughts thoroughly investigate their objects.

original: gnod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because they are harmed,

original: phung po lnga po dag lag pa la sogs pas kun du reg pa dang / mya ngan la sogs pas ji ltar mthun mthun du gnod par bya ba yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phung po lnga po dag lag pa la sogs pas kun du reg pa dang / mya ngan la sogs pas ji ltar mthun mthun du gnod par bya ba yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: means that the five aggregates are harmed by contact with hands, feet, etc., and by grief, etc., as is fitting.

original: go bar byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: go bar byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because they cause understanding,

original: bstan pas don la rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan pas don la rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: means that the meaning is understood through the teaching.

original: bsags pa rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsags pa rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because they are established as accumulations,

original: rdul phra mo las gong ma'i gzugs cha shas dang bcas par rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra mo las gong ma'i gzugs cha shas dang bcas par rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: means that form is established as having parts, above the level of atoms.

original: phyi rol du bltas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyi rol du bltas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because they face outward,

original: 'dod pa na sbyong pa'i gzugs 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la sred pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa na sbyong pa'i gzugs 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la sred pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: means that form in the realm of desire arises from craving for the five sense-qualities.

original: nang du bltas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nang du bltas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because they face inward,üîΩmeans that form in the realm of form does not arise from craving for the five sense-qualities.

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i gzugs snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems sred pa las byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i gzugs snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems sred pa las byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: because the form of the form realm is the mind of meditative attainment that arises from craving.

original: de'i phyir 'di yid las 'byung ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di yid las 'byung ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that form arises from mind.

original: rgyun ring ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyun ring ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it is long-lasting means

original: so so'i skye bo'i gzugs kyi sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i @146b mu rnam par gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i gzugs kyi sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i @146b mu rnam par gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that the form of ordinary beings has no end or beginning, and no end or beginning in the future.

original: yongs su chad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yongs su chad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it is limited means

original: slob pa'i gzugs 'khor ba'i mthar phyin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slob pa'i gzugs 'khor ba'i mthar phyin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that the form of trainees reaches the end of sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: de'i dus kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i dus kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it is momentary means

original: mi slob pa'i gzugs da ltar byung ba'i srid pa tsam zhig lus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i gzugs da ltar byung ba'i srid pa tsam zhig lus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that the form of non-trainees is only the present existence.

original: nges par bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nges par bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it is demonstrated means

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i gzugs ni kun du ston pa tsam du zad kyi grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i gzugs ni kun du ston pa tsam du zad kyi grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that the form of buddhas and so on is only demonstrated and not established.

original: thams cad kyang gzugs can no //
analyzed: thams cad kyang gzugs can no //
translated: All of them have form.

original: yang na ci rigs su sbyar ro //üîΩde la thams cad kyang gzugs can no zhes pa ni /
analyzed: yang na ci rigs su sbyar ro // de la thams cad kyang gzugs can no zhes pa ni /
translated: Or else, they are to be connected in any way that is suitable.

original: gnod par bya ba'i gzugs can gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod par bya ba'i gzugs can gyi phyir ro //
translated: In this regard, all are material because they are the material that is harmed.

original: lhag ma rnams ni ci rigs par rig par bya'o /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni ci rigs par rig par bya'o /
translated: The rest are to be understood according to what is suitable.

original: phyi rol du bltas pa la sogs pa gzugs can gyi rab tu dbye ba drug ni /
analyzed: phyi rol du bltas pa la sogs pa gzugs can gyi rab tu dbye ba drug ni /
translated: The six divisions of the material, such as those that are directed externally, etc.,

original: tshor ba la sogs pa dang thun mong bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa dang thun mong bar rig par bya'o //
translated: are to be understood as common to the material and the immaterial.

original: bdag la gzugs can du mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la gzugs can du mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to abandon attachment to a material self.

original: ji ltar na gzugs can ma yin /üîΩgzugs can ma yin ba rnams ni du /
analyzed: ji ltar na gzugs can ma yin / gzugs can ma yin ba rnams ni du /
translated: How many are immaterial?üîΩWith what aim is that which is immaterial investigated?

original: ci'i phyir gzugs can ma yin par brtag / gzugs can las bzlog pa ni gzugs can ma yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzugs can ma yin par brtag / gzugs can las bzlog pa ni gzugs can ma yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: That which is the opposite of material should be understood as immaterial.

original: thams cad kyang gzugs can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang gzugs can ma yin pa'o //
translated: All are immaterial.

original: yang na ci rigs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na ci rigs su sbyar ro //
translated: Or else, they are to be connected in any way that is suitable.

original: bdag la gzugs can ma yin par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la gzugs can ma yin par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to abandon attachment to an immaterial self.

original: thams cad ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i gzugs dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i gzugs dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All are related to form that is not derived from the elements.

original: ji ltar na bstan yod /
analyzed: ji ltar na bstan yod /
translated: What is having an object?

original: bstan yod rnams ni du /
analyzed: bstan yod rnams ni du /
translated: How many have an object?üîΩFor what purpose is that which has an object investigated?

original: ci'i phyir bstan yod du brtag / mig gi yul ni bstan yod do //
analyzed: ci'i phyir bstan yod du brtag / mig gi yul ni bstan yod do //
translated: The object of the eye is that which has an object.

original: lhag ma'i rab tu dbye ba ni gzugs can yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma'i rab tu dbye ba ni gzugs can yin no //
translated: The rest are classified as having form.

original: ji ltar rig par gzugs de'i bdag nyid ces pa rgya cher gzugs can la bshad pa de ltar bstan yod de'i bdag nyid ni bstan du yod pa zhes rgya cher sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rig par gzugs de'i bdag nyid ces pa rgya cher gzugs can la bshad pa de ltar bstan yod de'i bdag nyid ni bstan du yod pa zhes rgya cher sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Just as it is said that form is the essence of that which is to be known, so too that which has an object should be understood as the essence of that which has an object.

original: thams cad kyang bstan yod do //
analyzed: thams cad kyang bstan yod do //
translated: All are that which has an object.

original: yang na ci rigs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na ci rigs su sbyar ro //
translated: Or else, they are to be connected according to the case.

original: de la thams cad kyang bstan du yod pa ni /
analyzed: de la thams cad kyang bstan du yod pa ni /
translated: All are that which has an object.

original: bstan du yod pa dang 'brel ba la sogs pas gzugs can ma yin pa rnams kyang bstan du yod ces sbyar ro //
analyzed: bstan du yod pa dang 'brel ba la sogs pas gzugs can ma yin pa rnams kyang bstan du yod ces sbyar ro //
translated: That which has an object is connected with that which has an object, etc.

original: bdag mig gi yul du mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //üîΩji ltar na bstan med /
analyzed: bdag mig gi yul du mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar na bstan med /
translated: In order to abandon attachment to the self as the object of the eye.üîΩWhat is not having an object?

original: bstan med rnams ni du /
analyzed: bstan med rnams ni du /
translated: How many are not having an object?üîΩFor what purpose is that which is not having an object investigated?

original: ci'i phyir bstan @147a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir bstan @147a * //
translated: Why is it investigated?

original: med du brtag / bstan yod pas bzlog pa ni bstan med du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: med du brtag / bstan yod pas bzlog pa ni bstan med du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Because of the existence of the demonstrable, the opposite of the demonstrable is to be seen as the non-demonstrable.

original: thams cad kyang bstan med do //
analyzed: thams cad kyang bstan med do //
translated: All are non-demonstrable.

original: yang na ci rigs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na ci rigs su sbyar ro //
translated: Or else, it is to be connected with each one.

original: bdag mig gi yul ma yin pa la mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //üîΩji ltar na thogs bcas /
analyzed: bdag mig gi yul ma yin pa la mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar na thogs bcas /
translated: In order to abandon attachment to the self as not being an object of the eye.üîΩWhat is the resistant?

original: thogs bcas rnams ni du /
analyzed: thogs bcas rnams ni du /
translated: How many are resistant?üîΩWith what aim is the resistant investigated?

original: ci'i phyir thogs bcas su brtag / bstan du yod pa gang de thogs bcas kyang ngo //
analyzed: ci'i phyir thogs bcas su brtag / bstan du yod pa gang de thogs bcas kyang ngo //
translated: That which is demonstrable is also resistant.

original: yang rnam pa gsum gyis thogs bcas su blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gsum gyis thogs bcas su blta bar bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the resistant should be understood as threefold:

original: rigs dang / rgyas pa dang / yongs su sbyong ba ma byas pas kyang ngo //
analyzed: rigs dang / rgyas pa dang / yongs su sbyong ba ma byas pas kyang ngo //
translated: by its nature, by its extension, and by its lack of purification.

original: de la rigs ni gang phan tshun sgrib par byed pa dang / bsgrib par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la rigs ni gang phan tshun sgrib par byed pa dang / bsgrib par bya ba'o //
translated: Among them, by its nature, the resistant is that which mutually obstructs and is obstructed.

original: 'gro ba'i gegs byed pa'i phyir sgrib par byed pa zhes de tsam du bstan pas so //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i gegs byed pa'i phyir sgrib par byed pa zhes de tsam du bstan pas so //
translated: Because it is an obstacle to the movement of the others, it is called obstructive.

original: bsgrib par bya ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gis 'od la sogs pa'i gzugs thogs pa dang bcas par rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir te /üîΩde ni bsgrib par bya ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: bsgrib par bya ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gis 'od la sogs pa'i gzugs thogs pa dang bcas par rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir te / de ni bsgrib par bya ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: It is obscured,

original: sgrib par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sgrib par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not an obscurer.

original: 'di ni de'i rigs te /
analyzed: 'di ni de'i rigs te /
translated: This is its class,

original: 'di ni de'i rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni de'i rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: this is its nature.

original: de la rgyas pa ni rdul phra rab las gong ma'i'o //
analyzed: de la rgyas pa ni rdul phra rab las gong ma'i'o //
translated: Among these, the extended is the form above the atom.

original: rdul phra rab gcig ni thogs pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab gcig ni thogs pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a single atom is without resistance.

original: de la yongs su sbyong ba ma byas pa ni gang ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang gis ma bsgyur ba'i gzugs so //
analyzed: de la yongs su sbyong ba ma byas pa ni gang ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang gis ma bsgyur ba'i gzugs so //
translated: Among these, the unextended is the form not transformed by concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang gis bsgyur ba'i gzugs thogs pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang gis bsgyur ba'i gzugs thogs pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the form transformed by concentration is without resistance,

original: sems mnyam pa'i lha bzhin no //
analyzed: sems mnyam pa'i lha bzhin no //
translated: like the form of a god of equal measure of mind.

original: rdul yang rab tu 'khrugs pa'i gzhi'i gnas yin pas thogs pa dang bcas par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdul yang rab tu 'khrugs pa'i gzhi'i gnas yin pas thogs pa dang bcas par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The atom should be seen as resistant because it is the basis of the disturbance of the atoms.

original: gnas sam dmigs pa gang las 'dod chags dang zhe sdang skye ba'o //
analyzed: gnas sam dmigs pa gang las 'dod chags dang zhe sdang skye ba'o //
translated: The object or basis of attachment and hostility.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i don 'dis ni /
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i don 'dis ni /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúresistance‚Äù is as follows:

original: thams cad kyang thogs bcas so //
analyzed: thams cad kyang thogs bcas so //
translated: All are resistant.

original: yang na ci rigs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na ci rigs su sbyar ro //
translated: Or else, as the case may be.

original: lhag ma rnams kyis so //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyis so //
translated: The rest are not so.

original: bdag thams cad du song ba ma yin pa mngon bar zhen pa spong ba'i phyir ro //üîΩji ltar na thogs med ;
analyzed: bdag thams cad du song ba ma yin pa mngon bar zhen pa spong ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar na thogs med ;
translated: The idea that the self extends everywhere is eliminated.üîΩWhat is nonresistant?

original: thogs med rnams ni du /
analyzed: thogs med rnams ni du /
translated: How many are nonresistant?üîΩWith what aim is that which is nonresistant investigated?

original: ci'i phyir thogs med du brtag / thogs bcas las bzlog pa ni thogs med do //
analyzed: ci'i phyir thogs med du brtag / thogs bcas las bzlog pa ni thogs med do //
translated: The opposite of resistant is nonresistant.

original: thams cad kyang thogs med do //
analyzed: thams cad kyang thogs med do //
translated: All are nonresistant.

original: yang na ci rigs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na ci rigs su sbyar ro //
translated: Or else, as the case may be.

original: bdag la thams cad du song ba por mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //üîΩji ltar na zag @147b bcas ;
analyzed: bdag la thams cad du song ba por mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar na zag @147b bcas ;
translated: The idea that the self is all-pervading is eliminated.üîΩWhat is impure?

original: zag bcas rnams ni du /
analyzed: zag bcas rnams ni du /
translated: How many are impure?üîΩWith what aim is that which is impure investigated?

original: ci'i phyir zag bcas su brtag / zag pa de'i bdag nyid dang / zag pa rnams dang bcas pa nyid de /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zag bcas su brtag / zag pa de'i bdag nyid dang / zag pa rnams dang bcas pa nyid de /
translated: That which is itself a contaminant and that which is associated with the contaminants.

original: zag pa'i ngo bo nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa'i ngo bo nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the intrinsic reality of the contaminants.

original: zag pa de dang 'brel ba dang / de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang / mig la sogs pa zag pa dang bcas pa dang / gnas yin pa'i phyir go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: zag pa de dang 'brel ba dang / de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang / mig la sogs pa zag pa dang bcas pa dang / gnas yin pa'i phyir go rims bzhin no //
translated: The mind and mental factors that are related to those contaminants, and the contaminated eye, etc., are contaminated because they are the basis of the contaminants.

original: zag pas bcings pa dang / de dag gi dbang gis dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kyang yang srid pa 'grub par byed pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: zag pas bcings pa dang / de dag gi dbang gis dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kyang yang srid pa 'grub par byed pa'i phyir ro /
translated: The contaminated wholesome states are contaminated because they are bound by the contaminants and because they establish a new existence through the power of the contaminants.

original: zag pa'i rjes su 'brel pa dang / sa pa gzhan gyi zag pa'i gnas ngan len dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa'i rjes su 'brel pa dang / sa pa gzhan gyi zag pa'i gnas ngan len dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The uncontaminated states are related to the contaminants because they are associated with the negative reflex actions of the contaminants of the other stages.

original: zag pa'i rjes su mthun pa dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len dang ldan du zin kyang /
analyzed: zag pa'i rjes su mthun pa dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len dang ldan du zin kyang /
translated: The states that are conducive to penetrative insight are related to the contaminants because, although they are associated with the negative reflex actions of the mental afflictions,

original: zag pa med pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir te /
translated: they are still established as uncontaminated.

original: srid pa thams cad la rgyab kyis bltas pas de'i gnyen po la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa thams cad la rgyab kyis bltas pas de'i gnyen po la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they turn their back on all existence, they rely on the antidote to existence.

original: zag pa'i rgyu las byung pa'i phyir zag bcas su blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa'i rgyu las byung pa'i phyir zag bcas su blta bar bya'o //
translated: They should be regarded as contaminated because they arise from the cause of contamination.

original: dgra bcom pa rnams kyi phung po rnams ni tshe rabs snga ma'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams kyi phung po rnams ni tshe rabs snga ma'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The aggregates of the arhats arise from the defilements of previous lives.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams dang / khams bco lnga dang / tha ma'i gsum ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams dang / khams bco lnga dang / tha ma'i gsum ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The five appropriated aggregates, fifteen elements, and three of the last group.

original: skye mched bcu dang tha ma'i gnyis ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched bcu dang tha ma'i gnyis ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: Ten sense spheres, and two of the last group.

original: khams gsum dang / skye mched gnyis kyi phyogs ni zag bcas rnams so //
analyzed: khams gsum dang / skye mched gnyis kyi phyogs ni zag bcas rnams so //
translated: The three realms and two of the sense spheres are contaminated.

original: 'phags pa'i lam 'khor dang bcas pa dang / 'dus ma byas ma gtogs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam 'khor dang bcas pa dang / 'dus ma byas ma gtogs so //
translated: Except for the noble path and its concomitants and the unconditioned.

original: bdag zag bcas su mngon bar zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //üîΩji ltar na zag med /
analyzed: bdag zag bcas su mngon bar zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar na zag med /
translated: In order to abandon attachment to a contaminated self.üîΩWhat is uncontaminated?

original: zag med rnams ni du /
analyzed: zag med rnams ni du /
translated: How many are uncontaminated?üîΩWith what aim is that which is uncontaminated investigated?

original: ci'i phyir zag med du brtag / zag bcas las log pa ni zag med du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zag med du brtag / zag bcas las log pa ni zag med du blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as the opposite of that which is related to the outflows.üîΩIt is the five aggregates which are not liable to be grasped, three elements, two spheres,

original: nye bar len pa med pa'i phung po lnga rnams dang / khams gsum dang / skye mched gnyis kyi phyogs so //
analyzed: nye bar len pa med pa'i phung po lnga rnams dang / khams gsum dang / skye mched gnyis kyi phyogs so //
translated: and also part of the other three elements and of the other two spheres.

original: bdag zag pa dang bral bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag zag pa dang bral bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is investigated with the aim of abandoning at¬≠ tachment to a self free from the outflows.

original: ji ltar na 'thab bcas /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'thab bcas /
translated: What is the contentious?

original: 'thab bcas rnams ni du /üîΩci'i phyir 'thab bcas su brtag / ngo bo'i 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la brten nas mtshon @148a * //
analyzed: 'thab bcas rnams ni du / ci'i phyir 'thab bcas su brtag / ngo bo'i 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la brten nas mtshon @148a * //
translated: How many are contentious?üîΩWith what aim is the contentious investigated?

original: cha len pa dang / dbyig pa len pa dang / 'thab pa dang / mtshang 'dru ba dang / rtsod pa dang / 'gyed pa rnams 'byung ba /
analyzed: cha len pa dang / dbyig pa len pa dang / 'thab pa dang / mtshang 'dru ba dang / rtsod pa dang / 'gyed pa rnams 'byung ba /
translated: The contentious should be understood as the taking up of weapons, sticks, quarrels, disputes, contention, strife and all sorts of actions arising from attachment, hatred and delusion.

original: mtshon cha len pa la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: mtshon cha len pa la sogs pa ni /
translated: The taking up of weapons, sticks, etc.

original: 'thab pa ste /
analyzed: 'thab pa ste /
translated: is contention.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni rgyu yin pas 'thab pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni rgyu yin pas 'thab pa'o //
translated: Attachment, etc. are the causes of contention.

original: de'i bdag nyid dang / de dang 'brel pa dang / des bcings pa dang / de'i rjes su 'brel ba dang / de'i rjes su mthun pa dang / de'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir 'thab bcas su blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang / de dang 'brel pa dang / des bcings pa dang / de'i rjes su 'brel ba dang / de'i rjes su mthun pa dang / de'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir 'thab bcas su blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that they are accompanied by conflict because they are by nature, associated with, bound to, connected with, in conformity with, and caused by conflict.

original: zag bcas ji snyed par 'thab bcas kyang de snyed do //
analyzed: zag bcas ji snyed par 'thab bcas kyang de snyed do //
translated: There is the same number of things that are accompanied by conflict as there is of impure things.

original: de'i rjes su 'brel bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'brel bar rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood as being connected with conflict.

original: bdag 'thab pa dang bcas par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag 'thab pa dang bcas par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The object of the view that the self is accompanied by conflict is to be abandoned.

original: ji ltar na 'thab med /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'thab med /
translated: What is without conflict?

original: 'thab med rnams ni du /
analyzed: 'thab med rnams ni du /
translated: How many are without conflict?

original: ci'i phyir 'thab med du brtag /'thab bcas las bzlog pa ni 'thab med du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'thab med du brtag /'thab bcas las bzlog pa ni 'thab med du blta bar bya'o //
translated: With what aim is that which is without conflict investigated? That which is without conflict should be understood in the opposite sense to that which is accompanied by conflict.

original: zag med ji snyed par 'thab med kyang de snyed do //
analyzed: zag med ji snyed par 'thab med kyang de snyed do //
translated: There is the same number of things that are without conflict as there is of pure things.

original: bdag 'thab pa dang bral bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //üîΩji ltar na dug bcas /
analyzed: bdag 'thab pa dang bral bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar na dug bcas /
translated: The object of the view that the self is without conflict is to be abandoned.üîΩWhat is accompanied by taint?

original: dug bcas rnams ni du /
analyzed: dug bcas rnams ni du /
translated: How many are accompanied by taint?

original: ci'i phyir dug bcas su brtag / ngo bo 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gang la brten nas /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dug bcas su brtag / ngo bo 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gang la brten nas /
translated: They are the causes of poison because they are the roots of attachment, hatred, and delusion,

original: yang srid pa'i yul la lhag bar chags pa /üîΩyang srid pa la lhag par chags pa'i gnas 'dod chags la sogs pa ni dug bcas kyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: yang srid pa'i yul la lhag bar chags pa / yang srid pa la lhag par chags pa'i gnas 'dod chags la sogs pa ni dug bcas kyi rgyu'o //
translated: and because they are the causes of the attachment to existence that is the object of future rebirth.

original: yang srid pa la lhag par chags pa'i rgyu nyid zhe sdang ji lta bu ste /üîΩrnam par byang ba'i chos la zhe sdang bas /
analyzed: yang srid pa la lhag par chags pa'i rgyu nyid zhe sdang ji lta bu ste / rnam par byang ba'i chos la zhe sdang bas /
translated: How is hatred the cause of the attachment to existence?

original: yang srid pa la lhag par chags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang srid pa la lhag par chags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because hatred for the factors of purification causes one to cling to existence.

original: de'i bdag nyid dang de dang 'brel pa dang / des bcings pa dang / de'i rjes su 'brel ba dang / de'i rjes su mthun pa dang / de'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir dug bcas su blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang de dang 'brel pa dang / des bcings pa dang / de'i rjes su 'brel ba dang / de'i rjes su mthun pa dang / de'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir dug bcas su blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should understand that they are called ‚Äúwith poison‚Äù because they are of the nature of poison, they are related to poison, they are bound by poison, they are connected with poison, they are consistent with poison, and they arise from the cause of poison.

original: 'thab bcas ji snyed par dug bcas kyang de snyed do //
analyzed: 'thab bcas ji snyed par dug bcas kyang de snyed do //
translated: As many as are with conflict are also with poison.

original: bdag dug dang ldan par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dug dang ldan par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a poisonous self.

original: ji ltar na dug med /
analyzed: ji ltar na dug med /
translated: How many are free from poison?

original: dug med rnams ni du /üîΩci'i phyir dug med du brtag / dug bcas las bzlog pa ni /
analyzed: dug med rnams ni du / ci'i phyir dug med du brtag / dug bcas las bzlog pa ni /
translated: All those that are free from poison.üîΩWith what aim is that which is free from poison investigated?

original: dug med du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dug med du blta bar bya'o //
translated: That which is free from poison should be understood as the opposite of that which is accompanied by poison.

original: 'thab med ji snyed par dug med kyang de snyed do //
analyzed: 'thab med ji snyed par dug med kyang de snyed do //
translated: There are as many that are free from poison as there are that are accompanied by poison.

original: bdag dug dang bral bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dug dang bral bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self free from poison.

original: ji ltar na zhen rten /
analyzed: ji ltar na zhen rten /
translated: How many are bases of attachment?

original: zhen rten rnams ni du /
analyzed: zhen rten rnams ni du /
translated: All those that are bases of attachment.üîΩWith what aim is that which is a base of attachment investigated?üîΩThat which is a base of attachment is that which is the basis of attachment, hatred and delusion.

original: @148b ci'i phyir zhen rten du brtag / ngo bo 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gang la brten nas /
analyzed: @148b ci'i phyir zhen rten du brtag / ngo bo 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gang la brten nas /
translated: What is attachment?

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams la lhag par chags pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams la lhag par chags pa /
translated: It is the excessive desire for the five sense pleasures.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la lhag par chags pa'i rgyu yin pas zhen pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la lhag par chags pa'i rgyu yin pas zhen pa'o //
translated: It is attachment because it is the cause of excessive desire for the five sense pleasures.

original: zhe sdang ci 'dra ba zhig gis lhag par chags she na /
analyzed: zhe sdang ci 'dra ba zhig gis lhag par chags she na /
translated: What kind of hatred is excessive desire?

original: mngon par 'byung ba la zhe sdang bas so //
analyzed: mngon par 'byung ba la zhe sdang bas so //
translated: It is hatred for going forth.

original: de'i bdag nyid dang / de dang 'brel ba dang / des bcings pa dang / de'i rjes su 'brel ba dang / de'i rjes su mthun pa dang / de'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir zhen rten du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang / de dang 'brel ba dang / des bcings pa dang / de'i rjes su 'brel ba dang / de'i rjes su mthun pa dang / de'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir zhen rten du blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as the basis of attachment because it is of the nature of attachment, it is related to attachment, it is bound by attachment, it is associated with attachment, it is in conformity with attachment, and it arises from the cause of attachment.

original: dug bcas ji snyed par zhen rten kyang de snyed do //
analyzed: dug bcas ji snyed par zhen rten kyang de snyed do //
translated: There are as many bases of attachment as there are poisons.

original: bdag la zhen pa dang ldan par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la zhen pa dang ldan par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The investigation of the basis of attachment should be understood as the remedy for the belief in a self endowed with attachment.

original: ji ltar na mngon 'byung rten pa /
analyzed: ji ltar na mngon 'byung rten pa /
translated: What is the basis of non-attachment?

original: mngon 'byung rten pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: mngon 'byung rten pa rnams ni du /
translated: How many are bases of non-attachment?

original: ci'i phyir mngon 'byung rten par brtag / zhen pa rten ba las bzlog pa ni mngon 'byung rten par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir mngon 'byung rten par brtag / zhen pa rten ba las bzlog pa ni mngon 'byung rten par blta bar bya'o //
translated: With what aim is the basis of non-attachment investigated? The basis of non-attachment should be understood in the opposite sense to the basis of attachment.

original: dug med pa ni ji snyed par mngon 'byung rten pa 'ong de snyed do //
analyzed: dug med pa ni ji snyed par mngon 'byung rten pa 'ong de snyed do //
translated: There are as many bases of non-attachment as there are non-poisons.

original: bdag zhen pa dang bral bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //üîΩji ltar na 'dus byas /
analyzed: bdag zhen pa dang bral bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar na 'dus byas /
translated: The investigation of the basis of non-attachment should be understood as the remedy for the belief in a self free from attachment.üîΩWhat is the conditioned?

original: 'dus byas rnams ni du /
analyzed: 'dus byas rnams ni du /
translated: How many are conditioned?

original: ci'i phyir 'dus byas su brtag / gang la skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba de 'dus byas su blta bar bya'o//
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dus byas su brtag / gang la skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba de 'dus byas su blta bar bya'o//
translated: That which arises, passes away, and endures while changing is to be regarded as conditioned.

original: chos kyi khams dang / skye mched kyi phyogs gcig ma gtogs pa thams cad kyang 'dus byas so //
analyzed: chos kyi khams dang / skye mched kyi phyogs gcig ma gtogs pa thams cad kyang 'dus byas so //
translated: All except for one part of the element of mental objects and of the sense-field of mental objects are conditioned.

original: bdag mi rtag par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag mi rtag par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self which is not permanent.

original: ji ltar na 'dus ma byas /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'dus ma byas /
translated: What is unconditioned?

original: 'dus ma byas rnams ni du /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas rnams ni du /
translated: How many are unconditioned?

original: ci'i phyir 'dus ma byas su brtag /'dus byas las bzlog pa ni 'dus ma byas su blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dus ma byas su brtag /'dus byas las bzlog pa ni 'dus ma byas su blta bar bya'o //
translated: With what aim is the unconditioned investigated? The unconditioned should be understood as the opposite of the conditioned.

original: chos kyi khams dang / skye mched kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: chos kyi khams dang / skye mched kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: One part of the element of mental objects and of the sense-field of mental objects.

original: bdag rtag par mngon bar zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //üîΩnye bar len pa'i phung po ma yin pa rnams 'dus byas su zhes brjod par bya 'am /üîΩ'dus ma byas zhes brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: bdag rtag par mngon bar zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro // nye bar len pa'i phung po ma yin pa rnams 'dus byas su zhes brjod par bya 'am / 'dus ma byas zhes brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a permanent self.üîΩShould that which is not included in the appropriating aggregates be called conditioned or unconditioned?

original: 'dus byas su brjod par mi bya la /
analyzed: 'dus byas su brjod par mi bya la /
translated: It should not be said that it is conditioned.

original: 'dus ma byas su'ang brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas su'ang brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: It should not be said to be conditioned or unconditioned.

original: de ci'i phyir /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir /
translated: Why is that?

original: las dang nyon mongs pas mngon par 'dus ma byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩ'dus byas su brjod par mi bya la 'dod pa bzhin du byed pas mngon du phyogs pa dang rgyab @149a * //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pas mngon par 'dus ma byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro // 'dus byas su brjod par mi bya la 'dod pa bzhin du byed pas mngon du phyogs pa dang rgyab @149a * //
translated: Because it is not produced by karma and afflictions.

original: kyis blta ba'i dngos po nyid kyi phyir 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kyis blta ba'i dngos po nyid kyi phyir 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should not be said to be conditioned, but it should be understood that it is not unconditioned because it has the nature of turning toward and turning away according to one‚Äôs wishes.

original: 'dod pa bzhin du byed pas mngon du phyogs pa dang / rgyab kyis blta ba ni 'dus ma byas la mi srid de /
analyzed: 'dod pa bzhin du byed pas mngon du phyogs pa dang / rgyab kyis blta ba ni 'dus ma byas la mi srid de /
translated: Turning toward and turning away according to one‚Äôs wishes is not possible for the unconditioned.

original: rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is permanent.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
translated: The Blessed One also said:

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba 'di ni gnyis so gang gsungs pa de ji lta bu /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba 'di ni gnyis so gang gsungs pa de ji lta bu /
translated: ‚ÄúConditioned and unconditioned‚Äù ‚Äî this is a duality.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas gnyis las gud na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas gnyis las gud na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But since there is nothing apart from the conditioned and unconditioned,

original: don gang gis 'dus byas su gyur pa'i don de 'dus ma byas ma yin no //
analyzed: don gang gis 'dus byas su gyur pa'i don de 'dus ma byas ma yin no //
translated: the meaning of conditioned is not the meaning of unconditioned.

original: don gang gis 'dus ma byas su 'gyur ba'i don de nyid kyis 'dus byas ma yin te /
analyzed: don gang gis 'dus ma byas su 'gyur ba'i don de nyid kyis 'dus byas ma yin te /
translated: The same meaning that makes it unconditioned makes it uncompounded.

original: tshul 'di ni 'dir blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshul 'di ni 'dir blta bar bya'o //
translated: This method should be understood here.

original: 'dod pa bzhin du byed pas mngon du phyogs pa dang / rgyab kyis blta ba'i phyir 'dus byas nyid du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa bzhin du byed pas mngon du phyogs pa dang / rgyab kyis blta ba'i phyir 'dus byas nyid du brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be called conditioned because it is directed toward and turned away from according to desire.

original: las dang nyon mongs pas mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'dus ma byas nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pas mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir ro // 'dus ma byas nyid ces bya ste /
translated: It is called unconditioned because it is not directly produced by karma and the afflictions.

original: gnyis las gung na med par brjod do //
analyzed: gnyis las gung na med par brjod do //
translated: It is called unconditioned because it is not conditioned by the two.üîΩHow is it mundane?üîΩMundane is twofold:

original: ji ltar na 'jig rten pa /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'jig rten pa /
translated: Mundane is twofold: mundane and supramundane.üîΩMundane is twofold: mundane and supramundane.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams ni du /
translated: Mundane is twofold: mundane and supramundane.üîΩMundane is twofold: mundane and supramundane.üîΩMundane is twofold: mundane and supramundane.üîΩMundane is twofold: mundane and supramundane.

original: ci'i phyir 'jig rten par brtag / khams gsum par brtags pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes la thob pa de ltar snang ba yang 'jig rten pa'o //üîΩde ltar snang ba zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'jig rten par brtag / khams gsum par brtags pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes la thob pa de ltar snang ba yang 'jig rten pa'o // de ltar snang ba zhes pa ni /
translated: Mundane is twofold: mundane and supramundane.üîΩMundane is twofold: mundane and supramundane.üîΩMundane is twofold: mundane and supramundane.üîΩMundane is twofold: mundane and supramundane.üîΩMundane is twofold: mundane and supramundane.üîΩMundane is twofold: mundane and supramundane.üîΩMundane is twofold: mundane and supramundane.üîΩMundane is twofold: mundane and supramundane.üîΩMundane is twofold: mundane and supramundane.üîΩMundane is twofold: mundane and supramundane.üîΩMundane is twofold: mundane and supramundane.üîΩMundane is twofold: mundane and supramundane.üîΩMundane is twofold: mundane and supramundane.üîΩMundane is twofold: mundane and supramundane.üîΩMundane is twofold: mundane and supramundane.üîΩMundane is twofold: mundane and supramundane.üîΩMundane is twofold: mundane and supramundane.üîΩMundane is twofold: mundane and supramundane.üîΩMundane is twofold: mundane and supramundane.üîΩMundane is twofold: mundane and supramundane.üîΩMundane is twofold: mundane and supramundane.üîΩMundane is twofold: mundane and supramundane.üîΩMundane is twofold: mundane and supramundane.üîΩMundane is twofold: mundane and supramundane.üîΩMundane is twofold: mundane and supramundane.

original: khams gsum par gtogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum par gtogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Mundane is twofold: mundane and supramundane.üîΩMundane is twofold: mundane and sup

original: de bzhin nyid la sogs par snang ba ni gcig tu ma 'dres pa'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la sogs par snang ba ni gcig tu ma 'dres pa'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: The appearance of suchness, etc., is supramundane because it is not mixed with the mundane.

original: phung po rnams kyi phyogs gcig dang / yang dag pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa dang / rjes la thob pa 'jig rten las 'das par snang ba ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi phyogs gcig dang / yang dag pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa dang / rjes la thob pa 'jig rten las 'das par snang ba ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: It is not included in the aggregates, it is included in the correct path, and it is the supramundane appearance that is attained subsequently.

original: de dag dang 'dus ma byas ma gtogs pa ni /
analyzed: de dag dang 'dus ma byas ma gtogs pa ni /
translated: Except for those and the unconditioned,

original: khams bco lnga dang / skye mched bcu dang / khams gsum dang / skye mched gnyis kyi phyogs so //
analyzed: khams bco lnga dang / skye mched bcu dang / khams gsum dang / skye mched gnyis kyi phyogs so //
translated: the fifteen elements, ten spheres, three elements, and two spheres are included in the mundane.

original: bdag la 'jig rten du mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la 'jig rten du mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self which is mundane.

original: ji ltar na 'jig rten las 'das pa /üîΩ'jig rten las 'das pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'jig rten las 'das pa / 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams ni du /
translated: How many are supramundane?üîΩWith what aim is that which is supramundane investigated?

original: ci'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das par brtag / khams gsum pa'i gnyen po rnam par mi rtog pa ni /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das par brtag / khams gsum pa'i gnyen po rnam par mi rtog pa ni /
translated: That which is supramundane should be understood as the antidote to the three realms, as non-discrimination,üîΩas the path of seeing and the path of cultivation,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
translated: as the attainment of the fruit, and as the supramundane path.

original: phyin ci log dang / spros pa med pa'i rnam par mi rtog pas na rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log dang / spros pa med pa'i rnam par mi rtog pas na rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is non-conceptual because it is free from the four misconceptions and free from conceptual elaboration.

original: khams gsum @149b pa'i gnyen po rnam par mi rtog pa ni 'phags pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: khams gsum @149b pa'i gnyen po rnam par mi rtog pa ni 'phags pa'i lam mo //
translated: The non-conceptual antidote to the three realms is the noble path.

original: de yang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni rtag pa la sogs pa phyin ci log bzhi'i gnyen po yin pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de yang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni rtag pa la sogs pa phyin ci log bzhi'i gnyen po yin pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: Moreover, that of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas is supramundane because it is the antidote to the four misconceptions such as permanence.

original: phyin ci log tu rnam par mi rtog pas na rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu rnam par mi rtog pas na rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: It is non-conceptual because it is free from the misconception of the four misconceptions.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gzugs la sogs pa spros pa'i chos thams cad kyi gnyen po yin pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gzugs la sogs pa spros pa'i chos thams cad kyi gnyen po yin pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: That of the bodhisattvas is supramundane because it is the antidote to all phenomena such as form that are conceptual elaborations.

original: spros pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pas rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: spros pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pas rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: It is non-conceptual because it is free from the conceptualization of conceptual elaboration.

original: 'dus ma byas ni rtog pa thams cad kyi gzhi'i gnas ma yin pas rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni rtog pa thams cad kyi gzhi'i gnas ma yin pas rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: The unconditioned is non-conceptual because it is not the basis or abode of all conceptualization.

original: yang rnams grangs kyis na /
analyzed: yang rnams grangs kyis na /
translated: Moreover, in terms of enumeration,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes la thob pa yang yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes la thob pa yang yin te /
translated: It is also a subsequently acquired supramundane cognition,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is based on the supramundane cognition.

original: phung po rnams dang // khams gsum dang / skye mched gnyis kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: phung po rnams dang // khams gsum dang / skye mched gnyis kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: It is related to the aggregates, to three elements and to two sense-spheres.

original: bdag 'ba' zhig tu mngon par zhen pa spang pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag 'ba' zhig tu mngon par zhen pa spang pa'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self which is only a collection.

original: ji ltar na byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar na byung ba /
translated: What is the past?

original: byung ba rnams ni du /
analyzed: byung ba rnams ni du /
translated: How many are past?

original: ci'i phyir byung bar brtag /'das pa dang da ltar byung ba ni byung ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir byung bar brtag /'das pa dang da ltar byung ba ni byung ba'o //
translated: With what aim is the past investigated? The past is that which has been produced and has perished.

original: thams cad ni phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: thams cad ni phyogs gcig go //
translated: All are partially past.

original: bdag ther zug ma yin par mngon par zhen pa spang pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag ther zug ma yin par mngon par zhen pa spang pa'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self which is permanent.

original: yang byung ba ni rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang byung ba ni rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi ste /
translated: Furthermore, the past is of twenty-four kinds:

original: dang po byung ba dang / rgyun gyis byung ba dang / rgyas pa las byung ba dang / rten byung ba dang / 'gyur ba dang / 'gyur ba byung ba dang / yongs su smin par byung ba dang / nyams par byung ba dang / khyad par du byung ba dang /
analyzed: dang po byung ba dang / rgyun gyis byung ba dang / rgyas pa las byung ba dang / rten byung ba dang / 'gyur ba dang / 'gyur ba byung ba dang / yongs su smin par byung ba dang / nyams par byung ba dang / khyad par du byung ba dang /
translated: The first is arising as origination, arising as continuity, arising as development, arising as support, arising as transformation, arising as transformation of transformation, arising as complete ripening, arising as degeneration, arising as distinction,

original: 'od gsal bar byung ba dang / 'od gsal ba ma yin par byung ba dang / kun du 'gro bas byung ba dang / sa bon dang bcas pa las byung ba dang / sa bon ma yin par byung ba dang / gzugs brnyan dang / dbang 'byor pa dang /
analyzed: 'od gsal bar byung ba dang / 'od gsal ba ma yin par byung ba dang / kun du 'gro bas byung ba dang / sa bon dang bcas pa las byung ba dang / sa bon ma yin par byung ba dang / gzugs brnyan dang / dbang 'byor pa dang /
translated: arising as clear light, arising as unclear light, arising as all-pervading, arising as having seeds, arising as seedless, arising as reflection, arising as mastery,

original: nges par bstan pa'i phyir byung ba dang / gcig nas gcig tu byung ba dang / skad cig zhig nas byung ba dang / phrad pa dang bral nas byung ba dang ; gnas skabs gzhan du byung ba dang / 'chi 'pho dang skye bas byung ba dang /
analyzed: nges par bstan pa'i phyir byung ba dang / gcig nas gcig tu byung ba dang / skad cig zhig nas byung ba dang / phrad pa dang bral nas byung ba dang ; gnas skabs gzhan du byung ba dang / 'chi 'pho dang skye bas byung ba dang /
translated: arising as definite teaching, arising as one after another, arising as momentary disintegration, arising as separation from contact, arising as a different state, arising as death and rebirth,üîΩand arising as the ultimate.

original: 'jig pa dang chags pas byung ba dang / sngon gyi dus na byung ba dang / 'chi ba'i dus na byung ba dang / bar du byung ba dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i dus na byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa dang chags pas byung ba dang / sngon gyi dus na byung ba dang / 'chi ba'i dus na byung ba dang / bar du byung ba dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i dus na byung ba'o //
translated: 5. that which arises at the time of rebirth.

original: de la dang po byung ba ni nyid @150a * //üîΩmtshams sbyor ba'i dus na'o //
analyzed: de la dang po byung ba ni nyid @150a * // mtshams sbyor ba'i dus na'o //
translated: Among these, the first is that which arises at the time of rebirth.

original: rgyun gyis byung ba ni de phyin chad do //
analyzed: rgyun gyis byung ba ni de phyin chad do //
translated: The second is that which arises in the interval, from the moment of rebirth up to the moment of death.

original: rgyas pa las byung ba ni nyal ba dang / zas dang / tshangs par spyod pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rgyas pa rnam pa bzhi'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa las byung ba ni nyal ba dang / zas dang / tshangs par spyod pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rgyas pa rnam pa bzhi'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
translated: The third is that which arises from development, which is the result of four kinds of development: sleep, food, celibacy, and meditative concentration.

original: rten byung ba ni nang gi dbang po'o //
analyzed: rten byung ba ni nang gi dbang po'o //
translated: The fourth is that which arises as a support, which is the internal sense organs.

original: 'gyur bar byung ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba 'byung ba na de dang mthun par dbang por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'gyur bar byung ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba 'byung ba na de dang mthun par dbang por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The fifth is that which arises as transformation, which is the transformation of the sense organs in accordance with the transformation of feelings such as pleasure.

original: yongs su smin par byung ba ni /
analyzed: yongs su smin par byung ba ni /
translated: The sixth is that which arises as maturity,

original: rgas pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: rgas pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: which is the period of aging.

original: nyams par byung ba ni bde 'gro nas shi 'phos te ngan 'gror skye ba'o //
analyzed: nyams par byung ba ni bde 'gro nas shi 'phos te ngan 'gror skye ba'o //
translated: The degenerated is the transmigration from a happy destiny to a miserable destiny.

original: khyad par du byung ba ni de las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par du byung ba ni de las bzlog pa'o //
translated: The special is the opposite of that.

original: 'od gsal bar byung ba ni rtse bas rab tu slu ba rnams dang / yid rab tu sun 'byin pa rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams dga' ba mang ba dang /
analyzed: 'od gsal bar byung ba ni rtse bas rab tu slu ba rnams dang / yid rab tu sun 'byin pa rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams dga' ba mang ba dang /
translated: The illuminated is the gods of the Contented, the Gods who Delight in Creation, the Gods who Delight in the Creations of Others, the gods of the realm of form and the gods of the formless realm, because they have much pleasure,

original: longs spyod dang / gnas pa la rang gis dbang bsgyur ba'i phyir te ci rigs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: longs spyod dang / gnas pa la rang gis dbang bsgyur ba'i phyir te ci rigs su sbyar ro //
translated: because they have mastery over their enjoyments and their abode, as the case may be.

original: 'od gsal ba ma yin par byung ba ni de las gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba ma yin par byung ba ni de las gzhan pa'o //
translated: The non-illuminated is the opposite of that.

original: kun du 'gro bas byung ba ni 'gro ba'i gnas skabs na'o //üîΩsa bon dang bcas pa las byung ba ni dgra bcom pa tha ma'i phung po ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: kun du 'gro bas byung ba ni 'gro ba'i gnas skabs na'o // sa bon dang bcas pa las byung ba ni dgra bcom pa tha ma'i phung po ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The universal is the state of the transmigrator.üîΩ The with seed is all the aggregates, with the exception of the last aggregates of the Arhat.

original: sa bon ma yin par byung ba ni phung po tha ma rnams so //
analyzed: sa bon ma yin par byung ba ni phung po tha ma rnams so //
translated: The without seed is the last aggregates of the Arhat.

original: gzugs brnyan dang / dbang 'byor pa dang / nges par bstan pa'i phyir byung ba ni shes bya'i dngos po dang mthun pa dang / rnam par thar pa las byung ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs te /üîΩgo rims bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan dang / dbang 'byor pa dang / nges par bstan pa'i phyir byung ba ni shes bya'i dngos po dang mthun pa dang / rnam par thar pa las byung ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs te / go rims bzhin no //
translated: The arising of the reflection, the arising of the mastery, and the arising of the teaching are, respectively, the arising of the thing that is the object of knowledge, the arising of the liberation, and the arising of the form of the Tathagata.

original: gcig nas gcig tu byung ba ni tshe rabs kyi rgyun no //
analyzed: gcig nas gcig tu byung ba ni tshe rabs kyi rgyun no //
translated: The arising of the continuity is the continuity of the life-stream.

original: skad cig zhig nas byung ba ni 'du byed rnams ni skad cig so so'o //
analyzed: skad cig zhig nas byung ba ni 'du byed rnams ni skad cig so so'o //
translated: The arising of the moment is the moment of each of the formations.üîΩThe arising of the transformation is the transformation of the desire realm, etc.

original: 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams skad cig gis dbang bsgyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams skad cig gis dbang bsgyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The arising of the mastery is the mastery of the gods of the desire realm, the gods who delight in creation, and the gods who control the creations of others, because they have mastery over the moment.

original: phrad pa dang bral nas byung ba ni sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / phrad pa dang bral ba'i gnas skabs dang / sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: phrad pa dang bral nas byung ba ni sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / phrad pa dang bral ba'i gnas skabs dang / sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: The arising of the separation is the separation from the pleasant, the unpleasant, and the separation from the union, and the state of being with passion and the state of being without passion.

original: gnas skabs gzhan du byung ba ni mer mer po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs rnams dang / nang la sogs pa'i gnas skabs rnams su'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan du byung ba ni mer mer po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs rnams dang / nang la sogs pa'i gnas skabs rnams su'o //
translated: The other states are the states of kalala, etc., and the states of the womb, etc.

original: 'chi 'pho @150b dang ; skye bas byung ba ni sems can gyi 'jig rten na'o //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho @150b dang ; skye bas byung ba ni sems can gyi 'jig rten na'o //
translated: The arising of death and birth is in the world of sentient beings.

original: 'jig pa dang chags pas byung ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: 'jig pa dang chags pas byung ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten no //
translated: The arising of dissolution and evolution is in the receptacle world.üîΩThe arising of the past is in the past time period.üîΩThe arising of the present is in the present time period.

original: sngon gyi dus na byung ba ni sngon gyi dus kyi srid pa'o //üîΩ'chi ba'i dus na byung ba ni 'chi ba'i dus kyi srid pa'o //üîΩbar du byung ba ni bar ma do'i srid pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi dus na byung ba ni sngon gyi dus kyi srid pa'o // 'chi ba'i dus na byung ba ni 'chi ba'i dus kyi srid pa'o // bar du byung ba ni bar ma do'i srid pa'o //
translated: The arising of the future is in the future time period.üîΩThe arising of the future is in the future time period.üîΩThe arising of the past is in the past time period.üîΩThe arising of the present is in the present time period.üîΩThe arising of the future is in the future time period.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i dus na byung ba ni skye ba'i srid pa'o //üîΩji ltar na ma byung ba /
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i dus na byung ba ni skye ba'i srid pa'o // ji ltar na ma byung ba /
translated: The arising of the past is in the past time period.üîΩThe arising of the present is in the present time period.üîΩThe arising of the future is in the future time period.

original: ma byung ba rnams ni du /
analyzed: ma byung ba rnams ni du /
translated: The arising of the past is in the past time period.üîΩThe arising of the present is in the present time period.üîΩThe arising of the future is in the future time period.üîΩThe arising of the past is in the past time period.üîΩThe arising of the present is in the present time period.üîΩThe arising of the future is in the future time period.üîΩThe arising of the past is in the past time period.üîΩThe arising of the present is in the present time period.üîΩThe arising of the future is in the future time period.üîΩThe arising of the past is in the past time period.üîΩThe arising of the present is in the present time period.üîΩThe arising of the future is in the future time period.üîΩThe arising of the past is in the past time period.üîΩThe arising of the present is in the present time period.üîΩThe arising of the future is in the future time period.üîΩThe arising of the past is in the past time period.üîΩThe arising of the present is in the present time period.üîΩThe arising of the future is in the future time period.üîΩThe arising of the past is in the past time period.üîΩThe arising of the present is in the present time period.üîΩThe arising of the future is in the future time period.üîΩThe arising of the past is in the past time period.üîΩThe arising of the present is in the present time period.üîΩThe arising of the future is in the future time period.

original: ci'i phyir ma byung bar brtag / ma 'ongs pa dang / 'dus ma byas ni ma byung bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma byung bar brtag / ma 'ongs pa dang / 'dus ma byas ni ma byung bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The arising of the past is in the past time period.

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: The arising of the present is in

original: bdag ther zug tu mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag ther zug tu mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: with the aim of abandoning attachment to a permanent self.

original: yang byung ba las bzlog pa ni ma byung bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang byung ba las bzlog pa ni ma byung bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Non-arising should be understood as the opposite of arising.

original: ji ltar na 'dzin pa /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'dzin pa /
translated: What is grasping?

original: 'dzin pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: 'dzin pa rnams ni du /
translated: How many are grasping?üîΩWith what aim is grasping investigated?

original: ci'i phyir 'dzin par brtag / dbang po'i gzugs can dang / sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni 'dzin par blta bar bya'o //üîΩphung po gsum dang / gzugs dang / 'du byed kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig dang / dbang po'i mtshan nyid dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i mtshan nyid la go rims so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dzin par brtag / dbang po'i gzugs can dang / sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni 'dzin par blta bar bya'o // phung po gsum dang / gzugs dang / 'du byed kyi phung po'i phyogs gcig dang / dbang po'i mtshan nyid dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i mtshan nyid la go rims so //
translated: Grasping should be understood as the material sense-faculties, the mind and mental activities.

original: khams bcu gnyis dang / skye mched drug dang / chos kyi khams dang / skye mched kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: khams bcu gnyis dang / skye mched drug dang / chos kyi khams dang / skye mched kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: Three aggregates, one part of the aggregates of matter and formations, twelve elements, six spheres, and one part of the element and the sphere of mental objects.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The same as the preceding.

original: bdag za ba por mngon bar zhen pa spang pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag za ba por mngon bar zhen pa spang pa'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self which is an enjoyer.

original: zab po ni 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa'i yul rnams dmigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zab po ni 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa'i yul rnams dmigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The profound is to be known as the object of desire and the object of non-desire.

original: yang ma phrad pa dang / phrad nas 'dzin pa dang / da ltar gyi rang gi mtshan nyid so sor 'dzin pa dang / rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du thams cad pa'i yul thams cad 'dzin pa yang 'dzin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang ma phrad pa dang / phrad nas 'dzin pa dang / da ltar gyi rang gi mtshan nyid so sor 'dzin pa dang / rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du thams cad pa'i yul thams cad 'dzin pa yang 'dzin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the non-contacting apprehension, the contacting apprehension, the apprehension of the present individual characteristics, and the apprehension of all objects as both individual and universal characteristics should be understood as the apprehension of objects.

original: de la ma phrad par 'dzin pa ni mig dang / rna ba dang / yid do //
analyzed: de la ma phrad par 'dzin pa ni mig dang / rna ba dang / yid do //
translated: Among them, the non-contacting apprehension is the eye, ear, and mind.

original: phrad par 'dzin pa ni de las gzhan pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: phrad par 'dzin pa ni de las gzhan pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: The contacting apprehension is the other sense faculties.

original: da ltar gyi rang gi mtshan nyid so so ba yul so sor nges par 'dzin pa ni /
analyzed: da ltar gyi rang gi mtshan nyid so so ba yul so sor nges par 'dzin pa ni /
translated: The apprehension of the present individual characteristics, with each object being determined individually,

original: dbang po lnga las byung ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po lnga las byung ba'o //
translated: arises from the five sense faculties.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dus thams cad pa'i yul thams cad 'dzin pa ni /
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dus thams cad pa'i yul thams cad 'dzin pa ni /
translated: The apprehension of all objects in all times as both individual and universal characteristics

original: dbang po drug las byung ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po drug las byung ba'o //
translated: arises from the six sense faculties.

original: tshogs rnams par shes pa 'byung ba'i phyir brtags pa can yang 'dzin par bshad par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshogs rnams par shes pa 'byung ba'i phyir brtags pa can yang 'dzin par bshad par blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the designation of the apprehender is also made in this way, because the collection of the aggregates is the cause of the arising of consciousness.

original: rkyen tshogs na rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'i dbang du byas te /üîΩbrtags nas 'dzin @151a * //
analyzed: rkyen tshogs na rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'i dbang du byas te / brtags nas 'dzin @151a * //
translated: The designation of the apprehender is made in terms of the arising of consciousness when the conditions are assembled.

original: pa nye bar 'dogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: pa nye bar 'dogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the designation of the apprehender is made in terms of the arising of consciousness when the conditions are assembled.

original: yang dag pa'i don du na chos rnams byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩji ltar na gzung ba /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don du na chos rnams byed pa med pa'i phyir ro // ji ltar na gzung ba /
translated: In reality, there is no apprehender, because phenomena are devoid of activity.üîΩHow many are the apprehended?

original: gzung ba rnams ni du /
analyzed: gzung ba rnams ni du /
translated: How many are the apprehender?

original: ci'i phyir gzung ba brtag /'dzin pa gang yin pa gzung ba'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzung ba brtag /'dzin pa gang yin pa gzung ba'ang de bzhin no //
translated: The apprehended and the apprehender should be investigated for the same reason, that is, in order to abandon attachment to a high status of the self.

original: mig la sogs pa yang yid kyi rnam par shes pas 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa yang yid kyi rnam par shes pas 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The eye, etc., are also apprehended by the mental consciousness.

original: gzung ba yin la 'dzin pa ma yin pa yang yod do //
analyzed: gzung ba yin la 'dzin pa ma yin pa yang yod do //
translated: There is an apprehended that is not an apprehender.

original: 'dzin pa'i spyod yul gyi don no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i spyod yul gyi don no //
translated: The object that is the domain of the apprehender.

original: 'dzin pa'i spyod yul nyid ces bya ba nges par gzung ba ni /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i spyod yul nyid ces bya ba nges par gzung ba ni /
translated: The specification ‚Äúthat is the domain of the apprehender‚Äù is made

original: sems las byung ba bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems las byung ba bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to exclude mental factors.

original: bdag la thams cad yul du mngon par zhen pa spang pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la thams cad yul du mngon par zhen pa spang pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to abandon attachment to the self as the object of all.

original: ji ltar na phyi rol du bltas pa /
analyzed: ji ltar na phyi rol du bltas pa /
translated: What is the internal?

original: phyi rol du bltas pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: phyi rol du bltas pa rnams ni du /
translated: How many are internal?üîΩWith what aim is that which is internal investigated?

original: ci'i phyir phyi rol du bltas par brtag / sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / de'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pas yongs su bsdus pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams ma gtogs par 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: ci'i phyir phyi rol du bltas par brtag / sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / de'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pas yongs su bsdus pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams ma gtogs par 'dod pa dang /
translated: That which is internal should be understood as the mind and mental activities included in the personal series, and as the form included in the personal series, which is the basis of the mind and mental activities.

original: rab tu ldan pa ni phyi rol du bltas pa yin no //üîΩthos pa dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / de'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pas yongs su bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: rab tu ldan pa ni phyi rol du bltas pa yin no // thos pa dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / de'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pas yongs su bsdus pa ni /
translated: The internal is that which is associated with the internal sense-sphere.

original: phyi rol du bltas pa ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: phyi rol du bltas pa ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: That which is not internal is the opposite of that.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i chos kyi rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i chos kyi rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not internal because it is the cause of the Dharma which is the cause of the similar Dharma.

original: de'i dbang gis mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa la dmigs par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa la dmigs par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Consequently, the dharmas are considered as the object of the Path of Seeing.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i chos ni sangs rgyas la sogs pas thugs su chud pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i chos ni sangs rgyas la sogs pas thugs su chud pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: The dharmas that are the natural outcome of the Path of Seeing are the Teaching that has arisen from the cause which is the comprehension of the Truths by the Buddhas, etc.

original: khams bzhi dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang / ro'i khams so /
analyzed: khams bzhi dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang / ro'i khams so /
translated: The four elements, the olfactory consciousness element, the odor element, the taste element.

original: skye mched gnyis dang / dri dang ro'i skye mched do //
analyzed: skye mched gnyis dang / dri dang ro'i skye mched do //
translated: Two sense-spheres, the sense-sphere of odor and the sense-sphere of taste.

original: de las gzhan pa rnams kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa rnams kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: One part of the other elements.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: The element of factors is included in the realm of desire.

original: bdag 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin par mngon bar zhen pa spang pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin par mngon bar zhen pa spang pa'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self free from desire.

original: ji ltar na nang du bltas pa /
analyzed: ji ltar na nang du bltas pa /
translated: What is internal?

original: nang du bltas pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: nang du bltas pa rnams ni du /
translated: How many are internal?

original: ci'i phyir nang du bltas bar brtag / phyi rol du bltas pa las bzlog pa ni nang du bltas par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir nang du bltas bar brtag / phyi rol du bltas pa las bzlog pa ni nang du bltas par blta bar bya'o //
translated: With what aim is that which is internal investigated? That which is internal should be understood as the opposite of that which is external.

original: khams bzhi dang / skye mched gnyis ma @151b gtogs par de las gzhan pa dag gi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: khams bzhi dang / skye mched gnyis ma @151b gtogs par de las gzhan pa dag gi phyogs gcig go //
translated: with the exception of the four elements and two spheres, a part of the rest.

original: bdag la 'dod chags dang bral bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //üîΩji ltar na nyon mongs pa can /
analyzed: bdag la 'dod chags dang bral bar mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar na nyon mongs pa can /
translated: with the aim of abandoning attachment to a self free from craving.üîΩWhat is defiled?

original: nyon mongs pa can ni du /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ni du /
translated: How many are defiled?üîΩWith what aim is that which is defiled investigated?

original: ci'i phyir nyon mongs pa can du brtag / mi dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni nyon mongs pa can du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir nyon mongs pa can du brtag / mi dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni nyon mongs pa can du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The unwholesome and the obscurednondefined are defiled.

original: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni kun du 'gro ba'i yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni kun du 'gro ba'i yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
translated: The obscurednondefined is the innate afflicted view of self and the extreme, associated with the universal mental factors, and associated with form and the formless.

original: phung po rnams dang / khams bcu dang / skye mched bzhi'i phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: phung po rnams dang / khams bcu dang / skye mched bzhi'i phyogs gcig go //
translated: It consists of the aggregates, ten elements, four spheres,üîΩand a part of the element and the sphere of mental objects.

original: khams bcu zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khams bcu zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Ten elements, namely:

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams bdun dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / chos kyi khams so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams bdun dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / chos kyi khams so //
translated: the seven elements of consciousness, the element of form, the element of sound, and the element of mental objects.

original: skye mched bzhi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skye mched bzhi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Four sense-spheres:

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / yid dang / chos kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / yid dang / chos kyi skye mched do //
translated: the sense-sphere of form, the sense-sphere of sound, the sense-sphere of the mental faculty, and the sense-sphere of mental objects.

original: bdag nyon mongs pa dang / ldan par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyon mongs pa dang / ldan par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: with the aim of abandoning attachment to a self endowed with defilement.

original: ji ltar nyon mongs pa can ma yin /
analyzed: ji ltar nyon mongs pa can ma yin /
translated: What is not defiled?

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnams ni du /
translated: How many are not defiled?üîΩWith what aim is that which is not defiled investigated?

original: ci'i phyir nyon mongs pa can ma yin par brtag / dge ba dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir nyon mongs pa can ma yin par brtag / dge ba dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The wholesome and the unobscured-non-defined should be understood as not defiled.

original: khams brgyad dang / skye mched brgyad dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched lhag ma rnams kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: khams brgyad dang / skye mched brgyad dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched lhag ma rnams kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: Eight elements, eight sense-spheres, part of the aggregates, elements and sense-spheres that remain.

original: bdag nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i mngon bar zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //üîΩji ltar na 'das pa /
analyzed: bdag nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i mngon bar zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar na 'das pa /
translated: with the aim of abandoning attachment to a self devoid of defilement.üîΩWhat is past?

original: 'das pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: 'das pa rnams ni du /
translated: How many are past?

original: ci'i phyir 'das par brtag / byung ba ni 'gags pa rang gi mtshan nyid dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu spyad zin pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar byed pa yang dag par shin du 'das pa dang / rgyu yongs su bzung nas zhig pa dang /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'das par brtag / byung ba ni 'gags pa rang gi mtshan nyid dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu spyad zin pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar byed pa yang dag par shin du 'das pa dang / rgyu yongs su bzung nas zhig pa dang /
translated: The past should be seen as having the characteristic of having arisen and ceased, as having already experienced cause and effect, as having completely transcended the process of affliction and purification, as having perished after having taken up a cause,
