original: 'bras bu dang / rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa dang / med pa dang / dran pa'i kun du rtog pa'i mtshan ma dang / ltos pas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma dang / btang snyoms kyi rnam par byang ba'i mtshan ma yin pas kyang 'das par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang / rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa dang / med pa dang / dran pa'i kun du rtog pa'i mtshan ma dang / ltos pas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma dang / btang snyoms kyi rnam par byang ba'i mtshan ma yin pas kyang 'das par blta bar bya'o //
translated: as having the existence and non-existence of its own characteristic, as the sign of conceptualization through memory, as the sign of affliction through dependence, and as the sign of purification through equanimity.

original: de la rgyu dang 'bras bu spyad zin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la rgyu dang 'bras bu spyad zin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, ‚Äúhaving already experienced cause and effect‚Äù means

original: skyes zin pa dang / 'gags zin pa'i phyir te go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: skyes zin pa dang / 'gags zin pa'i phyir te go rims bzhin no //
translated: having already arisen and having already ceased, respectively.

original: @152a * // kun nas nyon mongs dang rnam par byang bar byed pa shin du 'das pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: @152a * // kun nas nyon mongs dang rnam par byang bar byed pa shin du 'das pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúHaving completely transcended the process of affliction and purification‚Äù means

original: da ltar byung ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa bzhin du sems kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar byed pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa bzhin du sems kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar byed pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not have the power to defile or purify the mind, like present passion and so on, and faith and so on.

original: rgyu yongs su bzung nas zhig pa zhes bya ba ni bag chags gzhan nas zhig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu yongs su bzung nas zhig pa zhes bya ba ni bag chags gzhan nas zhig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving taken up a cause, it is destroyed‚Äù means that it is destroyed by the arising of another latent impression.

original: 'bras bu dang / rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa dang / med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang / rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa dang / med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe existence and non-existence of a result and its own nature‚Äù means that

original: da ltar gyi dus na des bskyed pa'i bag chags yod pa dang / de 'jog par byed pa'i rdzas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus na des bskyed pa'i bag chags yod pa dang / de 'jog par byed pa'i rdzas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: in the present time, the latent impression that it produces exists, but the substance that establishes it does not exist.

original: dran pa'i kun du rtog pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma ni dmigs pa tsam du yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa'i kun du rtog pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma ni dmigs pa tsam du yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: The signs of memory, imagination, and so on should be understood as existing merely as objects.

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: It is a part of all.

original: ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / 'dus ma byas ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / 'dus ma byas ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: It is everything except the future, the present, and the unconditioned.

original: bdag 'jug par byed par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag 'jug par byed par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: with the aim of abandoning attachment to a self which engages in action.

original: ji ltar na ma 'ongs pa dang / ma 'ongs pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: ji ltar na ma 'ongs pa dang / ma 'ongs pa rnams ni du /
translated: How should the future be understood? How many are future?

original: ci'i phyir ma 'ongs par brtag //
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma 'ongs par brtag //
translated: With what aim is the future investigated?

original: rgyu yod kyang ma byung ba dang / rang gi mtshan nyid ma thob pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu ma spyad pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i dngos po nye bar dmigs pa dang / rgyu dang / rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa dang med pa dang /
analyzed: rgyu yod kyang ma byung ba dang / rang gi mtshan nyid ma thob pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu ma spyad pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i dngos po nye bar dmigs pa dang / rgyu dang / rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa dang med pa dang /
translated: The future should be understood as having a cause, as not having occurred, as not having attained its own character, as not having entered into the effect-result, as the apprehension of the entity of defilement and purification, as having a cause and as not having it,

original: mngon par dga' bas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma dang / mngon par dga' ba med pas rnam par byang ba'i mtshan mas kyang ma 'ongs par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par dga' bas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma dang / mngon par dga' ba med pas rnam par byang ba'i mtshan mas kyang ma 'ongs par blta bar bya'o //
translated: as the sign of defilement through delight, and as the sign of purification through non-delight.

original: de la rgyu yod kyang ma byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas las bye brag tu dbye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la rgyu yod kyang ma byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas las bye brag tu dbye ba'i phyir te /
translated: Therein, having a cause and not having occurred is a special designation for the unconditioned.

original: de ni ma byung ba la rgyu dang ldan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni ma byung ba la rgyu dang ldan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: For that which has not occurred does not have a cause.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ma thob pa ni rang bzhin ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ma thob pa ni rang bzhin ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has not acquired its own characteristic, since its intrinsic nature is not established.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu ma spyad pa ni de'i sa bon gyi bya ba ma byas pa dang / de la ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu ma spyad pa ni de'i sa bon gyi bya ba ma byas pa dang / de la ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has not yet performed its function as cause and effect, since it has not yet performed the action of its seed and has not yet arisen in that.

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: It is a part of all.

original: bdag 'jug par byed par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag 'jug par byed par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self which engages in action.

original: ji ltar na da ltar byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar na da ltar byung ba /
translated: What is the present?

original: da ltar byung ba rnams ni du /üîΩci'i phyir da ltar byung bar brtag / byung ba ma 'gags pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu spyad zin pa dang / spyad ma zin pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam @152b bar byang ba'i byed pa nye bar gnas pa dang /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba rnams ni du / ci'i phyir da ltar byung bar brtag / byung ba ma 'gags pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu spyad zin pa dang / spyad ma zin pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam @152b bar byang ba'i byed pa nye bar gnas pa dang /
translated: How many are present?üîΩWith what aim is the present investigated? The present should be understood as having the characteristic of that which has arisen and not yet ceased, as having the function of the experience of cause and effect, whether or not it has been experienced, as the basis of the manifestation of defilement and purification,

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs par rab tu gzhag pa'i rgyu dang / byed pa nye bar gnas pas kyang da ltar byung bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs par rab tu gzhag pa'i rgyu dang / byed pa nye bar gnas pas kyang da ltar byung bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: and as the cause of the designation of past and future, by reason of the presence of action.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu spyad zin pa dang / spyad ma zin pa zhes bya ba ni yang mi 'grub pa dang / yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rab tu bzhag pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba la brten te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu spyad zin pa dang / spyad ma zin pa zhes bya ba ni yang mi 'grub pa dang / yod pa'i phyir ro // 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rab tu bzhag pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba la brten te /
translated: The past and future are established as having the nature of cause and effect that have been used up and not yet used up, respectively, because they exist.üîΩThe cause of the establishment of the past and future is the present.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa brtags pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa brtags pa'i phyir te /
translated: The past and future are imputed in dependence on the present.

original: gang de'i gnas skabs thob par 'gyur ba de ni ma 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: gang de'i gnas skabs thob par 'gyur ba de ni ma 'ongs pa'o //
translated: That which has not yet attained its own state is the future.

original: gang thob zin pa de ni 'das pa'o //
analyzed: gang thob zin pa de ni 'das pa'o //
translated: That which has already attained it is the past.

original: byed pa nye bar gnas pas kyang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byed pa nye bar gnas pas kyang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The present is established by the presence of activity.

original: mig la sogs pa ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The eye and so on are consciousness.

original: gnas la sogs pa ni yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas la sogs pa ni yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The abode and so on are the sense faculties.

original: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: They are part of all.

original: bdag 'jug par byed par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag 'jug par byed par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to abandon attachment to the self as an agent.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa bshad pa'i skabs kyis 'di yang ston te /
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa bshad pa'i skabs kyis 'di yang ston te /
translated: This is also taught by the context of the explanation of the past and so on.

original: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'das pa la sogs pa ni gsum po nyid gtam gyi gzhi rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'das pa la sogs pa ni gsum po nyid gtam gyi gzhi rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Why did the Lord establish the three times, past, etc., as the basis of discourse?

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba ni gtam gyi gzhi yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba ni gtam gyi gzhi yin no //
translated: The past, future, and present are the basis of discourse.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Nirvana is not,

original: so so rang gis rig par bya ba dang / brjod du med pa nyid dang / byung ba dang 'byung ba dang / da ltar gyi tha snyad kyi gnas ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so rang gis rig par bya ba dang / brjod du med pa nyid dang / byung ba dang 'byung ba dang / da ltar gyi tha snyad kyi gnas ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is to be personally experienced, because it is inexpressible, and because it is not the basis of the conventions of origination, origination, and present.

original: ci'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin /
translated: Why is nirvana not the basis of discourse?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni so so rang gis rig par bya ba dang / brjod du med pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni so so rang gis rig par bya ba dang / brjod du med pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: Nirvana is not the basis of discourse because it is to be personally experienced and because it is inexpressible.

original: ji ltar yang brjod par mi nus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar yang brjod par mi nus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it cannot be expressed in any way.

original: byung ba dang 'byung ba dang da ltar gyi mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i tha snyad rnams kyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byung ba dang 'byung ba dang da ltar gyi mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i tha snyad rnams kyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the basis of the conventional expressions of the past, future, and present, of what is seen, heard, distinguished, and cognized.üîΩHow should wholesome be understood?

original: ji ltar na dge ba /üîΩdge ba rnams ni du /üîΩci'i phyir dge bar brtag / ngo bo nyid dang / 'brel pa dang / rjes su 'brel pa dang / slong pa dang / don dam pa dang / skye bas thob pa dang / sbyor ba dang / mdun du byas pa dang / phan 'dogs pa dang /üîΩyongs su 'dzin pa dang / gnyen po dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / rgyu mthun pas kyang dge bar blta bar @153a * //üîΩbya'o // phung po rnams dang / khams bcu dang / skye mchad bzhi'i phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: ji ltar na dge ba / dge ba rnams ni du / ci'i phyir dge bar brtag / ngo bo nyid dang / 'brel pa dang / rjes su 'brel pa dang / slong pa dang / don dam pa dang / skye bas thob pa dang / sbyor ba dang / mdun du byas pa dang / phan 'dogs pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gnyen po dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / rgyu mthun pas kyang dge bar blta bar @153a * // bya'o // phung po rnams dang / khams bcu dang / skye mchad bzhi'i phyogs gcig go //
translated: How many are wholesome?üîΩFor what reason is that which is wholesome investigated?

original: de la khams bcu zhes bya ba ni /üîΩrnam par shes pa'i khams rnams dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / chos kyi khams so //
analyzed: de la khams bcu zhes bya ba ni /üîΩrnam par shes pa'i khams rnams dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / chos kyi khams so //
translated: Wholesome should be understood as having the nature of roots, as being related to roots, as being related to that which arises from roots, as being related to roots and that which arises from roots, as being related to the wholesome, as being related to that which arises from the wholesome, as being related to the wholesome and that which arises from the wholesome, as being related to roots, the wholesome, and that which arises from the wholesome, as being related to the ultimate, as being related to that obtained through preparatory effort, as being related to that obtained by the power of causes, as being related to that obtained by the power of application, as being related to that which is helpful, as being related to that which is not helpful, as being related to that which is both helpful and not helpful, as being related to that which is neither helpful nor not helpful, as being related to that which is to be abandoned by vision, as being related to that which is to be abandoned by cultivation, as being related to that which is to be abandoned neither by vision nor by cultivation, as being related to that which is to be abandoned by vision, as being related to that calm nor not calm, as being related to the

original: skye mched bzhi zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / yid dang / chos kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: skye mched bzhi zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / yid dang / chos kyi skye mched do //
translated: The four sense-spheres are the sense-spheres of visible form, sound, mental object, and the non-defined factors.

original: bdag chos dang ldan par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag chos dang ldan par mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: With the aim of abandoning attachment to a self endowed with qualities.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis dge ba gang /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis dge ba gang /
translated: What is wholesome by nature?

original: dad pa la sogs pa sems las byung ba'i chos bcu gcig go //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa sems las byung ba'i chos bcu gcig go //
translated: It consists of eleven factors, such as faith, which are wholesome thought-concomitants.

original: 'brel bas dge ba gang /
analyzed: 'brel bas dge ba gang /
translated: What is wholesome through association?

original: dad pa la sogs pa de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: It consists of the factors associated with the eleven wholesome thought-concomitants, such as faith.

original: rjes su 'brel bas dge ba gang /üîΩde dag nyid kyi bag chags gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'brel bas dge ba gang / de dag nyid kyi bag chags gang yin pa'o //
translated: What is wholesome through its original nature?üîΩIt consists of the permeations of the above-mentioned wholesome factors.

original: slong bas dge ba gang /
analyzed: slong bas dge ba gang /
translated: What is wholesome through acquisition?

original: de kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi las so //
analyzed: de kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi las so //
translated: It consists of the actions of body and speech which are produced by the wholesome thought-concomitants.

original: don dam pas dge ba gang /
analyzed: don dam pas dge ba gang /
translated: What is wholesome through its intrinsic meaning?

original: de bzhin nyid do //üîΩskye bas thob pas dge ba gang /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid do // skye bas thob pas dge ba gang /
translated: It consists of Suchness.üîΩWhat is wholesome through its following?

original: dge ba'i chos 'di dag nyid sngon goms par byas pa la brten nas /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos 'di dag nyid sngon goms par byas pa la brten nas /
translated: It consists of the wholesome factors themselves, on the basis of which one acquires the wholesome factors.
